Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: SilverFang13
Reviews.Content: Hotel River Palace ++++ +Great location, 1min to Via Del Corso, where Piazza Del Popolo is. +Nice and clean room. +Air condition, personal lock case, fridgerator, tv. +2 toilets, maybe one is for the kids. +Breakfast. -Small room and bathroom, but clean. +/- We stayed at the top floor (8th) so we didnt heard any sound from the street, but its barely any traffic outside the hotel. The elevator take you to the first floor and the rest you have to take another elevator to take you up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Karamellisade
Reviews.Content: Location is great, service was excellent - perhaps the best I´ve ever faced. Rooms were clean and beds comfy. Lots of choices in breakfast (even champagne!). We will defintely come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel at the entrance of the Piazza del Popolo”
Reviews.Author: Hayjayhay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the River Palace, and am so glad I did. The reviews I had read previous to me booking, were dead on. The only negative at all, was the size of the standard rooms. We were upgraded so the room we had was above average size for Rome standards. They're very tiny, but lovely. Then again, how much time do you spend in your room while in Rome?? I can't say enough about the staff and the service we received - it was exceptional. Besides being on a cruise ship, there aren't that many hotels I've been to in the past the offered the same service. The hotel rooms are relatively small (as are most in Rome), but very lovely, with a very cozy decor. It's not cheap, but hotels which are dumps, sell for very little less. The breakfast was called continental but this was the best by far I have ever had. Good variety and great service again. The location of the hotel is perfect!!! You step out of the front door, hang a right and just walk. You're in the main area of Rome, all the shopping is right there and you can reach the Spanish Steps. Great to just hang out. The variety of the restaurants nearby is great. Will definitely go back here in the future. Also, you're a 2 minute walk to the underground metro....sooo easy to use and will take you anywhere...we were at the Vatican in less than 20 minutes, including a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice base for a trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Inga27
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at River Palace Hotel in March and had a great stay. We were welcomed by the very nice receptionist. She gave as map of Rome and explained how to find our way to the major sights. We were also very happy to receive a free room upgrade! The overall atmosphere was very nice with a lot of nice decorations everywhere, giving it a nice "Rome feeling". The room was very clean, nicely decorated and comfy! Service was great throughout the hotel. At the first evening we found a complimentary bottle of wine in our room. Furthermore, chocolates and weather forecast were put on our pillows each evening. Really nice. Breakfast was also very good with good choice of freshly prepared and tasty food.. The hotel is centrally located at Piazza del Popolo, allowing to explore Rome by foot. A metro stop is also very close and you can get to the airport easily by metro and Leonardo Express. We would definitely return to this hotel!There was absolutely nothing to complain about!!! This hotel provides very high value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: lrf83
Reviews.Content: River Palace is a well located boutique hotel - close to the Piazza del Populo, Metro and easy walking distance to the Spanish steps and great shopping and restaurants. The rooms, though on the smallish side, are roomy enough, very comfortable and well appointed with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. The staff was incredibly helpful - especially Francesco who went above and beyond to help us secure tickets for a specific time to the Borghese Gallery. Another person on staff was incredibly helpful securing dinner reservations for 10 people. The breakfast is fantastic with so many choices we didn't eat the same thing in 4 days. The bar is also great with free food at happy hour. I highly recommend the River Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Avi A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January with my wife and had a great time! The room was very clean, the breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful! helped us with every question and on any situation (recommendation on "Roma pass", places to visit, printed our eTickets and much much more) - we felt like a family (took pictures with the hotel staff!) The hotel is well designed - looks new. As we see it, this hotel is a boutique hotel and it's prices are relativity cheep! Located near Via Del Corso - 50 meters from Piazza Di Pa polo. Their standard room is small so be prepared but the room is well equipped - every night you get tomorrow forecast with some chocolates..

Reviews.Title: “Second year in a row!”
Reviews.Author: JSimmons8172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace in April of 2011 and we enjoyed it and the city of Rome so much that we returned again this year. We spent a very enjoyable 6 days there. We loved our room and felt the staff was responsive to all our needs. We especially like the location close to Piazzo Popolo. The Metro was a few yards away and it was within walking distance to many of Rome's finest sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Michw7
Reviews.Content: River Palace Hotel is a quaint hotel just outside Piazza Del Popolo. Rooms were small but cozy. Staff was also friendly and very helpful. A generous breakfast buffet was served daily. No room service fyi. Great half price happy hour. This was a business trip mixed with a few days of pleasure. This hotel seemed centrally located. Subway was near and easy access to the must see sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “True gem”
Reviews.Author: Eternal_Wanderluster
Reviews.Content: This isn't luxurious in the Ritz Carlton sense but it was quaint, beautiful and perfectly located. It was tucked away from the loud throngs of tourists, but a very easy walk to get to many of the main attractions or a 5 minute walk to the metro. PROS: - Location - Safety - Cleanliness - High quality breakfast (available for 4 1/2 hours) - Quaint rooms - English speaking news channels - Free WiFi - In-room safe - Helpful and extremely nice English speaking staff CONS: - Thin walls - Small shower When I travel I'm always concerned that my hotel won't be close to or in the middle of everything. River Palace is in a safe, premier location. When I go back to Rome, there will be no question where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsdianam
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the River Palace hotel having taken my Mum as a 60th birthday surpise. The hotel is absolutely fantastic, a two minute walk from Flaminio Metro station and a pleasant five minute walk from the main shopping street Via Del Corso. All of the main attractions are so easy to get to from the hotel. The hotel issued a map on arrival and we walked to most of the sights! The room was lovely, two great big apples on arrival followed by chocolates on the pillow each day and a hand written weather prediction for the following day. The room was lovely - not huge but definately not small as other rooms suggest - it was just right for a city break. The bathroom was very nice, slippers, robes and hair dryer provided. Breakfast was fantastic - full English or continental breakfast provided. Full range of fruits, yoghurts, pastries, cereals, breads,biscuits, juices, tea and coffee, sparkling wine. (Every type of tea seemed to be available) We actually didn't need lunch as we made th most of the breakfasts! The staff were friendly, efficient and couldn't seem to do enough for us! Another bonus is the bar is halfprice to guests from 6pm - 10pm. Baileys 2Euros, wine 3Euros, huge cocktails 5Euros. Fantastic experience and would definately stay at the River Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gibby W
Reviews.Content: I was torn between 2 or 3 hotels for this trip and am pleased to say I picked a good one in the River Palace. We had never been to Rome before and after reading reports were a wee bit apprehensive. We landed in Rome around 20.30 on Sunday 18th Mar and caught a taxi at the airport to the hotel no complaints but taxi kept the meter on level 2 all the way in even although we were only 100 yards out of the boundary. Arrived at the hotel 21.40 check in spot on and shown to the room 102 and were also shown the quirky lift set up. As most other reports have said the rooms are not the largest in the world but did have the basics of hair dryer and fridge with mini bar. Bathroom could have been a bit bigger but was ample. We went down to the bar to finish off their happy hour and were surprised to see the area full of my countrymen who had been at the rugby still there (Celtic tops and Kilts and Rugby don't go together). Breakfast was of good quality with the usual choices of yoghurt and fruit along with pastries etc, you could also have a hot breakfast with scrambled eggs / boiled eggs ,bacon, sausages potato cakes(hash browns) along with tea coffee and juice. Reception were very helpful in advising how to get to where we were going each day. There is a tram stop 100 yards from the hotel and the metro is about 30 yards further. We never bothered with getting different passes and the Vatican is 2 stops away in 1 direction with Spanish Steps 1 stop in the other. The Metro system is easy to follow and costs 1 Euro per journey within 75 minutes which makes everything well within reach. We did not encounter any problems with pocket dippers but were always on the alert for them. There are a few places to eat along the street from the hotel and even the standard Burger King but go a 5 minute walk through the Piazza and there are more places to eat. The walk from the hotel to any of the sites is easy to do with I would say an exception of the Colloseum which I would do by Metro. All in I would say this is a very good hotel to base yourself in and I would have no problem in saying to people to go there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elfbearduck
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned after an 8 night stay at the palace in their Villa Borghese suite. From the moment we walked in we knew we had made the right decision. The room was spotless, the terrace a beautiful place to sit and have our complimentary welcome bottle of wine, which was unexpected but so appreciated. The decor is wonderful, but the staff are certainly what made the stay so great. They all take the time to say hello and ask how you are, and it's quite genuine. We didn't figure out until the fourth night about happy hour, all I can say is take advantage of it! The drinks are all very reasonably priced and the bartenders make quality drinks. The location is perfect, half a block north of Piazza del Popolo. We were able to walk everywhere, but if you need to get somewhere fast the metro is literally just down the street. I did a lot of research to find a hotel in Rome to suit our needs and of course budget. After staying at the River Palace I almost feel like we paid too little for the level of service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat to Rome”
Reviews.Author: suen81
Reviews.Content: M daughter and I just spent 4 nights in a twin superior room, floor 4, at this hotel and had a wonderful time. Our room was perfect, the Staff so friendly and helpful and we highly reccommend this hotel.The breakfasts are amazing and the "Happy Hour" is a relaxing and inexpensive way to unwind and swap experiences with other guests before going out for dinner. Would reccommend the Hostaria-Pizzeria All'Orsetto opposite the hotel entrance to the right - No 14 Via Flaminia. The food was excellent, inexpensive and the restaurant is so convenient after a long day sightseeing. Location of hotel is great, away from the city centre but the Metro is so close, also easy walking distance to most sights if you choose to walk. For shopping, Via Del Corso is good and is a short walk through Piazza Del Popolo. If ordering a taxi from hotel agree fare in advance. On our departure day there was a Metro strike so the Concierge ordered us a taxi to Termini Station to catch the train to airport. The taxi driver was most unpleasant and charged us 16 Euros for a trip, he admitted, was maximum 6 Euros. We had no option but to pay. I have advised the hotel of this incident, it is no fault of theirs, but to alert them of the service? being provided by this taxi company. We had a wonderful visit to Rome, despite getting lost on several occasions - all good fun - and finding it very expesive. Our visit, however, was made enjoyable and memorable by having such lovely accomodation to return to each night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 5* service in a perfect 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: petalo01
Reviews.Content: Simply the perfect combination of service, quality and location in Rome. Everything is made to excede the guest expectation, with great care to detail. An exemple: the breakfast, made to surprise us every morning, with italian delicatessen proposed in a british style service. Location is great to discover the town, easily walking distance fron the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week in Rome and were absolutely delighted with the River Palace Hotel. The location is great. Near the Piazza de Popolo. Metro station is a block away. Twenty-five minute walk to the Colluseum and Vatican. Even less to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and graet shopping. We upgraded our room to a deluxe. We had a very comfortable king size bed. The room was not very large, nor was the shower (which is typical for traditional hotels in Italy) but it is well appointed, very clean and traditional. Our window opened up to a quiet street. The breakfast, which we looked forward to every morning was fabulous! Eggs, meats, delicious cheeses, artichokes, pastries, all kinds of juice, fresh fruits (the kiwis and oranges were amazing), yogurts,cereals and breads. The coffee was delicious and cappucino available if we wanted it, at no extra charge. There is happy hour every night when drinks are half price. The bartender is very generous! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent way to start our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Bvantick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights last August to start off our 10 day honeymoon trip traveling through Italy. The staff was able to accommodate an early check-in for us. We just had to wait for a few minutes in the bar so that could make sure the room was ready. The room was comfortable and clean. The window overlooked the street but it was not a busy street at all. It is located around the corner to the metro station and you can also walk to many major attractions. We were able to get around to everywhere we wanted to go by walking or the metro. I also need to mention the BREAKFAST. It is AMAZING!!! I was looking over other reviews prior to writing this and saw that someone had written that they miss the breakfast and it is definitely true. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Upon checking, they offered us a city map and oriented us to the area and where major attractions were and offered us the wi-fi password without even having to ask. We could not have asked for a more pleasurable experience and for a great price. I would stay at the River Palace Hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trsuyematsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the River Palace. The staff is very professional but friendly and helpful. It was clean, comfortable and a terrific location. We were able to walk to all of the sites although you can hop onto the metro right outside the hotel if you wish. The buffet breakfast was incredible. Fresh fruits and juices, champagne, eggs/sausage, breads, pastries, italian meats/cheeses, etc A wonderful way to start a full day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Terppa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Piazza del Poppolo, so it is very well located. It´s about 100 meters from the Metro station, and very close to the Park Borghese, shopping street Via del Corso and many nice restaurants. Besides the location I can't say enough about the fantastic breakfast with a great variety of choices, including tomato mozzarella salad, Brie cheese, salmon, fresh cut fruits and freshly baked cakes! Rooms are not very spacious, so we would recommend Deluxe room, which also is not very big, but it is big enough..

Reviews.Title: “Can't Really Fault it”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in prime location, Metro and Busses very close by, but all the main tourist sights are easily walkable. Many good restuarants within easy stroll, just ask at reception for suggestions. Stayed three nights with a friend in two 'singles' which were really doubles- very clean and warm and well appointed, not massive but fine by central Rome standards. Bar is good and breakfast could not be berrered, everything you could possibly want available. All staff pleasant and helpful at all times. Not much more to add, as I say - can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “I miss that breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanaStr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, close to Piazza del Poppolo where you can find several good restaurants. It´s also 100 meters from the Metro station. Besides the location I would like to highlight the fantastic breakfast with a great variaty of choices! Unforgettable! The only two cons I would like to talk about is the size of the classic room: it was hard to move around even considering that we had only two medium sized luggages and the price of the garage: 35,00 per night was simply the most expensive rate we had payed in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: We used the River Palace as a base from which to discover Rome during a first time trip to Italy in the first week of February 2012. Staff was friendly from the front desk to the breakfast room and bar (the bar has a 4 hour happy our session and the breakfast selection is something to behold). We even got a nightly chocolate biscuit with the next day's weather forecast. During our stay it was our wedding anniversary and we were treated to a complimentary bottle of wine and hand written note by the manager. My wife was particularly impressed. Upon arrival were were offered an upgraded room for virtually no money at all. The hotel is within walking distance of all major sites (albeit a brisk 15 minutes to the Forum and Colloseum). Check-in and check out was effortless. We only spent 3 nights there before moving on to Florence so we still have a lot of dicovering to do. We will defenitely use this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mother and daugher city break”
Reviews.Author: jr54_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed five nights at this hotel during the recent snow. Very little we can add to the other recent reviews with which we totally agree. Very good value with great service and attention to detail and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The reasonably priced bar with generous range of complimentary snacks was a great find in a city centre hotel in this price range. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oats65
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, just returned after a four night stay, I agree with all the other positve comments: friendly staff, excellent buffet breakfasts with a cooked option, happy hour with a good selection of nibbles, a weather report for the next day with complimentary chocolates, complimentary apples on arrival, it's also in a good location. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: Very pretty hotel inside in a great location in Rome. Metro stop is at the end of the block. Happy hour provides snacks and half-price drinks. Great breakfast buffet with lots of choices. Clean room and nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value !”
Reviews.Author: Martyn W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, in a good location and the happy hour and nibbles are very welcome after a long days walking. Good breakfast too ! friendly approachable staff and good service I would stay here again definately when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: The River Palace was a great choice for our 6 nights in Rome. When researching we were a little concerned that it might be a bit out of the way, but we found it really convenient and walked to all the main attractions. If you prefer the train, the underground station is only a couple minutes walk and costs 1 euro for a 75 minute ticket. There are a lot of hotels around the Termini station, but we felt the Piazza del Popolo area was a lot nicer and we were pleased we chose to stay at that end of town. We paid a little extra for an upgrade to a superior room, which was very comfortable, with a bit more space for relaxing and keeping bags. Two things made River Palace stand out. Firstly was the excellent included breakfast. It had the full range of hot and cold foods, including eggs, bacon, cooked mushrooms, smoked salmon etc. It was so filling we rarely felt like lunch! We have had some great breakfast buffets, but this one stood out. The other really enjoyable thing was the half price happy hour between 6 and 10 pm. We rarely drink cocktails, but enjoyed one or two each night. A very nice way to relax after a full day and there is so much to see in Rome, every day is a full day. The only slight niggles we had were that the plumbing needed a bit of work, as the shower head was droopy and the sink and bath drains were both very slow. Also, unless you get a room on the first floor, you need to use two lifts, with the changeover at opposite ends of the first floor. A slight inconvenience, but nothing you can't live with. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matusevic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly well located for transport, the staff are super helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable (maybe a little small but that's not a problem). The free wireless is a god send in Rome as every other Rome hotel I've stayed in has charged significantly more for the wireless and it's never that strong whereas here I had a great signal. Breakfast is a good spread and while you wouldn't class it as fantastic, there's plenty of variety and the staff are attentive, and the room is kept spotless. The bar area always seems a bit empty and to be honest, it's not somewhere I'd want to hang out late in the evening and there's no room service so you'll have to venture out for food. Great if you're a tourist, not so helpful if you're on business and are working late and just need a quick meal while at your laptop. I've stayed in Rome a number of times, and for a business hotel at a reasonable price, the River Palace is the best I've stayed at in about ten visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: boboangel7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace Hotel in February 2012. We stayed for four nights in a deluxe room and had a fantastic time. The bed was very large and very comfortable, the pillows were amazing! The rooms and the hotel in general were kept spotless at all times. The breakfast in the hotel was extensive-there really was something for everyone from cooked food to meats, cheeses, cereals and pastries. The bar at night time has happy hour between 6pm and 10pm. We tried some of the cocktails-very strong but the sex on the beach was lovely. The hotel is in a prime location. We walked from the hotel to the Vatican in 15 minutes, the Spanish steps in 15 minutes and the Trevi Fountain in 20 minutes. Piazza del Popolo and Via del Corso are within 3 minutes walk of the hotel so for shopping and food its perfect. There is a restaurant on the same side of the street as the hotel, if you come out of the hotel and turn right its beside the pharmacy. The food was absolutely delicious, extremely cheap and the staff were very friendly. I would definitely recommend you eat here at least once! While in Rome, I was robbed on the metro between Barberini and Republica. The carriage was excessively packed with people and when I got separated from my partner someone saw this as an opportunity to pick-pocket. Unfortunately on our second last day, they stole 450euro-everything we had. I went back to the hotel to report this and to be honest, the staff were not in any way helpful. I understand that in Rome this is a regular occurance but where I am from its not so common and I was very upset. The receptionist told me to go to the 'carabineri' in the sqaure nearby and report to them. When I did, they sent me to a police station which was closed. Back to the carabineri who couldnt speak english and they then sent us on a wild goose chase for a police station. After 4 and a half hours of walking around rome on a saturday night we found that no one was willing to help us; not the hotel, not the carabineri and not the police. The next morning I reported it again to the hotel and the told me to speak to the police, even though I had already told them of the ordeal the night before. I do think that the hotel could have done more for us in this upsetting situtation. I know pick-pocketing is rampant in Rome but when it happens to you, and on such a large scale, you expect alot more from people than what we had. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that the staff were not helpful when I was in this situation. Please at all times keep your hand on your handbag, even if it is at the front of you. Also split your money up between the group because they are so good at what they do. You never thing its going to happen to you so please be very careful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly Hotel, ideally situated for the Metro”
Reviews.Author: mistypie
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel, we were offered an upgrade when we got there but declined, the room was very clean but small as we were out most of the day so the size didn't matter, the bed was very comfortable and the room was lovely and warm, we will definintely return to this hotel again as we didn't see everything due to the snow we had. The breakfast was excellent, staff very helpful and polite, half price bar 6-10pm with complimentary sandwiches,nibbles etc. It's near Piazza de Popolo, 5 minutes from the main shopping street. If you don't mind walking everthing is in walking distance otherwise the Metro is on the door step 1 euro a single journey, or 4 euros for 24 hours (BUT TAKE PLENTY OF CHANGE AS THE TICKET MACHINE ONLY HOLDS 4 EUROS IN CHANGE). Please be careful on the Metro, a young couple staying at the hotel had their money stolen from their bag.

Reviews.Title: “Stay January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Debra W
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was lovely. The hotel was perfectly located and the staff are fantastic. Our room was a little on the small side, but we didnt go to Rome to sit in our room! It was clean and comfortable and the ensuite was gorgeous. The mini bar is very reasonably priced and well stocked! The hotel bar has a happy hour from 6 - 10pm every night, and the cocktails are just wonderful and very alcholic!! The breakfsts are also brilliant, everyones tastes are catered for and the mini pastries are fantastic! There are a couple of small restaurants very close by, so after being on your feet all day seeing the sites its nice to wonder down the road to get a bite to eat! With everything a tourist wants to see within a 45 minute walk in any direction, staying at the River Palace is perfect! I cant wait to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem, great location”
Reviews.Author: PunchFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the River Palace for 4 nights in Dec. Great location, within walking distance of sights and very close to underground. Very close to the Piazza del Popolo which is one of my favorite spots. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. Hotel was very clean, nicely decorated. Rooms on small side (even though we had a superior room). However, we did not mind - we were not in it for very long as there is too much to see and experience in Rome. Staff were very nice and helpful. The bar was always very quiet despite the great value in cocktails. The mojitos were the best we ever had. The breakfast is excellent and plentiful with a great choice of hot and cold dishes. I highly recommend the River Palace and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jayne J
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very snowy weekend in Rome. The hotel is in a great spot for shops and sights. The staff were friendly and attentive without being pushy. Our room was small but perfectly functional and very clean. Great for flopping down in after a long days sightseeing. We would certainly recommend it and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sight Seeing & Shopping”
Reviews.Author: oliviacasey
Reviews.Content: I just left this hotel yesterday and we loved it. We were able to walk to all the main attractions from here and the hotel is situated a 2 minute walk from one long shopping street off which is the trevi fountain. It was my partners birthday while there and although we said nothing there was a bottle of wine and a lovely note left on the bed when we arrived back that evening. Every night there were chocolates left as well as the weather forecast for the following day. The staff were super friendly with excellent english and gave us a simple map to follow to see all the attractions. We walked everwhere from the colosseum to the Vatican although the metro is very easy to use and cheap and the stop is very near the hotel.The breakfast was also better than expected with everything from hashbrowns, eggs, bacon, sausages to a variety of pastries and fresh fruit. I would highly recommend this hotel to a first time visitor to Rome like we were

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday (c)”
Reviews.Author: Fairy-fairytale
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the River Palace Hotel is its location. It's really just a few steps from Piazza del Popolo as well as from the underground station (it's very good if you do not take a taxi from Termini station). As it's quite near the city center so you can easily walk to mostly all sightseeing attractions in Rome. The hotel itself is quite nice if you are lucky and have a good room. In this case you'll be able to rank it "excellent". Unfortunately we were not as lucky as we hoped and I can give only 3 points - not very bad but not very good/good. Pros: -the staff is very friendly and helpful. But there were 2 guys at receprtion (I suppose they were very busy at that moment on the phone) who did not answer our "bye". It happened only once so not a tragedy at all. -breakfast is VERY-VERY good and generous! It exceeded our expectations. Fresh fruits (pineapple, kiwi, sweet melon..), selection of cheese, antipasty, ham, eggs ........Even champange ;-) -two PCs with free Internet access (in the lobby) are really helpful for those who did not take their notebooks (we did not). It was good to check-in for our flight in advance and to get our boarding passes printed -the bar is very nice and it was almost full every evening. From 6 to 10 p.m. you can enjoy your drink with 50% discount. -safe, fridge, nicely decorated room's walls and marble in a bathroom -again location - the hotel is not far from the city center and it can be easily found Cons: -TINY room! Our standart room was so tiny that it was more like a dog house but not a room in a 4* hotel. It was just impossible to move around the room for two people, only this way - one is sitting on the bed, the other is doing smth (e.g. getting dressed in the morning). -The same about the bathroom. You should better ask balance-masters for a piece of advice before you tried to enter the bathroom together or use your towel (after shower) in it. - every day at any time (and at night as you can guess) we were lucky enough to enjoy the noise of plumbing system. As soon as someone (above) flashed the toilet ot took shower we heard real roaring. Thanks God I took ear muffs - after the first night without them I had to use them every night to sleep well. - every evening we were again "happy" to enjoy some strange smell from the street (our windows overlooked the backyard) like smoke. It was very unpleasant. We tried to use conditioning but - as soon as it was switched on there was smell of cigarette smoke. I guess some guests smoked in their rooms but somehow (the cond-n system is old enough in my opinion) we felt it. We did not complain about that because we had been told the hotel is full. -weird lift system. First you need to go up to the 1st floor then walk to anouther lift and go up again. It's not good when you are tired or have luggage etc. Moreover the second lift can be used only for 2-2.5 people at the same time, it's very small If my friends may happen to have the same room and face the same troubles (and they may because it's unpredictable which room you'll have) I can not recommend them to stay at this hotel. As for me I will also hardly choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday in Roma”
Reviews.Author: GazBouch
Reviews.Content: Sadly no special treatment for my 50th but spending it in Rome with my beautiful girlfriend was enough. This is a very nice hotel, plenty of plus points; most of staff very friendly and helpful, location for walking to the main tourist sites is good, but the neighbourhood to the North is not pretty day or night. Get used to the constant non-Italian street sellers bothering you and piazza popolo is a lovely place. The breakfast at the hotel is everything and more, you can eat as much as you can stomach and then not eat again until the next morning, the food is that good & plentiful, even for a veggie like me. Dont be conned by the "happy hour", drinks are very nice but the 50% prices are because they are 100% over priced the rest of the day. Cocktails are about 5 euros during happy hour, which is the "normal" price everywhere else in rome. Rooms are nice, although a bit on the tight size, and we were "upgraded" for free on arrival. The lifts to limited floors are quirky more than an inconvenience. No noise from outside, despite the tram line; but the noise from the cleaners on a morning was a real spoiler. Would we stay here again - yes more than likely if only for the breakfast & location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: We decided to opt for this hotel after the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor and we werent disappointed !!! The hotel is hidden away with a fairly small entrance however once inside it has everything you need including great staff. Our room was great, not huge but enough space for eveything. Lovely bathroom....very italian. Happy hour was a good way to relax after full days of sight seeing, the cocktails and bar snacks really hit the spot. I would definitely go back to this hotel it was a great find and made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “FirstRomeExperience”
Reviews.Author: Oleg P
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome turned out extremely well, and very much so due to River Palace Hotel, a really nice place we were so lucky to choose! Perfectly located - right in the heart of the city, minutes away by foot from major sights. The interior seemed to be designed to introduce a guest to unique Roman atmosphere - classic-style decor, illuminated ancient bas-reliefs on the walls, blue sky painted on the bedroom ceiling - impressing. The room was clean, cozy, comfortable and in perfect condition. Maybe a little bit dark, due to heavyly curtained windows, but it was fine with us anyway. Plentiful breakfast, with wide selection of dishes and drinks. A pleasant surprise - small compliments (cookies or chocolates) from the hotel left on the bed every evening. The staff was really caring, helpful and cooperative. They promptly helped us well in advance, when we needed a hotel confirmation for visa. We enjoyed the stay and would be happy to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: onetreehill8
Reviews.Content: Good location - a stone's throw from Piazza Del Popola (Close to shopping and plenty of restaurants). Room was clean - although small even after an upgrade...bed was huge. Had an issue with the shower which was resolved promptly. Hotel is 20 min walk to Trevi Fountain and likewise to the Pantheon, About 30 minute walk to the Vatican. Breakfast was average. Staff were mostly friendly (the guy behind the bar was not overly friendly). We hired a private taxi through Zelit Limosine's/Car hire for pickup to and from airport... highly recommended - cheap and no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous...a Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Littleredbee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the River Palace Hotel many times over the last number of years, with my most recent visit being with my mother mid December 2011. From the moment the hotel was booked, any requests that we had were attended too quickly and they basically tried to help us out in anyway possible to make our stay very comfortable. The reception staff( cant remember all there names but they were all just fantastic) are so friendly and welcoming and this carries through to all other members of the team one in particular from what i recall her name was Daniella, didnt have much english (I dont have much italian) but when requesting something at breakfast she went out of her way to help and always had a smile on her face. Location wise, I dont think you will get much better, its right in the centre and just a 2 min walk from the metro flamina stop. As it is so central, you are within walking distance from all the main sights just a few mins from the spanish steps, trevi fountain and piazza navona . Within the hotel there is a bar which when we visited was having what i can only call a happy 4 hours from 6 to 10pm!!! (Drinks were half price which did lead to a few too many....haha) All joking aside, for two women travelling alone, this suited us perfectly as we could pop to the hotel bar at 8 or 9pm to socialise feeling safe and secure back in the hotel. Everytime I have stayed here, each time I come back raving about the breakfast, its in a word amazing!!Coffee is great and they have a huge selection of savory and sweet treats, I must say the pastry section in particular is a credit to the hotel. All in all this is fantasic hotel the perfect base to discover Rome from.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FourSeasonsFanUK
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at the River Palace Hotel before our Cruise in October based on previous Tripadvisor reviews. We were really impressed with all aspects of the hotel with the highlight being the daily breakfast (especially the prosecco!). As other reviewers have mentioned, the daily happy hour in the bar is excellent value and the barmen take pride in making a great cocktail. Rooms were comfortable and we all liked the interior design especially the sky painted on the ceiling. The location was spot on and being next to the Piazza del Popolo was a big plus. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: MarcB888
Reviews.Content: Location: very good, even if it’s not center-center. 15 minutes walk to Trevi fountain, this is a quiet area close to Piazza del Popolo and Borghese Gardens. We had a very nice and efficient welcome, the key was ready in a matter of minutes and we were upgraded from superior to deluxe bedroom. We were offered an option to get a junior suite for 25 euros more per night that we declined. The person at the reception was extremely helpful, spoke perfect English, booked our return cab and printed our boarding passes. The bedroom was a bit small, but very manageable. Bathroom very nice with marble everywhere. Some chips on the bathtub and the showerhead. Otherwise perfectly clean, with all the right things at disposal: wardrobe with drawers and hangers, safe, free wifi, minibar and snacks. The hairdryer turned off a bit randomly, and a free bottle of water every day would be good. Overall a bit dated, but has some charm to it. The way from reception to the bedrooms is a bit weird with a first elevator going up just one floor and a second where you can fit 3 ½ people to the next floors. The bar is a very nice area where we stopped every day for a cocktail. The happy hour extends from 6 to 10 pm, which makes it a bargain: cocktails will be down to 5 euros and there are free nibbles and sandwiches. The bartenders are good, the cocktails not perfect but quite close. Guys please no cherries in the caipirinha and the margarita next time! The breakfast buffet is very generous, diversified between sweet and savoury: croissants, tarts, cheese, antipasti, eggs, ham, anything you can ask for and more. Horrible coffee and juices from a set of container… Shame: that would make a big difference to start the day with fresh sqeezed juice and a decent expresso. Three minutes to Piazza del Pepolo. Go to the restaurant Porto di Ripetta, on Via Ripetta, you cannot be disappointed. Tube direct to the train station, cute bus 117 to the Coliseum –or back when you’re tired to walk-, good location for the west bank (Vatican, Castel Sant’Angelo…). Overall a very pleasant experience, worth its 4 stars, would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: karenfrost
Reviews.Content: To put this review into context we are a middle aged couple who have travelled worldwide frequently usually staying in 4 star hotels This hotel is not at all easy to review as it has some excellent features as well as some areas for improvement. a good 3 but with elements of a good 4* Our room wasnt ready for us on arrival even though it was 5pm. We had to wait until 7.30pm but were invited to have a drink in the bar whilst we waited. We thought this was really kind until we found that we had been charged for them on our check out bill (refunded when we asked but shouldnt have had to) We did feel a little miffed when we asked for a late check out ourselves but were refused unless we paid 50 euros. The hotel just maintained that our late check in was due to a" technical problem" so not their fault LOCATION - Great location very close to a large square which links to a major shopping street. We never felt the need to use any public transport, walking to all attractions. The closest is the spanish steps (15 mins) Trevi Fountain (20 mins) Vatican (30 min brisk walk) Collosseum (40 MIns). We returned with very weary feet and legs but it is all possible. We found that the queue for St Peter's Basilica was hours long but revisited at 7.30 am and walked straight in. There was also no queue on our exit an hour later. ROOMS - We stayed in a superior which was small but manageable. I had read on another review no space for a suitcase which i found to be untrue. There wasnt a luggage rack as such but they did fit in the corner of the room without causng and obstruction. A bi folding wardrobe door meant that access to the wardrobe could be tricky as opening it required more space than was available. The room had tv, well stocked minibar of a reasonable price, desk and chair (although the mirror was at standing height above it so ladies take a mirror if you like to sit for hair and makeup) The temperature was a major problem. After being able to control it individually for a couple of nights the hotel then took cental control and tried to roast us all. It was far too hot and opening the windows was ok until about 5.30 when trams would begin to wake us.The corridors were even hotter We got wifi in the room but it could be intermittent. Bed was comfortable (double)and we both slept well. No bath towel or bedding change was given during our 4 nights. The bathroom was very narrow meaning that your knees actually touched the bath when you sat. The bathtub itself was too narrow and shortfor either of us to lie in comfortably but the shower head wasnt great (shot water out sideways from the head soaking the bathroom)Again it was all manageable but not quite a 4* experience It was nicely supplied with bath/shower gel, shampoo, conditioner. body lotion, soap, tissues, and a lovely little beauty box containing cleansing lotion, cotton pad and buds. A hair dryer on the wall was available. Although the bathroom was spotlesslessy clean the fittings were very worn and would benefit from upgrade. A turn down service was provided with chocolates and a weather forecast (she usuaally arrived a bit too early 6.30 to 7.00 when we were getting ready) BAR AREA - Very comfortable place to sit with a nice relaxed ambience with smart decor. Half price drinks during happy hour between 6 and 10 were on offer along with snacks that you could make a meal of (sandwiches, savoury pastries, salami, nuts and crisps). Full price was large beer 5, cocktails 10, wine 5, liqueurs 4. BREAKFAST- Wonderful breakfast with pretty much everything you would want on offer. Wide selection of meats, cheeses, breads, sweet pastries and cakes as well as fuit and yoghurt and hot options too. The dining room was pleasant but again on the small side when full which made getting out of your seat to visit the buffet a bit of a squeeze. One last tip - There is a small restaurant almost oposite the hotel (La Sella del Diavola) which doesnt look much from outside but please do go in. The food is excellent and of average We visited twice paying about 60 euros for 2 of us having 2 courses each and a drink. Lobster with linguni was to die for. We would definately stay here again as overall we enjoyed our stay but we would probably go for a deluxe room to solve the space issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - very quiet”
Reviews.Author: oev_oslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights, we booked a superior double, but our room was upgraded to a de luxe at no extra cost - excellent!! Nice, big room with a spacious bathroom, all in marble. Our room faced the backyard and was VERY quiet, we slept very well, no noise at all. It was a little bit dark in the daytime and a bit too hot during the night, but all in all very good. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty, although the coffee was horrible.. The staff was friendly and very helpful and the room was spotless. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Enormous!”
Reviews.Author: Cal26_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last March, given to us as a present so I cannot comment on booking/ reservation aspect of it. Our room was spotlessly clean and kept so throughout our stay. Breakfast was superb. The lounge/bar area with free snacks available (most welcome as the hotel only does breakfast and we walked a lot and of course wanted to enjoy happy 'hour' (more than an hour) before we went out to eat. The staff were exceptionally helpful and patient. The location is really good with most of the touristy sights within walking distant. We LOVED this hotel. The bathroom was awfully small though and to take away the bidet would be a good idea. I wouldnt hesitate to go back or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Finely appointed hotel near Piazza del Popolo”
Reviews.Author: pieterde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. The hotel is very finely appointed, with good taste. Staff very friendly, rooms spotlessly clean. Breakfast buffet quite rich. Free wifi in the room. My main gripe, being on business, is that I really value space above all else, and in this case I am afraid the rooms are quite small. I also found the mattress quite hard. Would not hesitate to go back on a holiday trip though, with all the attractions close by, direct access to tram and metro and generally a very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: JennPG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in November. Great location, could walk everywhere. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: aldo_razzino
Reviews.Content: nice environment and lovely staff. If you are looking for a nice place right in the middle of the city, 100 ms from Piazza del Popolo, this should be your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent December visit”
Reviews.Author: j b
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent 6 nights here in mid December. The staff and amenities were wonderful. They helped with any questions we had regarding our visit. The breakfast buffet was superb and the 6-10pm happy hour and lounge was a great transition from touring to dinner. The "Superior Room" was a bit tight but except for an occasional afternoon siesta we only needed it for sleeping and changing. The bathroom was clean and roomy. Our only struggle was the room temperature. Set it to 16 Celsius and it wouldn't go lower than 19. I was prepared for lack of heat - we managed with cracking the windows open and a light bed cover.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLJEH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November and found the hotel was the ideal location for visiting the city, just off the piazza del popolo. The room was fine, very clean, but a bit hot, so we turned the air con off. The only minor thing was we had an adjoining door to the next room so you could hear their conversations! The breakfast was delicious and plenty to choose from including prosecco for a bucksfizz! Highly recommend Happy Hour and their wonderful cocktails and snacks. We found that to get from the airport to Rome there were many different suggestions, but we used Terrevison Buses which took 45mins and cost 4 Euros each return, bargain.

Reviews.Title: “small, very hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: Edayuksel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on December 7-11, 2011. The room for 3 was very very small and the temprature in the room was over 30 Celcius Degree even the heating was turned off.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth”
Reviews.Author: erin m
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are Exactly right about this hotel. Also it is fantastic value. The hotel was very clean and modern. Room not quite as big as I'd hoped, but luxurious and clean. Nice bathroom . Staff were helpful. Free buffet breakfasts and dinners were good early, but what do you want for free! The only negative thing I have to say, is the noise, to reach shops on foot, essentials like water. But saves hiring a car! Stay here - you will not regret it. Thank you for having recommended the Porto di Ripetta restaurant it was a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Greallán d
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in Rome one night but the River Palace was a perfect choice for us. It's in a great location within walking distance to everything in the center of Rome (except perhaps The Last Supper) and although the small hotel itself doesn't have a kitchen, the extremely helpful staff directed us to nearby restaurants Porto Di Ripetta I am totally in love with them.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say.... had a brillant time Hotel staff lovely and genuinely pleased to help you Breakfast Buffet to die for so much to choose from ... Hot buffet, cereals, fresh fruit salads, smoked salmon, bakery items etc etc absolutely stuffed myself silly every morning BLISS ! Rooms lovely, only one compliant Sky TV was playing up when we stayed so couldnt get any channels BUT to be honest didn't care as so exhausted from walking all day sightseeing Rome. Would recommend the Vatican to anyone. Had a lovely time and would definitely stay at the River Palace very central to everything. Well done to all the staff at River Palace. Oh and please take full advantage of Happy Hour in the Bar it is lovely. xx Deb Conway

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Nikatnite8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace for several nights recently. The staff is wonderful, polite, very friendly and ready to help. We received a nice bottle of wine delivered to our room after check-in, plus chocolates in the evening with the next days weather forecast. The rooms: yes they are small, but beautifully decorated and clean. The shower is very small but I expected this after researching and reading the reviews. There is free wi-fi in the rooms which was nice. Breakfast: outstanding breakfast which we enjoyed each morning! Beautiful meats and cheeses, rolls, croissants, pastries, fruit, marinated artichokes, tomatoes, caprese salad, even some "Americana" choices such as eggs, bacon...etc. Plus juices, coffee, tea...etc. The best!!!! Location: stone's throw from the Metro and right next to Piazza de Popolo. Rome is huge and we walked everywhere. It didn't seem to take more than 30 minutes to walk to most of the popular attractions of Rome. After a few days our legs were sore so we hopped on the Metro a few times and even took the bus once or twice. Metro is €1 so reasonably priced to get around. There is a happy hour in the bar every night for 4 hours, and they also serve little appetizers which was very nice. We loved our stay at the River Palace and would stay there again without hesitation! Thank you to the staff at River Palace for helping make our Roma vacation so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EvangeliaVal
Reviews.Content: Just a minute from Piazza del Popolo, River Palace was really near to all major attractions. Buffet breakfast was as good as needed to start a busy day in Rome. Service was outstanding. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: angelina8-21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at R.P. for three nights in a really tiny room, but we didn’t have a problem because we were out all day and had no suitcases. There was no room for suitcases. The location was convenient for us, as we like knowing places by walking around. The Spanish steps, the trevi fountain, villa Borghese are very close to the hotel. Breakfast is very good and the staff great. We had a problem with the noises/voices from the hallway, bad soundproof?

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: biskitWestLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I agree with the gist and many of the specifics of other recent reviews. My husband and I stayed at the River Palace for 3 nights in October during our first trip to Rome, and we were pleasantly surprised by the warmth and friendliness we experienced from everyone, from the desk staff to the ones working in the dining room during breakfast and the bar during happy hour. The superior room was small but charming, comfortable and quiet, with a location that is convenient to the historic district (we never took a bus or taxi and made our way everywhere by foot) without being in the middle of the craziness and the noise I found elsewhere. Unlike some others, we were amused rather than annoyed by the complicated elevator logistics (take this one to the second floor, then go around the corner to the second one which will bring you further up.) The breakfast buffet was the best we had in 11 days travelling throughout Italy, with some pastries still warm from the over. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: R5-man
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Mrs for five day break. Cant fault it. Staff were really friendly, breakfast was superb (lots of choice and lots of it). Strong wifi in the bar area. Happy hour lasted four hours each day! Good sleep and ideal location, next to Metro. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ainsleythomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a superior room, room size was decent which was a nice surprise after reading previous reviews. Very good breakfast, lots of home made cakes, great selection of meats and cheeses and prosecco to top it all off :) Friendly staff and chocolates each night with the weather report for the next day! Would definitely stay here again! On a separate note the price for a taxi should be around 10 Euros to this hotel from Termini station NOT 25 as one taxi driver tried to charge us so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Rob601
Reviews.Content: Staff - helpful and friendly Breakfast - Excellent Happy Hour - 4 hours at 1/2 price. Large measures Wi-Fi - Good reception Value for money - excellent Cleanliness - excellent Decor - excellent Location - 200yds from Piazza de Popolo and 100yds from Flamini Underground station. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in a superior room having read the reviews on trip advisor - I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A small restored hotel with excellent European service and location”
Reviews.Author: jhemp42
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this hotel--it had been beautifully restored. The location was really good, within walking distance of the Spanish Steps area, but just outside in a local neighborhood so it was less expensive. Every morning they served a lavish buffet breakfast, including a fresh juice that was a blend of carrot and orange juice--sounds strange but was very good. Naturally the cappuccino was great, and always forthcoming. The rooms are a little smaller than American hotels, but very gracious and luxuriously furnished. We will definitely stay here again, the next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Roger D
Reviews.Content: One or two notes about the River Palace Hotel in Rome: 1. The location is good - within 20 minutes walk of most of Romes historic artefacts & the Vatican city - 5 out of 5 2. The food (breakfast and 'bar snacks' in the evening) were great - again 5 out of 5 3. The hotel itself is clean, the staff polite (unlike the rest of Rome!) and the inside is attractive - 4 out of 5 4. Our room was small, as was the en-suite. I suppose it was adequate if you just use it as a dormitory - but I expected a little more from a '4 star' hotel - 2 out of 5. As for Rome? Fantastic things to see - in a busy, dirty, expensive and generally rude city! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was very good. A wide variety of food. 2 elevators in the hotel. One is ecxtremely small. Common areas carpet somewhat worn. Staff people nice and helpful. Lighting in the room for reading/working on anything not very good. Cocktail area with the Happy Hour was fun and the nibbles were good.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Sapphireprincess065
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, stay here, the River Palace! It is very close to Piazza Del Popolo, and not far from there is the Spanish Step. There are AMAZING restautants by the Piazza, our favorite was Frashetteri Brunetti... http://www.fraschetteriabrunetti.it. The metro is steps from the front door too. Also if buffet breakfast is imporant to you, then this has it all, from prosciutto to prosecco and everything in between. The hotel has a very nice bar and happy hour with many free appitizers. The hotel is very clean, and the staff very friendly and helpful! i would recommend this hotel, and I would go back !

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: BVI17
Reviews.Content: Background: My husband and I travel several times a year and based on my profile we stay at a variety of hotels. The positives: *The Location is terrific. We were able to walk everyone in Rome (even all the way to Testaccio). During our stay we were able to experience a concert in the Piazza del Popolo for the 150th anniversary of Italy's unification (something we would have missed if not staying at River Palace). *The Junior Suites are roomy, clean, and nicely decorated (although a bit worn). *There were two minibars in our room filled with sodas, water, alcohol, and wines. All the items were reasonable priced. *The staff were friendly and tried to be accommodating. *Breakfast is plentiful, fresh, and relaxing. *Happy Hour at the hotel is 50% off drinks (except champagnes) from 6-10pm each night. The bartender was always friendly and efficient. The negatives: *Housekeeping - we ran into a few problems when it came to housekeeping. The first was that they always came too early for daily service and too early for turn down service. The would never come back if the do not disturb sign was on the door, they slide a card under the door saying they tried to come by. This caused us to constanly have to ask for our rooms to be cleaned once we were ready to leave. The 2nd issue was that they didn't always take and replace dirty items (mainly cups), and we don't believe the bedding was ever changed. The 3rd issue was that 20 euros was missing from our room. We went our one morning to get money and counted that money while we were out, counted it again when we got back to our room, and later in the day found that the 20 was missing. We searched the enire room, went through our belongings, verified our receipts etc. We don't know if it was taken out of the safe or if we dropped on the floor while trying to put it in the safe but either way it was gone and it wasn't our doing. We contacted the front desk and they ensured us that they would let the staff know. At the end of the day we weren't mad - if someone took it then we hope that they just needed it more than us. *Our room key was deactivated three times during our stay. *There isn't truly a concierge at the hotel. We once asked for help with a restaurant recommendation in the Trevi fountain area. The response was I don't know of any your probably best to go and look. Another time the staff was at first very helpful with trying to secure a reservation at a particular restaurant. The gentleman called but the restaurant wasn't open during the afternoon. He offered to keep calling the restaurant until they opened. Unfortunately, he didn't let us know our reservation was confirmed until we were walking out the door to go to dinner somewhere else. Overall we had a nice vacation would recommend the hotel for others but for ourselves we would try a new hotel for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Rome the hotel was first class and very well situated . We managed to see all the sites during our four day stay. We booked our short break through Supreme Flights the contact being Mrs Catherine Navin and we would absolutely recommend Supreme Flights as they recommended our hotel and all aspects of our break flights/transfers etc was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round service and stay”
Reviews.Author: MartinisInRome
Reviews.Content: In a quieter, yet very convenient location in Rome - the hotel's primary features include; clean well furnished rooms. Small to mid in size but everything you need and expect that close within Rome. The service excellent, very helpful. 50/50 fluent English speaking but its nice to converse a little in Italian. The hotels bar is great and happy hour(s) daily. The bar tender a great guy and makes fantastic drinks. Breakfast - best in Italy. We've been in Florence and Venice also, no comparison. River palace certainly pulls out all stops. Location; 2 mins walk from del popolo. 5 mins from Spanish steps. 5 mins walk to the gardens. 8 min walk to the tour bus pickup. 15 mins to trevi. Shopping, the del corso famous strip starts at del popolo. Go no further. Eating out, we walked to numerous lane way locations between Spanish steps and via del corso from the river palace hotel - high recommend sharing it round these spots, get the full experience. Highly recommend the hotel, will thank my travel agent and advocate the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: btblaney
Reviews.Content: Great location about 7 minutes from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Easy to find - convenient by the Metro (Red Line, Fluminco stop). We were upgraded to a Deluxe room, which had a great bathroom and comfortable beds. Breakfast had lots of variety and was delicious. Hotel bar offered 50% during Happy Hour (6-10). Very helpful staff (though not the most knowledgable, they try). If you're interested in a tour of the Vatican, I recommend using Angel Tours (knowledgable, reasonable, youthful, helpful, English-speaking, small groups). Nearby were 3 main shopping streets, the main one (del Corso) leads to the main Piazza by the Roman Forum and Colosseum (literally 10 minutes walk if you walk quickly). Would be honored to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “we all enjoyed this hotel,”
Reviews.Author: leostargirl
Reviews.Content: Location is great, breakfasts were wonderful , best we had in our whole trip, bar service was very nice,, had coffee and cookies while trying to stay wake waiting for friends to arrive from airport on our first day,,,, would go back ,and would recommend to others,,,Eileen,ny.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samantha C
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two week tour of Italy that I enjoyed with three friends. We stayed in 6 hotels along the way, with River Palace being the first. My only regret is perhaps that we did not appreciate what a gem it was at the time. All four of us work in the South African Tourism industry and admit that we can be quite picky when it comes to hospitality products and services. Our first impression of the hotel was that it was not four star standard with the rooms being unbelievably small and with the tiniest shower I had ever seen ... however, as we soon found out, the room size was about normal for Italy and also realised that what what we know as a three star in South Africa is equivalent to Italy's four star! Anyway - having now returned from our holiday, I wanted to make a point of reporting back on the postives of this hotel. Firstly the location is wonderful, with easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain and infact many other places if happy to walk a bit further. For those less energetic people though, there is a Metro stop just a few metres from the hotel. Secondly, the staff were very friendly and helpful, which once again ... we soon found out, was not the norm throughout the rest of our Journey, infact would even go as far to say that other service providers, including Tourism offices that we came into contact with along the way were downright rude! The breakfast is nothing short of superb and was the only hotel we stayed at that offered a hot option too. The selection really was fantastic and again with friendly service staff. The free wifi was very much appreciated and last but not least - one of the best selling points of this hotel was their happy hour that runs each evening from 6-10pm - where all drinks are half price. To us South Africans, struggling with a very bad exchange rate - this was music to our ears. They also put on a full spread of snacks that were complimentary during Happy hour. Bottom line, I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is not planning on spending huge amounts of time in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SalmanShakeeb
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great location, and from it we walked to every tourist site & back. Great location, and very friendly staff . . but I must say the rooms are TIGHT. But at the end of the day, you're only there for a couple of days, and mainly to have a goodnights sleep, and River Palace does just that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great Happy Hour and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli K
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, close distance to major attractions in Rome. The hotel staff was wonderful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Rooms are clean but small (as expected).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: eirambob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located. It is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and the Metro is about a block away. Well decorated and upscale. The rooms are a bit small, but still very nice. The bathrooms are small as well, but this is quite common in Europe. The whole hotel is well kept and exceptionally clean. The bar offers a Happy Hour from 6 to 10 every evening, the drinks are half price and complimentary appetizers are served. This was a great way to meet other travellers and was a lot of fun.The staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again and would recommed it for your trip to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jerrydon
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in the standard rooms. They are very small. Breakfast & happy hour are awesome. The entire staff is friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! small rooms means 10sqr meters!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ifat A
Reviews.Content: If you weigh more than 80 kilo you cannot even consider taking the classic room otherwise you can forget about a decent shower during your stay in this hotel. and this is no joke!! the shower is so small I could not even bend to pick up the soa,. and I am a skiny lady barely 55 kilo... Regarding the rooms- they are kind of clastrophobic. We really wanted to upgrade but I was told by the hotel receptionist that there is no available room. it is so small there is no place to put the laugage and I could not even walk around the bed. I am sure these kind of conditions are not part of your plans in Rome. For 220 Euro I would expect much more.I heard the hotels in rome are bad and its my first time so I have nothing to compare. Anyways the breakfast was very nice. everyday exactly the same but good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel friendly and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: JohnchrisBunburyW_A
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nites here early this month (oct) and found all staff very helpful and friendly. The Superior room was comfortable and a good size by European standards. The breakfast was like a feast. The male staff were very helpful with local suggestions re banking and restaurants etc. we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. John and Chris - Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But....”
Reviews.Author: bigjourneys
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 5 star hotel but sadly we suffered one significant issue. We were in Rome Sept 2011 for a 5 day break for our 25th wedding anniversary, this included 4 nights in the River Palace or at least that’s what we booked 8 months earlier and confirmed 2 months earlier (as we had been spooked by reviews). When we arrived the manager informed us they had made a mistake with our booking and did not have a room for us! Shock horror this was exactly what we had read about with this hotel, we had so wanted to believe that the reviews recited a freak incident that happened to a very unlucky minority but shouldn't happen to us. How wrong we were! The manager offered another hotel for our first night and then we would be back to the River Palace, I got very cross about this, he then added 20 euros to spend in the bar and two places on the hotel recommended bus / walking tour. So as not to further upset our anniversary and given the amount of time we had, there was really little choice but to accept the situation. We noticed during our stay that other unfortunate people were subjected to the same fate, which adds to the difficulty in believing these are mistakes. The big problem here is the feeling of uncertainty, the unknown commodity, 'will they really have a room tomorrow night? what will this other hotel really be like? Actually the other hotel was nice but we were still left with worry about the rest of the booking, we had no faith or trust in the hotels promise. My wife was very upset, the break meant so much to her, one important reason being that we couldn't afford a honey moon 25 years ago. So this was pretty special, she is not normally that emotional but she cried in the room later that night. It hadn't helped mind you that we had had a nightmare journey from the airport, 4hrs for an alleged 45 minute shuttle journey! The very big point here which I believe may be eluding the hotel is the amount of distress this causes. In other aspects of the River Palace experience the hotel does try very hard and succeeds to provide an excellent service, however this problem cruelly lets it down where it matters most. Right off the soap box and back to the rest of the stay with the River Palace, which was great! The champagne breakfast was fabulous, the best continental breakfast we have ever had, I tried everything and made a point of fuelling up daily with salmon and mushrooms and whatever else I fancied (pastries, fruit, cold meats, cheeses) plus champagne, well rude not to really . Did try their hash browns, bacon, sausage and scrambled egg, tasty enough but not as good as english hotels but of course we weren’t there for english style food. When we finally got to our ‘Superior deluxe ’ room on the second night, the room was exactly as per the internet if not better, it was very slightly smaller than a typical English hotel room but more than ample for us. We’ve both got middle aged spreads but still had plenty of space in our room and in the notorious second lift, which incidentally is as small as we had read about. The hotel is very pleasantly decorated with some nice touches like the cast sculptures and paintings. The piano lounge is a good size and well appointed with soft leather sofas and coffee tables, it leads to the marble stairs and legendary happy hour half price 6 – 10 bar, which leads to cocktail upon cocktail which leads to us and other happy tourists enjoying each others company. On our arrival in our room we received two large sweet apples, then every morning we received two soft sweets and a card with the daily weather forecast. The room includes bath robes, slippers, safe, dumb waiter, pay tv, phone, bidet, good shower but similar to other Italian hotels no tea or coffee facilities. The linen is good quality and the bed was comfortable, the room air conditioning works fine and as well as the privacy nets the two sets of curtains include black out curtains. The staff were very friendly, very helpful, good English with great restaurant recommendations. We would recommend the hotel taxi service, the guy is very helpful (50 euros too Fiumicino airport).

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quite, best breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: Houstan
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights: the room was nice but the fancy gold colored rugs need to be cleaned or replaced (even in the halls). We were on the 4th floor so anyone above the 2nd floor needs to take two elevators. The first only takes you to the second floor then you walk to a second elevator to get access to additional floors. But it was the best breakfast spread during our entire trip and free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Typical small (but nice) room”
Reviews.Author: BradMaui
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nites October 2011 with my wife. Location is 2 blocks from Piazza Popolo and Villa Borghese gardens - Most big sites are easily walkable for healthy folks. A metro station and surface tram stop only a block away. The front desk staff were all very nice, bilingual and helpful. The included breakfasts were the best I've ever seen in Europe - beyond the usual coldcuts and croissants, there were scrambled eggs, multiple pork products, fruit, cereals, oatmeal, etc, etc. This healthy start got us well into the afternoon before we needed to eat again. The rooms were nicely appointed but small and the bathrooms were even more compact. We would likely stay here again -

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sararoyal
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the River Palace at the end of September. The hotel was very nice and met all our needs...very close to a metro station, good breakfast, and clean. We did the Roman Vacation package which provided a great 3 hr tour of St. Peters, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, etc and a dinner at a great authentic Italian restaurant. There were lots of restaurants close by and it was easy to get around the city. Wi-fi worked well in the rooms and there were also a few computers that guests could use. Happy hour prices were great, although it wasn't all that happening when we were down there. The rooms are not huge, but were adequate. They were clean and bathroom was also very nice. We had a small stand up shower, so no issue with the shower handle as others have noted. My only major complaint is that it took over 30 minutes for us to check in after we arrived (which was around 3:00, check in time). After a long day of traveling, we just wanted to get in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: buca1234
Reviews.Content: The River Palace Hotel is in a great location. My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights along with 3 other couples. The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and shops. This was my 10th time in Rome and my first time at the River Palace. On my next trip to Rome I will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but nice hotel and room”
Reviews.Author: KrissyKolb
Reviews.Content: While the location is a bit north of most of the sights in Rome, the hotel was very nice. Great lobby and bar area, the room was nice and clean but a bit small. The bathroom shower was difficult as there was only a hand held shower head that would not stay secured at the highest position. Definitely would recommend if you are willing to walk a bit further to get to the vatican or ancient rome area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fanstastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: Like most people visiting this site I trawled through many hotels before settling on the River Palace. I stayed for 4 nights and loved every minute of my trip. The hotel is ideally located for the Metro and only moments away from the Piazza del Poppolo. Within a 10 minute stroll you can visit the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The Colusseum is about 25 mins walk or can be reached via the Metro. The River Palace hotel is a fantastic place to stay and the staff are extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast is a food extravaganza with a great selection from fresh muffins, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cheeses and many hot items - there was even bucks fizz if you wanted it! The cleanliness and attention to detail made the stay very enjoyable and I would definately stay here again if I were to go back to Rome. I was in a deluxe twin room which featured slippers and big comfy bathrobes. A card detailing the weather for the next day was waiting for us on our beds at night along with little sweets ... what a nice touch. It was very hot during our stay and thankfully the room had air conditioning - it was positioned at the back of the hotel overlooking residential apartments so it was nice and quiet.
