The room was nicely decorated and featued a flat screen TV which had the option to choose programmes in English if you wanted it. Happy hour was popular with guests (between 18.30 and 22.30) and the sandwiches available in the bar were very reasonable and tasty. Don't look any further than the River Palace hotel if you are planning to visit Rome - you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember!”
Reviews.Author: vanessak19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights, in celebration of our silver wedding anniversary. On arrival, we were told that our superior room would not be available until the following day, so we stayed in a classic room that night. It was small, but absolutely beautiful, and the sun flowed in across the roof tops straight onto our bed ( and toilet- fab view!!) We were compensated with 20euros in the bar, and an equally beautiful, but large room the next day! The staff were all so friendly and professional, and the breakfast was the best ever! It was perfectly situated to visit all the historic sites, on foot, as long as you are pretty fit! The Pincio Gardens above the impressive Piazza de Popolo was very restful, and the Icecreams are out of this world! We would highly recommend The River Palace Hotel, and look forward to hopefully returning one day.Also, the driver Allesandro was brilliant- what a passionate, typical italian man!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: miroma
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel – the location close to Borghese and other attractions, steps away from Flaminio subway station, the spacious room, complimentary water and fruit, excellent breakfast (I loved their) homemade biscuits), and the friendly and helpful reception staff. They made our stay in Rome unforgettable. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to Rome and to this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheExile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Palace Hotel with my wife for my 50th birthday. The hotel was excellent, the staff were helpful and superb and Rome was stunning. Much has already been said so I will try and not repeat everything. One of the best things we did was to arrange a taxi via the Hotel, you simply supply your flight times and they arrange everything for you. Its €55 pick up to hotel (to cover parking) and €50 return. No advanced payments and the driver is waiting for you in arrivals with a card clearly displaying your name. Alessandro Marconi (hope the spelling is correct) was our driver both ways; he was excellent and gave us a mini guided tour of Rome on the way to the hotel which later proved to be invaluable and saved us a lot of time and effort. He is not over the top and you are not expected to pay any extra for his mini tour; he does it because he is wants to help and is proud of his job and of Rome. Using some of the detail from Alessandro and some from the very kind reception staff at the hotel, you can use my following information to get you started.. We walked everywhere, there are good transport links but we did not need them. I’ll try and remember the cost of things and indicate below. We had no need for ‘guided tours’; they can be expensive and do not always beat the queues. Directions and articles in the sights are well signed and explained in English. Here we go.... Step out of the hotel and turn right, you will see a big arch ahead of you - Picture 1 (2 min walk), cross the main road and walk under the arch and you are now in the Piazza Del Popolo. As you pass under the arch and enter the Popolo, visit the church on the left – Santa Maria Del Popello which featured in a Dan Brown book!? – Picture 2. Look across the Piazza (past the Egyptian obelisk and fountain) and you will see three (3) roads separated by two (2) apparently identical churches with large domes, Picture 3 The road to the left (1st) takes you to the Spanish Steps (free), Trevi Fountain (free). We then visited the Pantheon (free), Piazza Novona (free) etc. The middle road (2nd) takes you to the Colosseum*, Faro Romano* (ruins) and Monte Palatino*. (* joint ticket €12 – get your tickets at Faro Romano – less queues!) The road to the right (3rd) takes you to Saint Angelo’s Castle (€5), St Peters Church (free), Cupola (this is up into the dome at St Peters, 600 + steps! - €5 all steps, €7 a few less steps as you can use an elevator to avoid some) Vatican Museum which includes Sistine Chapel (€15). There is lots more to see and do and it is all covered in other reviews. Just to round off, we had the classic (small) room and it was fine, we were offered a reduced upgrade but did not need it. We had nothing to complain about, and the breakfast is yummy! The half price ‘happy 4 hour’ drinks and free food at the bar (mentioned in other reviews) is great value for money. We will return to Rome and to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with top rated service”
Reviews.Author: LuvToTravelGrl
Reviews.Content: I'd highly recommend this hotel for its safe, easy location and wonderful service. 4.5 stars Location: While the hotel was a bit north of various historical sites, it is extremely close to Piazza Popolo, Villa Borghese, and right at the top of the three main roads (Via Corso) that leads to all the places. Also, the hotel is right next to the Metro and tram. From the hotel, we had walked to the Vatican & St Castel (20 to 30 min walk). We felt safe and the hotel was in the vicinity of many wonderful restaurants (5 to 10 min walk). Also, there's a great little grocery store around the corner where you can pick up cheap sandwiches for 2-3 euros each. Service: All the hotel concierge personnel were professional, spoke excellent English, and provided great service. They were able to provide assistance to questions we had about the area, different tourist sites, transportation, restaurant recommendations, etc. Our rooms were kept cleaned by the housekeepers . Rooms: Our room was a queen room (ie two doublebeds pushed together) with a desk and a small closet. A bit on the small side but enough space for two people. The bathroom was clean and showers ran great. The room also had a working tv (some English channels). Other: Hotel had free wifi in the rooms or you can use their computers in the lobby. Additional, the hotel provide a happy hour from 6-10pm (half price off all drinks.) This was a great place to grab a drink before heading out to dinner and there usually was a crowd of the hotel guests creating a fun ambience. The servers were nice and served diligently. Overall, we'd stay here again for the service, location, and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor reservation”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on our way to a 7 day stay in Tuscany and found the location to be excellent, the rooms very small ( literally 10ft by 10 ft with bathroom about 4 by 7 ft) very clean and beautifully decorated with a wonderful breakfast. Our plan was to stay for another night on our way back, but when we arrived, Christian told us that a mistake had been made with our reservation and did not have a room for us. He arranged for is to have a room at the Hotel Lucarno, which was dirty and shabby, with a bathroom with cracked tile with obvious black mold, chipped paint and a shower that was so dirty that I wouldn't consider stepping into without slippers. Our reservation was made 7 months in advance and was reconfirmed one week prior. We felt like we were really taken advantage of and will tell our AAA travel agent to avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lesaw4
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. By far the best 4 Star Hotel we stayed in. The breakfast spoiled us for the rest of our trip, no one else could compare. A nice touch with a lot of English language channels on the TV. The rooms are a little small and the elevators tiny but staying there was really special.

Reviews.Title: “Rome 2011”
Reviews.Author: JSimmons8172
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very enjoyable. It was in a convenient area, close to the metro and a 20 minute walk to the Vatican. Rooms were on the small side , but nicely decorated and very clean. Breakfasts were complementary and were the best we had had i n Italy

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: JaneSomerset_England
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It is well located just above Piazza del Popolo with most sites easily accessible on foot or by public transport. Standard rooms are petite with very small bathrooms BUT very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful although bar undermanned during the happy hour so you have to wait for drinks to be served. Breakfasts are excellent with a wide range of food and drink on offer. Pizzas and basic pastas are best value the hotel side of the piazza. Trastavere is one of the best areas to explore and eat in - lovely atmosphere. Would definately return to Rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable; Quiet Location; Superb Breakfast; Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Reed T
Reviews.Content: Pros: Quiet location, superb breakfast, courteous staff, beautifully decorated. Cons: Expensive, Not in the middle of the action (that is why it is a quiet location), very small rooms, even smaller showers, hard and lumpy mattresses and you have to take two separate elevators to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kath49245
Reviews.Content: You couldnt ask for a better location in Rome as this little Gem, Rooms are Beautiful, Breakfast was Excellant, staff are wonderfull. could not find a fault with this Hotel - Location ideal for getting to all main attraction we walked to all from this Hotel because if you dont you will miss out on so much. Be sure to drink in the Hotel Bar fantastic value. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Months in Advance, but Never Got to Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Two_Travel_Bugs_WI
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the River Palace Hotel more than 10 months prior to our trip. We reserved the Suite Villa Borghese for one night - our final night of a two week trip to Italy. We were so excited to have a lovely room - with a private terrace on which we could relax the last night away. When I attempted to reconfirm our reservation three weeks before the trip, we were told that our reservation was no longer valid! No explanation, just that it was not valid. They offered us a different type of room instead. However, when I attempted to contact them for more information on why our reservation was invalid and to get more info on the other option, so that we could understand the situation and make a more informed decision, I received no further emails or follow-up. Needless to say, we no longer trusted this hotel with any reservation! I hate to think what would have happened had I not tried to reconfirm, and showed up on our final evening of the trip, to no reservation. I can't speak for the rooms, or the ambiance, of this hotel, but I can say that the reservations system and the customer service were extremely poor. We were extremely disappointed in our entire experience with River Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Excellence in Everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3popcorn
Reviews.Content: Sept. 14th, 2011 I cannot put into words the "wonderful" experience I had at the hotel. The staff was friendly, warm, professional and always willing to help and they went beyond their job responsibilities to provide comfort and satisfaction. Tityana was superb in assisting us in every way! She should be commended for her customer service excellence and genuiness.... She made us feel at home along with Sergio and Christian, they were the perfect host and very accomodating! Customer Service was GREAT!!! I will recommend this hotel very highly and refer to others. Our flight was cancelled once we arrived at the airport and we stayed overnight at the Hilton(airport).... The service we received at the Hilton did not compare to the excellent service we received at the River Palace... Keep up the great work!!!! You made our vacation a huge success!!! Blessings!! Amaza Boddie

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denis F
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the River Palace. We had a superior room and lots of space, wonderful architecture. Close to Piazza Del Populo, nice restaurants and a subway station, Flaminio. The staff were helpful and very caring. The elevators are not a problem, small but working. Love the bar service and also the delicious breakfast. Kudos to all the staff at the River Palace. We had a wonderful stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel with friendly staff and we will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 nights at the River Palace. The breakfasts were fantastic and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We went for our Silver Wedding Anniversary and booked a superior room, but when we got there they upgraded us to a deluxe room which was really nice. They also gave us a bottle of wine which I thought was really thoughtful. Special thanks to the barman who took great pride in his cocktails and it made our break really special. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Sharon O
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room and free wi-fi. Important to communicate back home. The employees were very nice and helpful. We would reccomend to anyone. Walking distance to points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Most AMAZING visit to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Princess_loz_89
Reviews.Content: We Arrived in Rome at the River Palace on Saturday 27th. After travelling for best part of 8 hours we arrived tired and hungry but excited to be in Rome. We arrived to check in and the staff were very friendly and polite however to be told for the first night of our week stay our room had been double booked! Normally this would have been highly irritating however they couldn't have been more apologetic and helpful. They put us up in their sister hotel about 5 minutes out of the city which was just as lovely as River Palace. On our return on sunday we arrived to a room upgrade and a bottle of wine which was a nice touch. the hotels location was perfect and in walking distant to all the main attractions including pantheon and colosseum on days when you didn't want to walk because of the heat the metro was a two minute walk and 1 euro for 1 journey. The hotel provided free wifi and had computers in the reception area. The bar area was a great place to chill out in the evening and happy hour was great and even had bar food. Hotel was clean and breakfast was the cherry on top which catered for everyone. Definitely would recommend and re visit River Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMichelle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close distance to major attractions in Rome. The hotel staff has been wonderful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Rooms are clean and fresh - we will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny (euro)!!!”
Reviews.Author: RDJames
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome. Booked Villa Borghese Suite 11 months in advance. They were very helpful with arranging transportation from the airport. Hotel and room are beautiful and clean. Staff was amazing!! Georgio and Sergio helped us with directions and Tetayana helped us navigate the metro. Booked the Vacanze Romane special which included the Eternal Rome our and a dinner. The dinner was great and the tour was excellent. Every morning there was a large buffet breakfast. We especially enjoyed the fresh fruit and yogurt, but the eggs, pancietta and pastries were very good as well! Every night during happy hour the gentlemen at the bar made us excellent coffee - even remembered how we liked it! These small personal touches really made this an excellent vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: megan e
Reviews.Content: After a 30 hour trip from Australia the Hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. They gave us an early check-in, chased up our luggage which took an extra day to arrive and organised tour and museum bookings for us. The breakfast was sensational and the happy hour with snacks helped out our budget. And the location was great with 20min walk to the Vatican, and 2 minutes to the Piazza Santa Maria del Popolo which meant I could drop in and see the Carravagios on my way past. We would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone. Meg and Brian from Mildura, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely Hotel, near to Metro and Trams, walking distance for the hardy!”
Reviews.Author: jimilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights 30th Jan-1st Feb for my birthday and couldn't fault the hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast has a big selection of pastries, cold meats, chesses, breads, yoghurts, cereals, tea, coffee, juice and cooked items. The happy hour was welcomed at the end of the day, we certainly made our way through the entire cocktail list with another couple that was staying there. Perfect relaxtion after a long days sightseeing. Sandwiches and snacks were ok. The hotel does not provide dinner, but there is a lovely little pizza place towards Piazza del Popolo on the same side of the road as the hotel, near Burger King. It is not much to look at from the outside, but very reasonably priced and nice size portions. across the road there is a restaurant with bright neon type signs, dont be put off - we had a lovely homecooked meal in there of chicken, rice, vegetable and fries, with 2 beers for 20E. They didn't speak much English, but were friendly all the same. It was a European resataurant, but had a funny name like "Chicken Express" Flaminio metro station is less than 5 minutes walk away, and there are trams that run directly outside the hotel. We were on the 4th floor, but as it was winter we had the window shut most of the time. The room could get quite warm, but it was 12'C outside and clear blue skies when we went, unlike the great British weather in January! We walked to all the main sites - Vatican, Colleseum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps etc, but occasionally got the Metro back when our legs were too weary. The location of the hotel is fantastic, just far enough out of the way to not be bombarded with tourists as soon as you step out onto the street, but close enough to the attractions. Piazza Del Poppollo is stunning, and a walk through Borghese park grounds is a must! This is definitely in my top 3 of favoutie hotels that we have stayed at and would definitely stay again if we ever go back to Rome. I would not bother paying for an upgrade, unless you would prefer to have a bath instead of a shower. The rooms are small, but unless you are bringing your cat to swing, you should find that there is sufficient space for all your clothes, toiletries etc. Highly recommended for couples as it is decorated in quite a quirky romantic way!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Staff Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maria T
Reviews.Content: Don't normally write reviews but having checked this on tripadvisor before we booked had to give an opinion. Hotel is beautiful, rooms are a bit small alright, but very clean and comfortable. After a long day sightseeing this was the perfect place to relax, very convenient for all sights, could walk to most of them easily within 15 mins. Staff excellent english and couldn't be more helpful, The bar had happy hour every evening with half price drinks and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Two computers in lobby with free access to internet anytime was very useful. Definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Could not speak more highly!!”
Reviews.Author: Nataliej2309
Reviews.Content: I dont normally write reviews but this hotel needed a mention. It was just how you imagine a hotel in rome to look like. The staff couldn't do enough, my friend accidentally left her phone charger in the room when we checked out in the morning and they found it and gave it back to her before we left. They were so helpful and showed us where the main point of interest were. The rooms were lovely and every evening you were provided with a card saying what the weather would be like the next day. The hotel was lovely, in a good location (near piazza del popolo) and it felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had everything we could want, and more!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Palace Hotel late August 2011. We really enjoyed it here, we were right up on the 8th floor so had to take the 2 lifts that everyone has been mentioning. They're really not that bad! We had a standard room, it was small but perfect for relaxing after a long days sightseeing. The bathroom was fantastic and included all the usual extras you would expect (Shampoo/shower gel) and more! There was a large TV with sky which had plenty of English channels for the small amount of time we would spend watching it. The was a mini fridge in the room and snacks which were available for a cost. It was exceptionally clean and the maid came in every evening to turn down the bed and leave us sweets and the weather forecast for the next day! Overall we were really pleased and have no complaints about the room. The rest of the hotel was fantastic. The staff were great - very friendly all the time. The public areas were all clean and welcoming. Free access to the computers (with internet) at any time during the day was really handy. The bar area was great, always buzzing with people during happy hour which was fantastic value for money. Breakfast was very good. The staff kept the food topped up throughout the breakfast period. There was enough food to cater to everyone's tastes, all very fresh and delicious. The hotel location was perfect. It was within walking distance of all the main sights of Rome and there is a Metro station within a minutes walk down the road for the day when you can no longer walk! Overall this was a fantastic hotel. If I ever return to Rome I will definitely be returning to this hotel and I will be recommending it to everyone. This should be everyone's first choice when travelling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I decided we would travel to Rome and see the sites. We booked into The River Palace Hotel and initially were unsure about location thinking that we would be too far away from the main sites. However this wasn't the case the metro was literally 50 mtrs away at the end of the road and the tram stop was also right at the end. When we arrived at the hotel we had a very warm greeting and our bags were collected for us from the taxi and we were taken personally to our room and the bags followed us up. I wondered whether tips were expected but as soon as our room had been opened and the lights etc shown to us we were left immediately. The hotel has two lifts, one to the first floor and a second tiny lift fitting only 4 people to the top. During our stay we didn't have any problems with the lifts at all. Our room was lovely and we could change our own air conditioning. The bathroom was clean and well equipped and the bed was comfortable with immaculately clean bedding. You could ask for your linen or your towels to be replaced at any time. In the evening our bed was turned down and a weather report was left in the room along with two sweets along with a mat at each side of the bed (to pray on who knows?) In the evening from 6pm onwards up until 10pm was happy hour (or 4 hrs!) and your drinks were half price and free sandwiches and crisps etc were served. This was a really nice atmosphere in the lounge and although the drinks were half price even at full price it was only E2.00 for latte coffee and E2.5 for a coke which is cheaper than the local restaurants. We travelled one day to Tripoli and saw the Villa D Este which was well worth the journey however 'big mistake' you need to buy a ticket for the bus prior to getting on! The bus driver was not happy at all when we tried to get from Tripoli to Hadrians villa - we found out later that the tickets are sold in the coffee shop across the road from the bus stop! However the journey from Hotel to Tripoli was really easy - Metro to bus station then one bus all the way total cost for the return trip E6.00 each however the ticket from Tripoli to Villa Hadrian on the number 4 bus was E1.00 each way, however we didn't return to Tripoli in the end deciding to just catch the Rome Cotral bus back to Rome from Hadrians Villa (main road). The baths of Carracella or a must see with fabulous mosaics and the Villa D'Este for its gardens and fountains. Trevi Fountain - well we went in the evening but it was packed so instead we went before breakfast later in the week and got there for around 8am and only a few others had had the same idea - it was lovely and a lot bigger than I thought. Tip - avoid anyone with Roses they want E1.00 for every Rose they palm off onto you. Tip - buy your bus ticket before embarking Tip - a 75 min ticket on the metro going anywhere is E1.00 Tip - we had our best meal at Al Garraro (think spelt like this) which is not far from Piazza Popollo.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Very Clean, Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: i_kenefick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is central which is important as you will walk a lot while in Rome. The Metro is less than a 5 minute walk away. A taxi to the Trastevere, a good spot for food and drink will cost between 10 and 15 euros each way. The staff here are very friendly and can't do enough for you :) The hotel is very clean, the only negative being the classic small rooms - although upgrades are available. Air conditioning is good and free sky TV and free WiFi is standard. The lounge area is comfortable and there is a good selection of beer available. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!! Perfect Honeymoon accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Victoria P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the middle of August for our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute of it. The weather was extremely hot so the excellent air conditioning in the hotel was very welcome. The staff were all really friendly and polite, greeting us warmly every morning, aswell as helpful - they offered us advice on where to visit nearby and gave us a map with our location pointed out, which we used for the rest of our stay. The hotel also offers a private car service to both airports. It is in an excellent location just above Piaza del Popolo and the main shopping area of Rome, and we were able to walk from there to our destination each day with no problems. I would say that if you are thinking of staying here, please ignore the comments by other reviewers about the small rooms - they are quite small but so what? I hope you wouldn't travel all the way to Rome to stay in your room for the entire visit! I can't fault this hotel at all and would definitely stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing there's allot to do in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Synn69
Reviews.Content: By far the smallest hotel room we've stayed in however it was clean and well appointed. The service was great and the breakfast buffet was excellent. We enjoyed the Cappuccinos every morning. The Wifi and Internet access went down and never resumed during our stay. There we no other nearby free hotspots, but there's a cyber-cafe right across the street. Getting to our room was weird, up one elevator, down a hall, up another elevator. We only spent time sleeping and showering in the hotel room and that time felt cramped, thankfully there's allot to see and do in Rome which kept us out of our Hotel. The location is good as we were able to walk to most of the sites and it's right next to the subway and train lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while sightseeing in Rome, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Like2Travel12
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the River Palace Hotel. The hotel was about a fifteen minute walk from the Spanish Steps, and had a metro stop nearby which was good. The room itself needs upgrading, specifically the carpets. They were moldy & dirty, just really nasty. On a positive note, the breakfast was great, probably the best out of all the hotels we stayed in while visiting Italy. I would not stay here again unless they renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but quirky...”
Reviews.Author: Shepard26
Reviews.Content: As noted in most other reviews, the rooms range from small to very small, the whole interior seems to be an M.C. Escher design, and the elevator is about the size of a hall closet...but I loved every quirky minute of it. This was an anniversary trip, so I went for the Villa Borghese suite on the top with a balcony and jacuzzi tub, but I can't really say it was worth it. The balcony faces east towards the Villa Borghese park, which is pleasant, but not the scenic view of ancient Rome we were hoping for. As for the jacuzzi tub, well...my wife and are are getting a bit old for that. On top of the building (almost directly above the Villa Borghese suite) was a massive grouping of cellphone antennas, which might be a concern for some. On the plus side for the suite, it included a dinner at a local cafe (another story itself...!) and a tour which turned out to be excellent. The breakfast selections were fine and there was plenty of seating, but my favorite part of the hotel was the simple bar/lounge area called Cheers...good times with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Golfwidow89
Reviews.Content: WARNING: The hotel overbooked a honeymoon even though it was booked early in the Spring of 2011 and we also reconfirmed the reservation a few weeks before in July and they stated that all was well. The hotel did not communicate and has not replied to any subsequent emails asking them for explanations. There is no excuse for this having happened, so think carefully before you select this property even if the confirm and reconfirm your room. An alternative was given but this was not the hotel and location that we spent many hours selecting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, tiny rooms, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Arthur P
Reviews.Content: You'll trip over your luggage in these rooms. tiny, with dated bathrooms. To get to the 2nd floor rooms, you have to take two of the slowest elevators north of the equator. The breakfast was very nice. The most annoying thing was that the internet was not working for 4 of the 5 days we stayed there. Since hotels work the internet fee into the price of the room, don't you think they should give us a price break if the internet is out...like your home cable tv company does? Not a chance here, however. I'd stay here again, but it is not a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel as a finale to our two week Europe trip!”
Reviews.Author: Diane74
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself stayed here last month for one night. I had booked a Junior Suite well ahead of time so we could treat ourselves at the end of a two week coach tour. We were greeted nicely although our room wasn't ready since we were early. We left our bags to be locked up and wandered around for awhile until the valet took us up to our room later. The hotel was about a 20 minute walk to the Trevi fountain. The suite was a ground floor overlooking an inner courtyard which was really nice and quiet. The rooms were very clean, large by European standards with a combined tub and shower. We had a king bed and our daughter had a daybed. Both beds were really comfortable. The air conditioning was quiet and worked really well although it seemed better in our daughter's room. We had two bar fridges which was really nice. We didn't try anything at the bar although it looked nice. The sitting areas seemed really nice as well. The desk clerks were very good with answering questions. They booked us a taxi to go to the airport the next morning and he was early but waited for us. The location was good since we found the Trevi fountain, bank machines, the Pantheon, churches, piazzas, a small grocery store etc., near by along with tons of shops and restaurants of every type. We had their buffet breakfast the next morning and it had a very wide variety of hot and cold food. Someone would have to be very picky to not find somethin We paid 299 Euros for the junior suite for 3 people, tax and breakfast for one night which was well worth it. Overall we wish we could have stayed longer and we would definitely return given the chance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room I've stayed in anywhere ....”
Reviews.Author: VikeST
Reviews.Content: .. and I even booked the 'superiore' for my wife and I .... and then the internet was supposedly temporarily unavailable for my entire 4 night stay .... only positives were the service and breakfast .. but definately not worth the high price tag

Reviews.Title: “We had a grand time...hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: ML G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located for all of our activities. The staff was very nice and accomodated our every question as seasoned professionals. The size of the hotel was perfect...not too big, but big enough to have all the amenities any one could want. We do hope to return...from breakfast to happy hour, everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen318
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful but the hotel itself definitely needs to some updating. Having said that, the hotel is very well located and easily accessible to many sites. They also have a bar open late and an early breakfast which was nice as we had a morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobbesey
Reviews.Content: Before I stay at any hotel I read the reviews including the negatives. I like to see what people say are the problems. In my first day, I feel the hotel is great I wanted to add something. My wife and I arrived early. We knew our room might not be ready. That was okay. They had a place for us to change and leave our bags. The piazza del Popolo was only a 2 minute walk. Also close is the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. All in a the minute walk. The staff could not have been any friendlier. They were courteous and very polite as well as helpful. Then again, I think people responded how they are treated. You treat them well they will treat you well. If you are American, you might think the room is on the small time. To me seemed like a room in any city in Europe. We had plenty of room in the deluxe to put our stuff away and still had space. The room is very cozy for 2 and we were NOT tripping over one another. I was very impressed I thought is would right a review before our stay is even over.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along withour two daughters, travelled to Rome to celebrate our youngest daughter's 21st birthday. On arrival at the River Palace, we were greeted with scafolding and workmen in the bar area where we were asked to wait as our rooms were not ready. It was late afternoon and one would expect the rooms to be available at tis time. We had booked two rooms, one double and one twin, yet when we arrived at our daughters' room it was a double. We had booked the holiday months in advance and this was one of the booking criteria, along with a of bottle bubbly and a birthday cake (this went mouldy and was unedible!). Many hours and calls to our holiday rep and the hotel manger later, the hotel moved our daughters into two single rooms for one night until they had a free twin room on our second night. We were only there for a weekend break! The hotel itself was a great disappointment. To get to our rooms on the second floor, we had to enter a lift which only went to the first floor. The second lift was so small that only two people could travel in it at one time. The rooms were very small. Our bathroom had a shower which was smaller than the one in our touring caravan. The girls' room had a bath which was scratched and damaged. The corridors were in need of some care, as were the damaged walls in our rooms. In our room, the curtains had holes in them. All the carpets were stained and damaged, particularly where they joined where they were fraying. The veiw from the bedroom window was over a noisy street, opposite a graffitti covered wall and right by the end of a tram line. Breakfast was ok, but the drinks were awful, the tea like dishwater and the coffee too strong. The whole experience dampened our daughter's special day, a day that cannot be taken again as we travelled on her 21st! I would not recommend this hotel at all and would advise people to look elsewhere for their stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best part could have been when they told me they didn't have a room.”
Reviews.Author: blnk
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I was met with "we have a small problem. . . no room for you tonight." If only they had said, "no room for you for your entire stay. . . " They put me up at a comparable **** hotel, but they definitely grade on a big curve in Rome - I cannot imagine what a *** or ** is. They didn't even have the courtesy to pay the hotel tax at the place they sent me ! The second night I returned to the River Palace and found that this is at best a ** place in the US, but it was more like a &$^()@#*@*#&$ place for me. Each time I returned to the room, the power never worked so I would have to take the silly two different elevator rides to get from my 2nd floor room to the lobby to get someone to come up and turn on the breakers down the hallway. Beware, the walls are thin. The location is on the wrong side of the tracks. The donuts at the breakfast were the highlight, but you have to eat them in the windowless breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and in a magical City!”
Reviews.Author: Hlostar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace hotel from the 21st to 25th July and what a great experience. Before arriving at the hotel we contacted them to ask about transfers from the airport - they responded that day with prices and once we confirmed they arranged it all for us. They were even able to offer tour suggestions and restaurants all via email. So anyway to the actual holiday - we arrived early Thursday morning and were greeted at the arrivals by our private transfer. Lovely air conditioned mercedes and a really great driver - Alessandro. He gave us loads of hints and tips about getting round the city from our hotel and a nice pizzeria 10mins from the hotel called "Pizza Re", definitely worth a visit! On arrival to the hotel we were expecting to have to wait till 14:00 to check in but were really happy to find out that our room was ready, so we went into the bar and waited for the concierge to come and show us to our room. The room was lovely. We had a superior room so no suite and ok in comparison to the hotel rooms in the US it was on the small side but it was more than adequate. There was a large wardrobe, flat screen TV (however only Italian channels), a mini bar and the bathroom had a bath and shower head. The room was also air conditioned, which is a must for July in Rome! Breakfast was included in our rate and as other people have said was perfect! We went either early, 7am or late, 9:10am, and it was never over crowded. There was hot food, continental breakfast - pretty much anything you could ask for. I fell in love with their muesli! My husband enjoyed the cooked breakfast every morning. We went to the bar every evening for a drink before going to bed, the bar area surpassed our expectations. It was lovely and cool which is great after walking around the city, the decor was modern but still "Rome" and the drinks were half price between 6 and 10pm! I enjoyed the Grapefruit juice, was so refreshing, and their glasses of wine were huge. The front desk were really friendly. We asked for advice on getting across the city a few times and they really wanted to help. It was also a really nice touch every evening returning to your room to find your bed turned down, a couple of sweets and a weather forecast for the following day. All in all a really great hotel, the decor inside is so Rome that it just rounded of our whole trip to the magical city.

Reviews.Title: “River Palace Delivered As Advertised - Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: yooperscooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, 25-27 June 2011. Got to hotel early due to flight schedule, had to wait for room to be ready but was in the room before advertised check-in. Yes, rooms are small so let's move on. Given everything positive this hotel has going for it, a small room is very tolerable. Lobby is comfortable, happy hour is fantastic, breakfast buffet rivaled the cruise ship we went on not in size but in selection and freshness). ATM located just outside the front door. Cafes located within a 2 block walk toward Piazza de Popolo. We walked everywhere except to Vatican (2 subway stops) and Colliseum (several subway stops). Metro is 2 block away, very convenient. We booked a few extras with our rooms (2 couples). We booked the 3-hour walking tour and it was far beyond our expectations. We expected 3 hours form the hotel. No, we were picked up by van and transported to a tour agency and joined many others on a highly organized bus/walking tour with excellent guide. Visited Trevi Fountain (early in morning when there were few people), Pantheon, several Piazzas, and St. Peter's Square. By chance it was on Sunday and we even got blessed by the Pope! We got good recommendations on cafes for dinner near Piazza de Novano. A great value on this option. We also booked with the room dinner at Freschetta Brunetti (sp?). Again only 5-10 minutes from hotel front door. More food than we could eat, all the wine we wanted, and the waiter's sang opera!! A memorable 2 hours. I can't think of any negatives except the room size and that is such a minor issue given all the positives. We will stay here again any time we go back to Roma. And yes, Freddie is a charm.

Reviews.Title: “The location was great, but...”
Reviews.Author: BluePersuasion
Reviews.Content: The location, being so close to the Metro, was wonderful. They're also adequately close enough to most of the attractions like the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps if traveling on foot. The Metro is perfect for getting out to see the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, and the Roman Forum. If you've never been to Rome, be prepared -- it's packed -- but it's nice to have as an option. As for the hotel, the staff was friendly and helpful. However, we had an issue with our room where the first two nights of our four-night stay, the AC wasn't working at all. I don't know if it was just our room as I didn't hear anybody else complaining -- AND the AC worked very well in the lobby. But after our first night and sweating all through our attempted sleep, we said something at the front desk. They couldn't move us, so they gave us an oscillating fan. Great, but all it did was blow the warm air around. By the second morning, we were miserable. After that they were able to get us a portable AC unit to use as they still didn't have any open rooms to move us into. That worked okay (though it had a vent that fed outside which required the window be open all the time); but the last morning we were there, the unit almost flooded our suitcase as it backed up water into the room. Their breakfast was the best of the three places we stayed in Italy -- much larger than anyone would think.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: HingenBracket
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely short break here. This hotel is small but very comfortable and has a nice 'feel ' about it.. Breakfast very good . We found we could walk to many of the sights and for things further afield we used the hop on bus. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: serserou
Reviews.Content: Great location easy accessible to metro and bus lanes as well as the city-tour buses. You can easily walk to the major sightseeing of Rome. The rooms had good linens and pillows, pretty classic and renascent decoration with nice painted ceilings. The breakfast was very good with big variety and a lot of traditional products (I especially enjoyed the salami!). What I found especially nice was the next day weather forecast service the hotel had with a maid distributing special little weather-notes in every room. The business centre with two computers and the free internet access was also a plus, as well as the happy-hours at the bar that was a good alternative if you are very tired to get out for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Immaculately Clean”
Reviews.Author: jlbtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family members for 9 nights in mid July. There were 8 adults (4 couples) in our party and we had booked our 4 superior rooms 7 months in advance. However, 2 of the 4 rooms we had reserved were not available upon our check-in. The desk staff apologized & located 2 alternate "classic" rooms (smaller) for their first night. Upon my insistence the 2 couples (one couple was on their honeymoon) were then transferred to "upgraded" deluxe rooms without additional charge for the remaing 8 nites. The manager also provided each of the 2 couples with a complimentary bottle of wine. Although the upgraded rooms included a bathtub with shower the 2 deluxe rooms did not seem as large as the superior rooms we had booked. Note to the Hotel: When overseas travelers arrive they are exhausted, excited and desire to be accommodated. The poor desk clerk had to listen to my angry rants but could do nothing until the manager came in several hours later. Overall we were finally satisfied but this was a very bad way to start our stay which we had been planning for many months and had repeatedly sent & received confirmations to/from the hotel in advance of our arrival. Re: Booking through the Hotel's Website: It appears their booking system does not work properly which resulted in our unavailable room problem. It is also impossible to make any changes to reservations when booking through their website. You are required to cancel the whole reservation and start over. Even e-mails to the desk months prior to our arrival requesting changes were unsuccessful. They need to upgrade their on-line booking system to avoid such hassles and problems in the future. The Superior Rooms were quite spacious for European standards, hotel is immaculately clean and the staff is quite helpful whenever we requested assistance with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. The breakfasts are AWESOME -- the staff even prepared cappucino's for us each morning. The half price drinks with snacks for the happy hour in the lovely lobby/lounge area is a very welcome idea. Beds & pillows are very comfortable. If staying on 2nd floor or higher, you need to take 2 elevators but this quirky little scheme was no problem at all. At least they have working elevators! Air conditiong was great too -- especially since several days during our stay were in the high 90's and very hot. Location is super - just 2 block walk to metro/subway, about 3 or 4 blocks to the buses or shops. Can also walk to most sites. Overall we had a great stay. I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, friendly staff & reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: lolojones
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay In Rome. We were there for one night and wanted a nice comfortable base, close to the main attractions with breakfast. This hotel was awesome! Breakfast was better than any i'd had in Italy thus far and the hotel go the extra mile to make your trip enjoyable. We were upgraded to a superior room because they hadn't prepared our room when we had checked in. If I had one bad thing to say, it would be the carpets!! Horrid mustard yellow colour and worn out - and there's this crazy small lift that car barely fit 2 people in. But really, that' all I can say. Will stay here again if we return to Rome - JUST PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BundabergOllie48
Reviews.Content: Wonderful trip to Rome, made perfect by my stay for 8 days at the River Palace, sych attention to detail, great staff, great breakfast and 'happy hour'. Definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariahcuevas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Palace Hotel with my grand-daughter for a week. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and ready to help with suggestions and directions. The hotel is located less than a block away from the train station. Great restaurants in the area. The breakfast was fantastic with a great selections of cereals, fruits, etc. Will go back for sure when visiting Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: StuartC1978
Reviews.Content: Easy to find and easy walk to the main attractions in the city. What a city! The breakfast is superb, the rooms small (as per any city in Europe) but perfect. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and provided us with everything we needed. The happy hour with food was greatly appreciated. Have already recommended the hotel to friends and would definitely return. Thank you River Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Goingplaces11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at the River Palace Hotel and overall, my experience at the hotel was good. The room was very clean and the bedding was very comfortable. The washroom was quite nice as well. Breakfast was very good. There was a good variety of meats, cheese, pastries, yogurts etc. The wifi connection was terrible- we had to use the computers downstairs in the lobby which were often very busy. The hotel is on a quiet street so there were no issues with noise however, the area that the hotel is located in looks a bit run down. You should be aware that It is NOT in a very central location. Most of the tour buses would not pick us up or take us to the hotel because it was too far. With that said, it is very close to the metro and close to the Piazza de Popolo and not too far from the Spanish steps. It was a long ways away from the other big attractions.

Reviews.Title: “They gave us a free upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Manningjen
Reviews.Content: Quiet, near the Flaminia Metro stop, helpful staff, elegant interior. Efficient A/C!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, INDEPENDANT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: pippa154
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the River Palace on a four day trip to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We found all the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly and they could not do enough to make our trip pleasurable and smooth. As most reviews state here the breakfast was fantastic with pastries, croissants, cooked breakfast, yoghurt, cheese, flans, fresh fruit, smoked salmon, champagne, juice, tea and coffee available every morning - What a great start to any day! The happy hour was great as otherwise drinks would be pretty expensive, but all were half price between 6-10, great after a long, hot day on the tourist trail. Bar provides all manner of snacks including sandwiches, olives, corn snacks, crisps, pastries for free around late afternoon, early evening every day we were there which were welcome in the 'hungry period' between lunch and evening meal! The location was great with everything being walkable. Colloseum and Vatican are a longer walk at around 45 minutes but the Spanish Steps are 5-10 minutes along with the Borghese Park. Piaza Popolo is 2 mins along the road. The Trevi Fountain is about 20-25 minutes walk. We had a deluxe room which was great for us although, yes, a little smaller than most English rooms. We really only slept in our room as there was so much to see outside. It had a TV, desk, wardrobe, drawers, safe and minibar. The bathroom was absolutely fine with a shower over the bath and a glass screen. All very clean with beautiful bed linen. The only negative we found, which has nothing to do with the hotel, was it was very difficult to find somewhere decent to eat. Be careful of any restaurants on the street with nice canopies over (there are lots of them), we ate in these once or twice and it cost us a fortune for pizza which was no better than here in the UK! One lovely restaurant was 'Porto di Ripetta' which was recommended to us by the hotel staff and is only 5 minutes walk away and serves lovely food at a reasonable price. It's best not to eat in any restaurants near the major attractions. All in all, brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service and not honest!”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in December 2010 for our June 2011 trip. When we arrived to check in, they took our luggage and escorted us to the lobby lounge area where we were told that someone would be with us to tour the hotel in a couple of minutes. After waiting over half an hour we go back to the desk and are told that they overbooked and are looking for a room for us at another hotel. After another half hour we are finally told that they found us another room at an equivalent hotel. Well, their equivalent hotel had peeling wallpaper, stained carpet, tile pulling off the wall, chipped furniture, moldy caulk in the tub, and the room smelled. They know how to take the reservation-they just don't know how to keep the reservation. And to keep a customer waiting after you misled them is not right. Even less right is dumping them in an inferior hotel when you do it.

Reviews.Title: “Have already recommended to friends!”
Reviews.Author: jenfitz76
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very clean and luxurious and fully air conditioned. I've never seen such a fabulous breakfast! all staff are very polite and helpfull, and the cherry on top is happy hour from 6-10pm every night when drinks are half price, perfect if coming back from from a long hot day, or for a couple of drinks before heading out (also lots of free sandwiches and nibbles on the bar as well). It is in an excellent location and within easy walking distance to many of the main attracions. We stayed in a superior double which we felt was plenty big enough for a long weekend. You will not be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - I highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: calpaul47
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 5 nights in June, 2011 based upon reviews of prior guests. My experience was better than expected. Great breakfasts, clean and spacious rooms (for Europe), excellent service, people at front desk were superb. Within walking distance of Spanish Steps, Forum, Colliseum, etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Book a Car with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: essuu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break at the River Palace Hotel for our Silver Anniversary. The hotel is fine and as many the reviews state it is very clean, nice breakfasts, rooms on the small side. As the hotel is situated outside the zone for airport taxi fixed rate (40 euro). I booked a car through the hotel, this costs 55 euro but was a limo and there would be a driver at the airport to meet us on arrival. I thought this would be a nice start to our time in Rome. Unfortunately my flight was delayed for over 9 hours and I received a phone call from the hotel whilst I was still at Manchester Airport. I explained that I was delayed but had understood that the driver would be monitoring flight times as he had been passed all the details of my flight and this is normal procedure. I received two further calls whilst still at the airport telling me I was liable for additional charges as the driver had waited for me for several hours. Upon arrival in Rome there was no car waiting and I made my way to the hotel by taxi and was greeted with less than a warm welcome. The following day I discussed the matter with the manager who was very understanding of the situation. He said that the hotel had incurred a charge of 50 euros but said that it would not be charged to me. As a goodwill gesture I informed him that I would pay half of this to which he agreed was approriate. Sadly at check out time, I was harrassed over the 50 euros the hotel had paid despite me paying the 25 euros. In addition I did not receive a receipt. This put something of a dampener on our time at the River Palace Hotel. Apart from this, Rome is a fantastic place to visit and I would not put anyone off using this hotel, just dont book a car through them.

Reviews.Title: “Small intimate hotel near Santa Maria del Popolo”
Reviews.Author: smog100
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Popolo plaza on a quiet street. Got superior standard room. Adequate size, very nicely furnished. New AC - great in the hot weather. Nice bar area with free bar food around dinner time. Free internet. Very accommodating hotel staff - directions, phone calls, etc. Good location for subway and buses. Near some major attractions. Great buffet breakfast! Only negative was very small shower stall in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but very clean”
Reviews.Author: momofmombo
Reviews.Content: Location near Piazza Del Popolo was good but area surrounding hotel isn't that nice. not in downtown Rome. Front desk staff could have been more friendly. Breakfast was nice. Rooms very small but that is typical for Europe. Very clean. Still an enjoyable stay. Freddy the bell hop was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Louise528752
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days in June to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. When we arrived we had originally booked a superior room but found we had been upgraded to a delux room which was a nice suprise. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly at all times and we couldnt find fault with any of the service. The room was great with everything we needed and the happy hour at the bar was an added bonus.Breakfast was fantastic with everything to choose from and constantly refilled by the staff. We would definately stay here again and would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exige28
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the River Palace in June 2011. On arrival staff were very friendly and this remained consistent throughout our stay - we were always warmly greeted when coming and going from the hotel. The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. The room was fairly small (we had a classic double) but was more than suitable for our needs (it included a safe in the cupboard). There was an attractively painted ceiling and the furniture and decoration added an historic Roman feel which we enjoyed. The bathroom had a shower but no bath. The room was next to the elevator shaft but this didn't prove to be too noisy - if we had been staying longer than 2 night we may have asked for a different room. Breakfast was very good and included: hot buffet options (bacon, sausage, mushrooms, scrabbled egg and hash browns), cold meats, cheeses, bread/toast, cereal and a wide selection of pastries. Prosecco was also available on a help your self basis which was rather nice. We ate quite early and never had any issues with getting a table. The hotel bar had a 50% off happy hour lasting between 6pm-10pm and included everything but bottled champagne (with the discount: Cocktails were €5, a coke was €1.25). We found this to be a great place to enjoy a drink without having to pay the over the top tourist prices of bars around Rome. The hotel is towards the north of the city and very close to the Park Borghese - which I would recommend taking some time to stroll around. We walked to all tourist sites within Rome from this hotel although it does take longer to get to places than you might at first imaging (small roads and busy pavements) - some example times with a fairly brisk walk: Colosseum 45minutes, Trevi Fountain 25minutes, Vatican City 45m, Train Station 1hr.

Reviews.Title: “Not as we expected”
Reviews.Author: rossella91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful position just next to "Piazza del Popolo" in the citi centre. Again, the hotel looks like luxurious and the staff is helpful. Neverthless, the size of the room was not so good, it was too little and it was veri difficult for us to move inside. There was a fridge-bar (u must pai for it), a nice bed veri confortable and nice sheets and towels, a tv, hair drier and I must sai ani confort. However the bathrrom was ok but smelli, realli! I do not what the problem was about it but we couldn't stai in too long causa it was terrible! We just used the room to sleep. The breakfast was continental and a lot of food and sweets were there for us. But the qualiti of food was bad. I recomand to not eat sweets because thei were not fresh, I mean thei were there since long time...so we were disappointed about it. The beverage was ok, mani things and good. I would recommend this hotel for the position but just if the price is good because it is not a 4 stars, I have been in 3 stars hotels which were much better, realli!Aniwai, mani little regards were done for the guests as for instance we got everi dai a card with the weather and temperature before going out, little sweets on the desk, apples too. There is an happi hour in the evening but u must pai with a 50% discount.We did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: alanpast1
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel located in an excellent location near the Metro and walking distance to many of the wonderful parts of Rome. Very impressed with the breakfast and only wished we had more time to enjoy all the food (too many tours). The room was small but comfortable with a dynomite bathroom. First class hotel with amazingly helpful staff throughout. can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Farniente17
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with 5 couples to Rome for 3 days en route to a cruise on the Amalfi Coast. We wanted to see as much of Rome as possible prior to the cruise. Another friend had recommended the River Palace, and we were not disappointed. It is about 2 blocks from the Piazza del Popolo, a great spot for people watching, and a little less to a metro stop. From here you can reach most of the major highlights of Rome either on foot or metro. The staff at this hotel made us feel welcome from the time we booked our reservation. We had several questions, and responses to our emails came within an hour or so. Most spoke great English, so language was never a problem. They were helpful about arranging transportation either for airport pickup, local tours, or to the port of Civitavecchia, and knowledgable about activities in town that would cause crowds we might want to avoid. The breakfast buffet (included in our room pkg) was wonderful, and more than expected. Happy hour every afternoon in the bar included some good appetizers as well. The rooms are small, as are most in Rome, but make up for size in the quality, cleanliness, and elegance of the decor. Have been in Rome before and stayed near the forum, and much prefer this location for seeing the most in the least amount of time. Cannot recommend highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “must go back!”
Reviews.Author: xbeckyx_11
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault anything about this hotel. The staff, location and facilities were all first class. This hotel was recommended to me and I would without a doubt recommend it again. I hope I will be able to stay again in the future as it really was a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A short Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jdfbu96
Reviews.Content: While we were there only two nights, we managed to secure an upgrade to a junior suite for an extra charge and it was worth it. The entire staff was servicable, friendly and helpful. It was only a few steps to Plaza del Popollo with a variety of restaurants to pick from. The Happy Hour on every night was affordable, 50% off all drinks, with plenty of high quality snacks, a light dinner itself if you prefered to stay in on a given night. The breakfast buffet was the finest one in all of the hotels we stayed in our three weeks in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DebMG Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, having got a good deal via Octopus Travel. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel very welcome by every member of staff that we encountered. The room was very nice: clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was included in our package, and did not disappoint; there was a wide choice of hot and cold foods available including gorgeous cakes, and even a glass of Prosecco should you fancy it. The location of the hotel was excellent, only a few metres away from Piazza del Popolo (on the opposite side to the crowded, tourist filled streets, so more peaceful), and approximately 10-15 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps. The Trevi Fountain was probably around a 30 minute stroll away, but if you like to explore on foot, this was a great hotel from which to do that. We got the metro to the Vatican, as there was a metro station close to the hotel. The metro was cheap and easy to navigate on. If you're looking for a good, reasonably priced restaurant, please try La Sella del Diavolo, which is literally over the road from the hotel. It does not really catch your eye from the outside, but the service and the food was fantastic, and we had a very enjoyable evening there. All in all, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, and if we return to Rome, we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful hotel and impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: Pantilesdoctor
Reviews.Content: The River Palace Hotel was a great hotel 30 mins walk from the Palazzo Venezia close to which I attended a conference, which was a very enjoyable walk given it was through central Rome. Also, only a 10 minute walk from the Airport Shuttle Bus stop at Piazza Cavour- only 8 Euros one way. Saves on taxi and train fares. The staff were extremely helpful, inviting and polite. The breakfast, included in the room rate, was superb. However as with other reviews, accommodation space was limited. We were offered a larger room to the Classic one I had booked, as they could see we would struggle with the tiny size of the Classic room. The upgrade was an extra 20 euros a night for the Superior Room but worth it if there is more than one of you staying. The bathroom was clean, well stocked with tolietries, robes, high quality fittings and soft towels, and the upgrade meant we had a bath as well as a shower. Worth noting you have to take a lift from the ground floor to the first one to access any of the upper floors- either via a second (tiny) lift or the stairs. Overall, however, was a lovely experience. Also appreciated the free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Experiment that will awaken the claustrophobic in you!”
Reviews.Author: hblnk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and the bathrooms are clean. I will give it that much. The rest of our experience was not so nice. Our room was so small we could not believe it. We would not have had room for a second piece of luggage. The space between the foot end of the bed and the wall was 12 inches. My wife and I are normal built - 5 ft 10, 140 pounds, but we could not move in the room simultaneously. To pack and unpack one of us had to hide in the bathroom or on the corridor. Cleaning staff thought it was a one person room as well: they give us only one towel. At the prices asked, this is a scandal. I am actually wondering whether it is legal to offer a room so small for double occupancy. International Human Rights standards put the limit for solitary confinement at 11 square meters, but this room was smaller. And a small bed too, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: dIngle_doo
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for a long weekend, everything about this hotel was nice. Perfect location - max walk to a place of interest was around 40minutes. The breakfast was delicious with a wide variation of food and drinks.Happy hour was really nice - with snacks included. The staff were VERY friendly and couldnt do enough for you,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Haeuser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the River Palace and it was a truly enjoyable Experience in every way. The room was very clean with turndown service. The extended Happy Hour with half-price drinks and snacks was much Appreciated. The breakfast buffet was extensive, delicious and a great way To start the day. But, first and foremost, is the truly wonderful staff, Efficient, Courteous, helpful and ALWAYS friendly. Kudos especially to Sergio and Tatiana. And, two free computers in the lobby. if you are looking for A super place to stay in Rome, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “It really is palatial”
Reviews.Author: rvb10
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome so I do not profess to know much about the competitor hotels. But, I can say that it is unimaginable to us to think that there are any better hotels in the city. Our room was truly palatial and the entire hotel staff were nothing less than wonderful during our 4 night stay. Centrally located, 100 meters from the subway, ability to walk to the Vatican, (about 30minutes), Spanish steps, (about 10minutes), upscale and moderate shopping (10 minutes) and a block from the Piazza Popolo (gateway to everything). Our guide spent 8 hours with us touring Rome by car and foot and we were never more than 30 minutes from the hotel and that includes the catacombs. We would strongly suggest hiring a private guide when visiting the Vatican and purchase your tickets online prior to arrival. Your guide and pre purchased tickets will save you hours standing on line. A truly exceptional hotel in a charming and vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - even after the 3rd trip”
Reviews.Author: ZIGGY2536
Reviews.Content: Before our Med cruise 2 years ago May we stayed in Rome for 3 nights, River Palace was our choice. We were impressed enough that we booked another 3 nights again before another Med cruise. Needless to say we were not disappointed the 2nd time either. Great staff, great breakfast buffet & great location. Oh ! after the cruise we stayed 1 more night ! 6 Stars would be a better ranking.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 209972Mary777
Reviews.Content: My children booked a weekend in Rome for my husband and myself as a birthday present and I am so glad they chose River Palace.The location is perfect, the ambience superb and, the staff are extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Our room, although a bit on the small side, was clean and comfortable. We did not come to Rome to spend much time in the room anyway!! The free internet access in the lobby allowed us to print our boarding tickets (helped by the kind guy on the front desk). The breakfasts were eagerly looked forward to and catered for every taste. I put on a few pounds in two days as I could not resist the appealing sweet pastries - in addition to everything else on offer!! In the evening the allure of the happy hour is hard to resist- especially as the prices are very very reasonable and there is a constant supply of tasty freshly made sandwiches and other nibbles. My husband is a vegetarian and within seconds he was handed his own plate of cheese and tomato sandwiches. All the staff cannot do enough to ensure your stay is memorable. The location is excellent. In fact we had intended taking a bus tour, but once we started walking we discovered we could see Rome on foot - and we are no spring chickens!! There is an abundance of water taps everywhere so I would advise anyone to keeping filling up their water bottles for free and keep hydrated. I would definitely recommend Rome for the perfect break and if you stay at the River Palace you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GlennOrlando
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were told our room wasn't available the first night due to an overbooking. They put us up in another similar hotel a couple of blocks away and paid for our taxi over. The next day they had our bags transferred while we were out sightseeing. They upgraded our room for the remaining 5 nights and gave us a nice bottle of chianti with their apologies. The staff was very professional, friendly and helpful. Their English was excellent. The breakfast was very good, with eggs, bacon, quiche, and a large assortment pastries and cookies. The location is good, just north of the Plaxa del Popolo about one block north of the Flaminio Metro. It's an easy walk down to the Spanish Steps, but be sure you stop at the churches in the plaza. It was a good first experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: DJW1957
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay and we were very impressed. The hotel is clean and the rooms are well equipped. The hotel is very easy the reach from the metro, although we almost walked past it, as it is quite subtle from the outside. The location is great, all the major sights are walkable - if you don't fancy walking the metro system is cheap and easy to find your way round. Breakfast was really nice with plenty of choice of hot & colds items. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The bar had a happy hour from 6.00 until 10.00 when all drinks, except coffee & champagne, are half price - great value !! The bar also had loads of crisps, nuts, olives etc in constant supply. I couldn't find any fault with this hotel and would certainly use it again....

Reviews.Title: “other than bait-and-switch, it was a good experience”
Reviews.Author: JimBobTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed "Jet Lag Special" package that included airport pickup at Fiumicino in the total price. After we booked it and had written email confirmation, they scheduled the beatification of Pope John Paul for the weekend we were going to be there. We then got an email that said "Due the high occupancy we closed the Jet Lag Package and there is not possibility to book". So we paid an extra 55 Euro for a pickup. The hotel is very nice, the staff friendly and well trained, the breakfast is one of the best we've had in Europe and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: robbogee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 minutes from Piazza del Popolo, the northern gateway to the ancient city. The metro is close, and there is a tram stop if you need to go further north, e.g. Stadio Flaminio. Our room was not very big, but this is common in Rome. It was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The breakfast was more than adequate, with a huge choice of meats, cheeses, pastries, fresh fruit, etc., with scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage for the Brits. The staff were very efficient and friendly, and the "happy hour" from 6pm to 10pm included half-price drinks with free snacks, although I don't know if this is available all year round. We had a good discount by booking through Expedia and would certainly book again if we return to Rome. We paid a bit extra for the hotel's limo transfer from Ciampino, but Alessandro Marconi (www.toplimo.it) showed us some of the sights on the way and was very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: chase555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Palace Hotel to celebrate his 50th birthday on our first trip to Italy - it was a wonderful and very memorable experience! The hotel was very clean, the location was within walking distance of the major sights, the staff was helpful and polite, the breakfast buffet was FANTASTIC, the daily happy hour with complimentary appetizers was a definite bonus, and the internet access in the lobby was much appreciated. We were very impressed with the hotel and will recommend it to friends and family, The River Palace is a wonderful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL, STAFF, BREAKFAST BUFFET”
Reviews.Author: ronpar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 55th anniversary at the River Palace Hotel. We booked our stay via the internet based on Trip Advisor positive reviews. The River Palace did not disappoint in any respect. The entire staff starting with our initial greeting from Freddy the door man with the genuine friendly smile and assistance to Sergio, the Concierge (and jack of all trades), who took care of all of our needs via the internet prior to our arrival and then in person, could not have made our stay more enjoyable. It is easy to see why the River Palace is rated in the top 30 of over 1200 hotels in Rome. No where have we ever experienced a more complete and delicious breakfast buffet than at this hotel. Not to be forgotten....this hotel is CLEAN....CLEAN....CLEAN. Yes, the Superior rooms are a little small....BIG DEAL...we didn't go to Rome to lounge around a hotel room all day.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: dreamer63_10
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, the staff are very helpful , the rooms are small but very clean and nicely decorated. The hotel is very clean and well maintained . The bar is very reasonable compared to many hotel prices and are served with great snacks, great place to unwind with after a hectic day sightseeing. The breakfast was out of this world and a great way to start the day especially with a bucks fizz. The hotel is well situated and you can easily walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The only dissappointment was the bus company the hotel recommended "ciao roma" they were more expensive, and were less frequent than the other companies of which there were six. Go to the bus stop and decide there. The nearest stop was outside the Gusto restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Smallest Deluxe Room in Europe”
Reviews.Author: vcs049
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on trip advisor about the small rooms my sister and I booked a deluxe room. We were extremely disappointed with the size of our room and when we queried with reception the category of our room we were advised it was a deluxe room - we were not convinced. This was the smallest room I have had in over thirty years of extensive travel in Italy and other parts of Europe (we travel to Northern Italy from Australia twice a year for business).. The hotel is well located and presented and overall the staff are friendly, Would we stay again, probably not, unless we were assured of a larger room..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Choice, Good Value, would choose again”
Reviews.Author: happy2bmeLaDolceVita
Reviews.Content: Texted hotel from restaurant as forgot husband's 40th birthday was at midnight, asked if they could bring something at midnight and they did. Very courteous, clean, Upgraded up to suite, 2 flat screes, 2 fridges, husband LOVED satellite TV so he could watch USA Gator game :(. Breakfast was hot with free mimosas (great way to start day :).
