Shuttle to airport was new Mercedes Van. Great Hotel, walking distance to most everywhere. Subway entrance is on corner <1block, but want to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Above and beyond!!!”
Reviews.Author: insureit74
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the River Palace Hotel, the entire facility was beautiful and Barbara the Receptionist as well as the bell hop Freddie really made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: mickpharris
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the River Palace over easter. On arrival we were shown our small room and so we upgraded for 25 euros a night. The hotel has no ironing facilities and they told me this is because irons are not allowed in rome hotels, i can't find any mention of this on line. The hotel is in a decent location, the breakfast is good and the staff are helpful. The hotel is ok as a base for a few days, not sure its 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at River Palace”
Reviews.Author: Geary58
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from the reviews and we were not disappointed we had a junior suite on the top floor with a roof top terrace which had the morning sun and we could over look the Vatican. The staff were friendly and Simone the barman was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations for a visit to Rome, Italy.”
Reviews.Author: johnwjohnsen
Reviews.Content: The stay was very enjoyeble at the River Palace Hotel. The accomodations were comfortable, the staff was very helpful, especially with providng directions and recommnedations for restaurants. They were also very responsive to any requeste. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: cheops5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while on our honeymoon in Italy. Upon arrival, we were given a choice of upgrading our rooms, and after seeing the room we had booked versus the deluxe room, we opted to pay the extra 20 Euro a night to be upgraded, as the regular room was extremely small. Upon check-in we were also given a complimentary bottle of wine, which was a nice touch. We were very impressed with this hotel, as it was close to the sights, but far enough away for us to feel like we weren't right in the middle of the tourist area. We were surprised to find that we had to take 2 different elevators to get to our room, and as one of them was extremely small, we often took the stairs instead, which helped to work off all the pasta we ate. The people at the front desk were extremely helpful, which we appreciated, especially when it came to choosing a restaurant. The breakfast each morning was wonderful, and the free wi-fi in the room was a great bonus. The only complaint we had was that the bed was a little uncomfortable. Overall, I would say that this is an excellent hotel to stay at for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bakerspencer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the River Palace hotel from April 13th through to April 17th to celebrate our anniversary. The stay was wonderful! My husband and I have been to Italy three times in the last two years and each time we have changed our hotel because we found something lacking. I am happy to say that we now have a new home. Everything was perfect. The customer service was excellent. The hotel is beautifully decorated and extremely clean. The price is also very reasonable and the hotel is worth every penny of it. My husband and I have already booked for next April.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a few years ago.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseWlr
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a room here for our wedding anniversary as a surprise to me, and it was wonderful. We stayed here in 2007 and the only comment I would have made was that the bedroom was so pretty, rather small, not that it mattered, the bathroom more than made up for it! It was spotlessly clean, the breakfast was perfect. and the bar was the perfect place to enjoy a pre-dinner drink before going out in the evening. The staff were very helpful and friendly and it is ideally located, right at the top of the Piazza del Popolo, one of the prettiest places in Rome. The tour bus stops the other side of the Piazza and the tram stops at the top of the road. A lovely hotel and I would definitely stay here if we ever go back to Rome, which I hope we will one day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: mavro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and it really couldn't have been much better. A two minute walk from Piazza de Popolo, 2 minutes from the metro which is very easy to use (The Vatican is only 2 stops away) and about 45 minute walk to the Colosseum. Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain 15 - 25minutes walk. Staff were very helpful and their English was excellent. We had a twin room and a superior double, both were good, not huge, but the twin was more spacious. Rooms at the front overlook the tramway but they are double glazed and noise wasn't a problem. Breakfast is a buffet and the choice was very good, cereal, cooked or continental. Happy hour between 6pm and 10pm with free sandwiches and snacks and the drinks were quite reasonably priced. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MargoE
Reviews.Content: We went for a one day stay in Rome prior to a cruise. This was a lovely hotel. Quiet, luxurious, service oriented. The desk staff speak english very well and did not hesitate to call for us to confirm tours and car arrangements. The happy hour is a delight. Sandwiches, antipasto, cheese and crackers all for free. Drinks were very good. The bar area was very nice with tables and couches and many seating areas. The breakfast the next day included hot and cold items. I could not have asked for more. The rooms are tiny but nice. large windows with nice bedding. Bath with a tub and hand held shower. Toilet and bidet. Good quality toiletries provided. We asked for a fan since it was too early for AC and one was brought up immediately. This is a small hotel very near the metro. We easily explored Rome via the metro the next day. Check out was quick and trouble free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel---tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelguy002
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but do not get the classic room---it is big enough only for one person in a pinch. We had to upgrade to a deuxe room to be able to fit 2medium suitcases. The front desk would not change a 5e note! The breakfast is fabulous but if they say it starts at 6:30---count on 7am! ALso it took 2 tries to find out that the heat was turned off but it was too early to turn on the air con so the room was a little warm without the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fifer75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at River Palace Hotel on a four day trip and over all were happy to have made the choice. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes walk from Flaminio Subway Station and the Piazza Del Popolo and from there all the major attractions are a couple of subway stops or no more than 30 minutes walk. impressed by the location and the cleanliness of the hotel. We stayed in a Deluxe Room and to be honest I'm glad we did. The room was on the small side and I wouldn't have like to have been in a Standard as it may have been just too small. That said the bathroom was of a decent size and the shower was powerful and to be honest if you go to Rome to sit in your room you are missing the point of going. One problem that would no doubt have given us trouble in high summer was that the air conditioning was not the best. However small our room was, this did not put us off this hotel; the breakfast was included in our rate and was a typical European buffet style with food for all tastes from hot bacon and eggs to a large selection of cheese and cold meats together with a choice of pastries. On a side note the morning coffee was excellent. The hotel lounge has a "Happy Hour" from 6pm until 10pm which serves 1/2 price drinks (probably the cheapest Cocktails in Rome) and has a complementary selection of bar snacks and sandwiches which is a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others, the staff were friendly, always helpful and spoke excellent English which saved by terrible Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: vaitiekiene
Reviews.Content: The River Palace is in a great location just a few minutes to the Piazza del Popolo from which you can go afoot to the most famous places of Rome. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff was pleasant and helpfull. The hotel has everything you need: rich breakfast with the cold ang hot meals, vegetables, fruits and cakes, happy hours in the bar with half price drinks and wine and snack type food, free internet access with possibility to print the documents, well setted rooms.... The rooms are clean and quiet. The room service is nice (every evening we got a weather forecast for the next day, as well as choclates on the bed). We would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BzandRh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and was delighted with my choice of hotel. We opted for a superior room based on the comments on room size and found this neat but perfectly formed. The hotel was in a perfect location for exploring the city on foot and happy hour was excellent for keeping costs down. The drinks prices in the hotel were low by Rome standards and to have half price drinks before dinner was ideal. I am surprised by several comments on the inconvenience of needing to use two lifts to access upper floors. The hotel is formed by 2 seperate Roman style town houses - this is not a modern, characterless specially built block and therefore it seems somewhat unfair commenting on the need to change lifts to access parts of the hotel. The stairs also provide a simpler solution. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay there again on any return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: garse04
Reviews.Content: Select this hotel through trip advisor reviews. They where SPOT ON. The hotel is very close to the underground, and near enough to walk to all the major tourist sites. We brought a Roma card that allows you 3 days travel on the underground and 2 museum. Cost 25 euros. Day 1 we walked and took the train back. Day 2 we took the train, to beat the crowds, and walked back. It gave you good flexibility. The breakfast was superb, but the classic room is small. If you just want to sleep and shower it is acceptable. If on the other hand you spend more time in your room will probably find this not acceptable i.e space. The hotel staff are very friendly and the happy hour 6-10pm was fantasic. After a day sight seeing it was really nice to sit and enjoy a reasonable priced beer and glass of wine ! Hopefully one day we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, but the Room was Too Small.”
Reviews.Author: Georpvesq
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon in Italy. We booked the River Palace Hotel while visiting Rome based on the strong reviews written by other users. I have to agree that the location, staff service, and breakfast were exceptional. The room on the other hand was too small. Basically, it consisted of a queen size bed and two night stands and a writing desk. Let's put it this way, I had to hop over the bed to get to the bathroom when my wife is sitting on the writing desk putting on her make up. Speaking of the bathroom, the stand alone shower was so small, I felt claustrophobic in it. By the way, I'm not a big guy (height 5'11 and weigh 165 lbs.) I can't imagine how some one bigger than me can comfortably take a shower in it. Furthermore, the room looked a bit dated and is in need of some updating. Another issue I had was that our room was on the third floor and it was a bit annoying having to take two different elevators just to get to our room. Oh did I mention, one of the elevators barely fit two people.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: russelltravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed three night at the River Palace to celebrate my wife's bitthday and it certainly lived up to the previous reviewers comments. Its location is ideal, just next to Flaminio metro station, and 100m from the Piazza del Popolo, which is reputed to be best the best visual entrance to Rome. We had a classic room, and it was small, we were offered the option of an upgrade to a Superior room, and with hindsight we probally should have gone for it, but as we knew we would be spending a lot of time exploring the city, the room size was'nt that big an issue. However, the standard of the rooms was extremely high, and they were spotless. Breakfast, fantistico! all you could eat, and with the prices in Rome, it is best to fill up in the morning. Piano bar area was lovely, I would have liked the piano to be played, or at least a better choice of music in the bar. Happy hour is 6 to 10pm, take advantage of this as the drinks prices are reasonable then. Staff were brilliant, smilliing Josephine in the bar, the porter Freddy, and the guys on reception, who's names escape me (sorry) plus everyone else were absolutely fantastic, thank you. To sum it up, great location, great staff, goood rooms, good price, fantastic decor, and all in one of the most spectacular cities I have had the pleasure of visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FrankieBorzen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in July 2010. Upon arrival, we were allowed to check into our room early (always appreciated). Some people complain about the size of the room-was it small? Yes. Do you need anything else? No, not in Rome. Our room had a stand up shower, which was also tight. Honestly, I could see an overweight person not being able to use it. The breakfast buffet was great, and allowed us to not purchase breakfast or lunch. Very useful for those on a budget. Also, the free internet was great. The staff were very well informed and polite. My only complaint would be the air conditioning. We are from Florida, so we are used to the heat. I think it was just our room or out section of the hotel, but it was not working properly. Rome in July gets pretty hot. However, this would not prevent us from returning to the River Palace. The location is great. Some people might not want to be at the "top" of Ancient Rome, but we found it to be a great location that gave us superior access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, excellent staff - My Hotel in ROME!!!”
Reviews.Author: SAzoulai
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor and they are spot on. The rooms are small but comfortable and very quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fantastic. Nice touch was a bottle of wine left in the room for my wife birthday which was during our stay. The bar has happy hour nightly with discounted drinks and wine and snack type food. I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: blior
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend traveld to rome for 5 nights and stayed at this hotel. It simply has it all: - great location. - the rooms are clean and at the size you need (not large, but not too small) - the staff are great and the room service is wonderful! (every night we got a weather forecast for the next day, with to choclates waiting on our bed). - A reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Janney_11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor and they are spot on. Staff are very accommodating. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was the best we've had at any hotel recently, really sets you up for the day. Nice touch was a bottle of wine left in the room for my birthday which was during our stay. If we are asked for a recommendation for a hotel in Rome, the River Palace will definitely be the one we'll tell people about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NarkedStarfish
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from 5 days in Rome and stayed at this excellent hotel. The rooms were perfect for what we wanted and it was nice and quite. The location is excellent - Flaminio Metro and Piazza Popolo are less than 5 mins away. We walked to the Vatican aswell and that only took 20-30 mins. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful The breakfast was fantastic, probably the best we've had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kmez50
Reviews.Content: The River Palace is in a great location and the hotel itself is quite good. The rooms are small but comfortable and very quiet. The beds are firm, (which i appreciated) and 2 apples for your health. The staff pleasant and helpful. The breakfast is large with many choices and good food. The bar has happy hour nightly with discounted drinks and wine and snack type food. I would definitley stay here again for pleasure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: samtogo
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 glorious days at this hotel, had deluxe room so was perfect size, breakfast best ever for variety and happy hour (4 hours) brillant with snacks to keep hunger away. The thing that makes this hotel is the fantastic staff, (thank you Tetyana) who were so helpful and just brilliant with any request, bar man was fantastic (best cocktails), hotel left a gift in our room for my boyfriend's birthday! The location was fatastic, beside metro stop for Vatican and 10 mins walk to Spanish Steps and many restaurants and bars. I never write reviews but this hotel truly deserves to be mentioned, as a globe trotter myself and my boyfriend loved this hotel and have recommended to parents who will be staying next week and will recommend to everyone I know who is planning a trip to Rome. Thank you very much River Palace Hotel, you made our trip to Rome memorable and perfect and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mmfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights as we celebrated our 20th anniversary. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We were welcomed with a personal note form the general manager and a bottle of wine! Friendly staff and willing to go out of their way to help you out. Massimilano was so accommodating when we asked about how to get to the Museum of Rome and even printed out details of the museum in English for us. Gave us a business card to call him in case we should get lost. Now that is service! INcredible breakfast, something there for everyone. Expresso and cappuccino could be made for you, great service. Happy hour at the bar was an added bonus, bartender extremely attentive and helpful. It was a beautiful area to sit , relax and enjoy a drink after a full day of sight seeing. The size of the room didn't bother us. It was spotlessly clean and beautiful decor. A heated towel rack to boot! We were happy with everything. We stayed on the first floor and as someone else stated here, we recommend it . . . no need to take an additional elevator. We liked the location. We walked everywhere! So much to see. Staff was so helpful in giving best walking directions and transit help when we needed it. Plus the area was very quiet. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: spud53 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: we would send any of our friends to this hotel. it is quiet but near to all the sites, within walking distance.is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming - a little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleAD Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of the other Trip Advisor reviews and wasn't disappointed. Friendly, helpful staff, ideally located and, yes, the breakfasts really are as good as everyone says. It's the little touches that make it special - the bucks fizz at breakfast, the fruit and little chocolates left in the room, the free pc use, no charge for the safe, the free nibbles at happy hour etc. We had a standard room which was compact especially the bathroom but this wasn't a problem as we were only there for 3 days and we're both on the small side ourselves. If you are staying for a while, have lots of luggage or need a bit of space, then it's probably best to consider a bigger room. You can easily and enjoyably walk to the major tourist sites but having a metro station on the dorrstep is a real plus. We used it to get to the attractions early to beat the crowds, then bimbled back at our leisure to enjoy the hotel's happy hour before eating at one of the many nearby restaurants. It's definately worth asking for the staff for their recommendations. Our top tip: when visiting the Colloseum, buy your combined Forum/Palantine/Colloseum ticket from the Palantine site as the queues there are much shorter. The ticket is valid for 24 hours so no need to cram all three sites into one day. There wasn't a lot of information on display at the Forum so take a good guide book or get an audioguide/guided tour at the ticket office - you'll need ID (a passport or credit card etc) to hire an audio guide. Having thrown coins in the Trevi, we have guaranteed we'll be returning to Rome - when we do, we'll be booking into the River Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Cald35
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Rome and will most definitely stay again at the River Palace. Sumptuous breakfasts,Comfortable rooms, great location and without exception, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Cozy & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: NGP189400
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and cooperative in all circumstances (had one medical serious issue and had to drive out in the middle of a protest in adjacent Piazza del Popolo.....) Great location (downtown Rome within 5 to 35 minutes of walking). Stylish rooms (rather small by US standards) excellent breakfast. I'll be there again.....

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: zebratrois
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights for our romantic escapade to Rome for Valentine's day and this hotel was perfect choice for such an occasion. The hotel and its rooms are in very good condition, nicely decorated and comfortable. The hotel is also well located, the Flaminio subway station is just a 2 mn walk from the hotel. The personnel was welcoming and helpful. The only downside to this hotel is -as mentionned in other reviews- that the rooms are a bit small and the doors are very well sound-proofed, letting you hear other guests and personnel when they're walking outside your room (but we did not hear noises from other rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry, You Will Be Happy Here.”
Reviews.Author: JMcKerr
Reviews.Content: Yes the 'classic' room is small but well finished with nice touches,marble bathroom again snug,LCD with Sky, room safe big enough for Laptop, the turn down service with the next day weather forecast and a couple of chocolates for examples. The oft talked about 'Happy Hour' was terrific especially as the prices outside of hotel were beyond a joke. Breakfast will now be judged in comparison to the River Palace, this was outstanding, hot and cold, sweet and savoury, fruit and cereals. Staff ready to make your choice of coffee, besides urn of Americano ready to use. Free internet access in room, Reception has ethernet cables for better results if the wifi signal is not great in your room. Right beside Flaminio Metro and the Villa Borghese ParK, if you want to get to Ancient Rome, walk across the Piazza del Popolo and hop on 117 bus, its that easy (provided you remember to get your Metrebus card (€11 for 3 days travel on Metro, bus, tram). I really loved this hotel and the staff are genuinely nice and welcoming , at all times acknowledging your presence with a buongiorno, buona sera etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bergerman2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed on our trip to Rome. The hotel was clean, roomy, and we had great service for the hotel employees. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: courtsidesports
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with marble foyer and bar area with comfortable couches. Happy hour is from 6 to 10 PM and Josephine the bartender always has a smile. Drinks are expensive in Rome so I recommend you take advantage of this perk. Full American breakfast....A whole wall of pastries, than across the room eggs, bacon, and toast along with various breads and fresh fruit. Of course cereal and yogurt and various fruit juices......and here is the best: It is included in the room. You will not find that at many hotels. There is a computer room in the front of the hotel with a computer and wi fi. The staff is very friendly, and will help make your stay as comfortable as possible. Yes, the rooms are small...upgrade if possible. The bathrooms are marble and beautiful. The floor can be slippery, so put towels down... All in all this hotel is a gem in the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but really small room”
Reviews.Author: Zhilin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at River Palace Hotel in Rome in January after read many good reviews of this hotel on tridadvisor.com. We spent 4 nights in Rome then went on to Siena, Florence, Venice and Milan. This is our least favorite among all the hotels we stayed in Italy. We booked a classic room directly through the hotel's website. Upon checking in, we were asked to consider an upgrade to deluxe room at additional costs. We decided not to upgrade but we were shocked to discover how small the classic rooms are! We can't even open our 2 suitcases in the room! The bed was just a super single in the classic room which is too small for 2 adults to sleep in. You can hardly turn around in the bathroom. We had a room at the top floor and it was really hot inside the room, and it was suppose to be winter! We had to keep the window open at night to get some cool air into the room and to make it less stuffy, but there were those birds screaming outside the winder every night so we could hardly sleep through. I guess that you will find this hotel ok if you book a deluxe or even the suite, as the hotel is at a very good location, 1 minute walk to a underground station and to the main shopping street, it is also walking distance to many of the major attractions. It felt like a family-run hotel and the staff are warm and helpful when you need them. Overall this is just an ok hotel in my opinion. I would recommend it for its location but do not get a classic room. Go for the higher category.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing City, Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernii719
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the US from a week long stay at the River Palace and my first thoughts this morning were,"Where is my buffet breakfast and mimosa." The River Palace hotel was very cozy and comfy. I will definitely stay there whenever I return to Rome. The staff was always very nice and respectful. I especially loved the turn down service with expected weather for the following day along with 2 chocolates. Housekeeping was awesome, literally cleaning up after my roommate and I (I stayed in a double room.) Free wifi is available in both the hotel lobby as well as in the rooms. There is also a computer station in the lobby with two desktops that came in handy. I was in Rome on a study abroad trip, and the staff was very welcoming and made their best efforts to accomodate 24 rowdy college students. Its proximity to the Piazza del Popolo is also a major plus. Overall, a very enjoyable stay, and I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this hote!”
Reviews.Author: cookieBelfast
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel having read many good reviews on tripadvisor. Could not fault this hotel. Every member of staff is friendly and helpful. The deluxe room had everything you could require, safe, bath robes, slippers, hair dryer and good toiletries. Very reasonably priced mini bar and snacks. The 'happy hour' from 6-10pm in the bar with free snacks provided, is great for a pre-dinner or after dinner drink (or both)! A lovely breakfast room where everything you could possibly want is provided. Very close to Flaminio metro station, Piazza del Popolo, good restaurants and shopping area. Cannot praise this hotel and its staff highly enough. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Joelly
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel. It is within walking distance of many of the main attractions as well as lots of restaurants. It is traditional and comfortable, with friendly, helpful staff and their advice on restaurants was spot on. (A cheap and cheerful trattoria and something a bit posher for a special occasion) The rooms are a reasonable size, not large but reasonablehad everything we needed including a safe that would take a lap top. Lots of choice at breakfast and a nice bar area. This wasn't used by many people, maybe because it was a quiet time of year, but there half price drinks with complimentary nibbles.A real bargain as the prices are reasonable to start of with. We had no problems with the lifts but they are small and if you are a wheel chair user I think you woul have to check about room access.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice value hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmills
Reviews.Content: Hotel is steps away from the Flaminio metro stop. It is a few minutes walk from the Piazza Polpolo, this square leads on to the main shopping street which passes by Spagna district which has restaruants and bars. There are plenty of restaurants in close proximity. The rooms are very small, but have hairdryer, safe, toiletries, phone, tv (no English Channels though) mini bar. Bar does happy hour 6 til 10pm, drinks half price which are excellent value, they also have complimentary bar snacks/nibbles during this time. Reception staff are excellent, very helpful. Bar staff are very slow and breakfast staff are very slow to lay up the tables and treat the Italians much better than the english. Would recomment hotel and definately say its value for money, very clean, excellent touches (turn down service). Also has two PC's with free internet access in reception area (and free wifi)

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, convenient location, elegant decor, top notch breakfast”
Reviews.Author: paulimeepa
Reviews.Content: A great location a few minutes walk to the Flaminio metro station on the A line and 1.5 blocks north of the gate to the Piazza del Popolo. In my opinion, to experience Rome requires walking and this location allows you to do exactly that, however, for those days where you don't want to walk, the metro station is right there if needed to help you cover some of the distances. In the event that you don't speak Italian, the staff speak English (and Spanish, and some French) not to mention they are extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are the best - from eggs, bacon/ham/sausage and potatoes (if that's your thing) to yogurt, cereal and fruit, to more of a European style breakfast... perfect to get you going for a day of exploring. If you want a cappuccino you have to ask for it. Also for some reason, the Italians can't seem to get their heads around how to make American coffee. However, of all the places we stayed on this trip (Florence, Rome, Venice), this hotel knows how to make a good cup of java. We got a smoking deal on our room, but as a result, the room was very small and the bathroom was probably as small as I've ever seen. The room and its amenities are luxurious and elegant, but our bathroom was downright tiny. Keep in mind, we are not big people; I am 6 feet 185 lbs and my wife is 5 feet 112 lbs - and it was cramped. In fairness they offered us an upgrade to a larger room for 20 euros a night which we did not take so my guess is that we had the smallest room in the hotel. But this wasn't a problem anyway because the point of Rome is not to stay in the hotel but to get out and about. Being that this was our anniversary we were greeted with a bottle of red wine - a very nice touch. It was also really cool to get back after a long day of exploring to see the beds turned down and two delicious chocolates there for our snacking. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. A high recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jupiter11_3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a block from Piazza del Popolo and a metro stop, so very easy to get around Rome from here. The staff were very friendly and accomodating and recommended a very fun and delicious restaurant very close by! They have a Happy Hour nightly with drink specials and snacks, which was a perfect way to relax after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms were nicely decorated and bathrooms were spacious. I will definitly stay here again next time I'm in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Ever”
Reviews.Author: italophile59
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at this hotel, the others being before my membership of Tripadvisor. I am a fairly regular visitor to the city, having family there, and have stayed in several different hotels over the years. This, however, far excels the others. I find it hard to fault this hotel - rooms, staff, cleanliness, service, meals, location (just up the road from Piazza del Popolo) - all excellent. Having to exit the lift on the first floor and walk down a corridor to another lift to access the rest of the hotel is something of an irritant, but, like the size of the lift itself, can be attributed to the limited space available in the building. A joy to stay in - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lia066
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I've ever been to. Although it is relatively old, it is very well preserved, very well decorated, clean and luxurious. The staff were very helpflul and polite, the breakfast AMAZING and the location extremely convenient (just of Piazza del Popolo). Value for money all the way. Higly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Many nice qualities but no in-room wifi”
Reviews.Author: FelicityRR
Reviews.Content: Pros: great breakfast buffet; generally nice staff; good lovation; clean; happy hour with half priced drinks and free snacks in the lobby Cons: no wifi in the room. It would connect then immediately disconnect. Although I complained about this every day, I got no response except some vague promise to get someone to check the router. There was wifi in the lobby, and I saw many people sitting there checking laptops, so I am pretty certain it wasn't just our room. This was a major disappointment as the free wifi was one of the main reasons I selected this hotel. Also, when we checked in, there was a lot of pressure to "upgrade" to a larger and more expensive room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: UkRebecca28
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome, to the amazing breakfast, the clean and well kept rooms to 'Happy hour' and free Wifi this hotel has it all. Lovely staff, very efficient, nothing is too much trouble and really we could not fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it a lot, very clean, staff very friendly, very good breakfast, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: JosephW_10
Reviews.Content: The only negative remark is about the room size (too tiny) and the lake of a coffee / tea pot. Otherwise, everything else is excelent: very clean, staff very friendly, close to all touristic places, close to Metro, very good breakfast, free internet, 18:00 - 22:00 happy hour at the bar, anything (except coffee and champain) half the price. Will recomd it for friends and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: torisian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights to experience Rome. I thought the street where the hotel is situated looked a bit dodgy but once I realised how close the beautiful Popalo square was and the metro being 2 mins away thought it really didn’t matter. I loved the hotel and thought it had many little touches 5 star hotels normally have and have stayed in much worse 5 stars! Yes the rooms and en-suite were a touch on the small side but was totally workable, it was clean and cute. I have recommended this hotel to family who have now been too and loved it just as much as i did. When I return to Rome again, I know where I’ll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “The best reception, the very convenient location and the best breakfast and overall service in Italy”
Reviews.Author: bowralblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel, from the street, is unpretentious, but once inside you discover its real value. The reception staff speak perfect english and are courteous, helpful and efficient--the bellboys are equally good. There's no need to go for a room at a higher standard than 'superior'--it is all that is needed. The buffet breakfast is among the best we've experienced in Europe. The location is such that, if you're a keen walker, the most distant of Rome's attractions is St Peters, 45 minutes away and the Trevi Fountain is 12 minutes away. Great spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: eric323
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful. Wonderful breakfast included with stay. The room was very nice. Be prepared that the rooms are much smaller than American hotel rooms. The hotel location was very convenient to exploring the city on foot or by metro. We walked the 20 minutes to the Vatican from the hotel. In all, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “So Much to Love about this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BOS2GA2010
Reviews.Content: I took my teenage daughter on a trip to Europe this summer. Our trip included tours of Paris, Milan, Florence and Rome. Rome and the River Palace Hotel being the last stop on our excursion. We definitely saved the best for last when it came to hotel stays. Our room was elegant, comfortable, clean and full of amenities. The television even had an English option. The buffet breakfast was awesome. Fresh foods and pastries; like smoked salmon, eggs, bacon, sausages, a variety of tarts, canolis and other pastry. Great coffee, they even had champagne for mimosa's. This was much more than a continental breakfast. The hotel had a happy hour every evening with half priced drinks, free snacks and a beautiful, relaxing atmosphere. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. We were within a pleasant walking distance of most of the attractions on our list and steps away from the transit system to take in others. We loved beginning and ending our days at this beautiful, relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place, nice all around, definitely recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: knwpsk
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't think of a complaint about River Palace. Our first impression was that the guest room was "small" (by American standards), but we soon found out it was very normal for Italy. It was the only hotel we stayed in (others were in Florence and Venice) that offered free Internet access at all, and particularly in the guest rooms. This is a MUST for international travel! (Or else get hijacked with roaming charges when calling home on your cell phone.) The location is great -- Piazza del Popolo nearby is a fun hangout, and Villa Borghese above that has terrific views. Easy 20 minute walk to the Vatican or (other direction) to the Forum/Colosseum/Palatine Hill/etc. Walk from the hotel down the Via del Corso and enjoy the heart of Rome. The staff were pleasant, helpful, accommodating. The daily breakfast was fresh and plentiful, with plenty of choices. The rooms were not big, but were comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the River Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cclayton80
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 nights at the River Palace Hotel as part of a special birthday present for my wife, so it was important that the whole stay was a great experience. We were not disappointed. Rome is a fantastic city and I couldn't have chosen a better hotel from which to explore. We arrived at night and the hotel looked inviting from outside, so much so that it drew comments from everyone on the coach. The hotel staff are very friendly, professional and helpful when I asked for advice about the city. The room we occupied was a little on the small side but was very clean and comfortable and although it overlooked Via Flaminia and the passing metro trams, we could not hear any noise from the street. The bathroom was small but was plush and had everything you need - including a great shower. We booked on a bed and breakfast basis and I can say without doubt that the choice and quality of continental breakfast is the best I've ever had. The bar and lounge area is opulent and comfortable, ideal for relaxing after a days walking. Even better was the happy hour from 6pm - 10pm where drinks were 50% off and sandwiches and snacks were placed on the bar and in the lounge for guests to help themselves. The location of the hotel is 2 minutes stroll from piazza del Popolo and from there you can easily walk to the Spanish steps or Trevi fountain in 10 minutes, Pantheon in 15 minutes and the Coluseum/Roman Forum at the other end of the centre in about 30 minutes. Crossing the river and following it round to St Peter's Basillica takes about 30 - 40 minutes and a further 10 minutes around the Vatican wall takes you to the Vatican museum. We spent about 4 hours in the museum and Sistene chapel - absolutely fantastic and well worth the 15 Euro pp entry fee. For the 4 days we were in Rome the weather prediction was for rain. We were lucky. Monday to Thursday was about 15 - 20 C with blue skies. Thursday PM it rained like there was no tomorrow, but being from England that was business as usual !! We both loved visiting Rome - even in November, and would definitely recommend that you consider the River Palace hotel as the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bobnarole
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly hotel,very clean, in walking distance to all sites. Rooms small but not that it caused a problem, Good happy hour in the bar and excellent breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel and will return. Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: andy227059
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace Hotel for our Honeymoon from the UK and we could not have wished for a better Hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and very happy to help with all of our questions. The Hotel is ideally located to be able to walk to all of the sites of Rome but is also in a quiet location. The breakfast was excellent and so was the bar service on an Evening. All of this enabled us to have a fantastic Honeymoon in Rome and we look forward to our return to Rome and the RP Hotel sometime in 2011. Andy and Laurie Watson from England

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Rome and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: chantimi
Reviews.Content: After I read comments for this hotel on Tripadvisor, I decided to go for this hotel and it was BINGO! We really enjoyed the hotel. The location is so good that you do not have to look for stations and bus stops. Hotel staff were so kind and helpful. Breakfast was good, wonderful pastries we fell in love with. We had some wine at the bar and we enjoyed their free snacks and conversation with good italian wine. The charge was amazingly reasonable and we thought we should have done it everyday...We will come back to this hotel for sure. There is a good restaurant across the street, just 30 steps away from the lobby. The name is La Sella Del Diavolo. Please try! They were good!

Reviews.Title: “Opulence on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Steve_in_Weymouth
Reviews.Content: This really is a hidden gem of a hotel. Rich marble and panelled interiors combined with excellent service and convenient location made for a truly special stay in Rome. The Happy Hour(s) prove great value for money (a very large Courvoisier Cognac measure for 3 Euros! - see photo) The Metro is 100yds away and a 3 day ticket made seeing the sights an easy and cheap alternative to cattle-guided tours. The hotel recommended a restaurant across Piazza del Popolo called Fraschetteria Brunetti...it served the most wonderful authentic Roman food. Don't look for a menu - you get what the waiter thinks you should have! The anti pasta is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Well located gem”
Reviews.Author: Birene
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay in August at River Palace Hotel was absolutely wonderful. The staff was professional, very pleasant and friendly. After a trouble-free hire car journey from the airport to the hotel [arranged by the hotel] our check-in was completed rapidly in comfort and style in the ground floor lounge. River Palace is well located, just 100m or so from the entrance to the Metro [Linea A - use it - it’s easy and fast] a few metres further to the huge Piazza Popolo, and within reasonable walking distance to many important features, including The Vatican, the Spanish Steps, River Tiber, Fontani de Trevi [a disappointment to us], Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, just to name a few. There are many good restaurants very close. The hotel staff can be trusted to provide up to date recommendations and welcomed feed back on our experiences - thanks to Tatiana and her colleagues. Although the room initially seemed a bit dark, once we opened the bedroom curtains and looked onto the internal courtyard its charm was apparent. The small sitting area also looked out onto the courtyard - so much better than the ‘you could be anywhere international style hotel room’ that can be instantly forgettable! Breakfast had a few hiccoughs - none serious. There was no toaster available and on 2 days no really hot water for tea, but when the latter was requested it was brought to the table with a smile. River Palace Hotel was a great find, a hotel with charm and character. We would be very likely to stay here again should we be lucky enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dd625
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 3 friends spent 4 nights at the River Palace Hotel. The location was outstanding, within walking distance of almost everything, and 1 block from Metro to get anywhere else. The room was nice with a very comfortable bed, and the breakfast was absolutely fantastic. They also had a very nice happy hour in the bar each day. The staff was very, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenGisborne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated to walk to all the major tourist attractions. The hotel staff are friendly and well able to look after weary tourists. The breakfasts are great with a wide variety of food to choose from. The reception staff were very obliging and able to assist with ideas for activities with maps to help. The room was small but we were warned to expect that. It was clean and comfortable. A nightly sweet to eat and weather forecast was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “special birthday trip to rome”
Reviews.Author: starkey123
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and were willing to help with any request such as recommending restaurants and organising tranfers back to the airport. our room was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The hotel was in a great location we were able to walk to all the main attractions, trevi fountain, spainish steps, colosseum and even the vatican, thus taking in plenty of cafe's on the way! We loved the relaxed atmosphere of the hotel, the happy hour[s] were great and a lovely way to rest after a full day sight seeing before going out again for our evening meal. The only point we could make would be an evening meal option, especially for our third night when we had walked so far during the day, it would of been lovely just to stay in the hotel and eat.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LAB50
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay at River Palace! We had booked a Jr. Suite, which I would recommend as a minimum since the rooms are small. Upon arrival, we were delighted to learn we’d been upgraded to a suite on the 8th floor with a huge terrace overlooking the city. It was wonderful to sit out there and sip wine during rare moments of downtime. The breakfasts were the best we had in Italy (I’m sure my husband ate their entire annual budget of salmon and prosciutto), and they will happily make an espresso or cappuccino upon request if you don’t want the ‘American Coffee’ in the canister. The happy hour with complimentary snacks is also a nice way to fill the void until the restaurants open for dinner. The location is perfect – close enough to walk to most center city attractions, but just far enough on the other side of Piazza del Popolo to be a little quieter. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. If you contact the concierge in advance, they will arrange a personal driver to pick you up at the airport – it’s only about 10 Euro more than a taxi and well worth it. They have computers set up in a sitting area with free internet access if you aren’t inclined to want to schlep a laptop around on your vacation. OK, the elevators are small and you have to take two of them, but you can avoid the first one by taking one flight of stairs. All in all, the River Palace is a gem. Our favorite restaurant in the area was Ristorante Graziosi. It’s on the square just before you go into Piazza del Popolo (from the hotel, go toward the Piazza, hang a right at the Burger King, and go down about 2/3 of the block). It appears to be a family operation that caters to the locals. Both times we went an older woman we assumed to be ‘mama’ was keeping an eye on everything from a corner table. The portions are very generous and reasonably priced – much better than the tourist traps on the other side of the Piazza. My mouth is still watering thinking of the spaghetti carbonara. And they don’t seem to mind if you want to share a plate.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners1081
Reviews.Content: Everyone should be so lucky as to stay here. Great location (near Metro and Piazza del Popolo with good food! try Canova and Osteria), clean, beautiful rooms and common areas, use of public computers included in stay as well as a fantastic breakfast each morning! Staff is WONDERFUL, resourceful and respectful. The beds were great, we slept like babies and our room had a fantastic view, each day it was a tie between staying in our room or sightseeing in Rome! Will stay again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: vmerr
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours researching where we would stay in Rome after staying in Umbria for 2 1/2 weeks. I am glad that we chose the River Palace since it was really a nice stay, in a great location. I think that the hotel's prepaid four day stay was a great deal. You have to stay Sunday, breakfast is included, and you are in a deluxe double room. This was a bargain compared to similar hotels in Rome. When I checked out a few other hotels we wanted to stay in mainly for a view and/or rooftop restaurant a few days before we left, they had available rooms at discounted rates so there is something to be said for booking at the last minute...We thought the River Palace was in very nice hotel...when we drove into Rome from Umbria it hard to find with all of the one ways, but eventually we found it just a few blocks from the Piazza de Popolo...not a huge awning or flags in front so we passed it by once...then drove slowly down the street again and there is was. Some previous reviews said that the area was dicey which was not the case. In fact, the two blocks from the Piazza help to separate the hotel from the hustle and bustle of Rome which was mobbed with tourists including passengers from 6 cruise ships. The concierge Sergio was on duty and he was very professional making all of our restaurant reservations, answering questions, etc. All of the staff was very helpful and professional. One important thing was that I was so happy that I did not follow their advice in emails I sent before we left the USA. They told us there was no problem, and to make our reservation for the Sistine Chapel once we got to Rome. We would never haven gotten into the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel; the lines to get in were at least 1 1l2 to 2 hrs. wait. This would have been a huge mistake. We should not have waited on the Villa Borghese...you could only book them a week in advance and the River Palace staff emailed me that there was no problem a few weeks before our arrival. I was so disappointed that their info was wrong, since the Museum was totally booked for days. Anyway, we stayed in the deluxe double on the first floor. It was spacious, clean, nicely decorated even though there were stains on the walls and carpets. There were two problems which we brought to the attention of the concierge. One...the air flow was horrible. Again, it seems from previous reviewers there is a problem with air conditioning. It was really chilly outside in the evening and morning, but the room was warm and stuffy. Thank God we opened up the window at night and air flowed in, although my husband was sneezing up a storm. The halls and the rest of the hotel were comfortable but there is a definite problem with the room. There was a man working in the hall for two days on the wiring outside of our room and perhaps that was what he was working on. We kept saying that this would so uncomfortable in any kind of heat. After being in Umbria for 2 1/2 weeks with rooms that had views, it was disconcerting to have such a dark room. The second problem was the shower/bath. We travel in Europe a lot and have encountered many an interesting tub, and this one has to be one of the hardest to get in and out of along with a shower handle that never worked properly and went flying in the air more than once. Housekeeping tried to fix it, but it never worked properly. We enjoyed the breakfast which had nice choices of meat, cheese, eggs, fruit, dolce...The lounge area was also very nice...clean, modern, stylish and very welcoming after a long day out sightseeing, shopping, etc. The happy hour or rather hours was a great deal with half price drinks and some appetizers such as olives, potato chips, pistachio nuts, and little sandwiches. It was nice to return to the hotel after supper and have an espresso or cappucino or a glass of wine before going to one's room. We brought our ipad and used it, but the room (like practically every one we had in Umbria) had internet service that kept going on and off so we used the lounge. There was a room with free computer usage which was nice. Must say to everybody...phone service was a real pain. We paid extra for ATT and there was absolutely no service in Umbria and Rome. In the hotel, you could not use any prepaid phone cards and they charged 1 Euro for each minute so that phone service was very poor. The hotel arranged for a cab to take us to DaVinci very early in the morning. Before we left , we were given a nice take away breakfast which came in handy since we were caught in the French wildcat strike that affected all Italian flights crossing their air space. We knew it was too good to be true...getting into DaVinci after a 25 minute ride, waiting for security (Italians do not work before 7 am), then the wait...13 1/2 hrs to get back!....All in all, the River Palace was a very nice place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Superb breakfasts, Chic Bar with happy hour, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: binoy_rosario
Reviews.Content: We were delightfully surprised by this hotel. The location is excellent - close to the metro to get to the Vatican or the Termini rail station. The daily breakfasts were outstanding (better than an other place we stayed) and we went to their bar each evening for happy hour before walking down the Corso to many nice restaurants. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. Service was prompt and very friendly. And the free internet service was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute delight!”
Reviews.Author: michele-rita
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the River Palace in Rome earlier this month and we were absolutely delighted with our vacation. The location of the hotel is so convenient, the hotel itself is very charming and most of all, the people are extremely helpful. efficient and polite. At the reception desk, we were always greeted with a smile and provided with the information requested. In the breakfast room and at the bar, the attendants were always very nice and attentive to our requests. It was a real pleasure to be guests at this hotel and should we return to Rome, it will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Classy yet comfortable”
Reviews.Author: daxton57041
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed in Italy, we had no idea where to stay. My friend found good reviews for this hotel and so we booked. We loved this hotels staff, they were friendly and eager to help us in every way. The lounge was fantastic. We enjoyed their happy hour and when we wanted to watch some Sunday Football they let us use a room with a flat screen TV. Their free breakfast is amazing and yummy! This hotel was very clean, close to the metro, shopping and great restaurants. We felt the rooms were pretty small as we had just come from a cruise and had alot of luggage and not alot of space to access it, but we weren't in our rooms enough to hinder our experience there. The morning of our departure at 4:30 a.m. the staff had arranged a car for us and had box up some sack breakfasts for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly priced, clean rooms albeit small in size.”
Reviews.Author: donaldjj
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are somewhat small, it's Europe and it's to be expected. The breakfast is excellent and the service is very good as well. The price was fair and all in all it was a very good choice. Plenty of restaureants within walking distance. A good choice in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: barbiekr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Rome for 2 days after spending 12 nights on a cruise in the Mediterranean. This hotel was recommended by a travel agency and we were very satisfied with our 2 night stay. The location is great, the room albeit small (it is Europe) was clean and comfortable, the staff was polite and gave great dinner recommendations, not to mention free internet and wifi which was very much appreciated. I would recommend anyone who is staying in Rome to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SPQR753
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 10 -- 5 couples, arriving on different days. The hotel staff was welcoming, gracious, and friendly. We appreciated their willingness to let us practice our Italian! The breakfast was incredible, and beautifully presented and served. Our rooms were clean, comfortable. The free Internet was very welcome. The location turned out to work fine, since the hotel is close to a Metro station. All in all, our stay was delightful and we all intend to go back there as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: kiwis4651
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay over 15 years and what a lot of changes have taken place - all for the better. The location is fantastic, so close to very good restaurants and of course the shopping.... Our deluxe room was very comfortable and quiet and so much larger than most European hotel rooms we have stayed in. Breakfast is of a very high standard with excellent choices. The happy hour in the bar is a great opportunity to relax before heading out for a meal. All the staff are friendly and very professional and very willing to assist where possible. We are looking forward to a return visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dryheat15
Reviews.Content: We arrived late but our room was waiting, thank goodness! The location is great enabling walking into the center of Rome or just relaxing strolling around the Villa Borghese. The bar is really inviting with excellent service. The breakfast buffet is more than you could ask for and also has great service. Our room was small but that is to be expected, the decor is over the top in the classical Italian style, lots of marble! The staff was very helpful with touring and travel arrangements, I would certainly recommend this hotel, and I have on several occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: pattid22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Can walk to most of the highlights of Rome, if you are a walker. Safe area, felt comfortable walking at night. great little pizza restaurant down the block. The staff was fabulous for recommendations, etc. Would stay here again. The rooms are small but it is Europe

Reviews.Title: “Quiet base in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: jag1410
Reviews.Content: The River Palace Hotel was our new home for six days in Rome and we were very pleased with our choice. The area had an abundance of good places to eat, sightsee and shop. And while it may not be the most prestigious of hotels in Rome, the friendly staff, excellent service and the location make up for it. We arrived earlier than the expected check in of 14.00 but were guided in to the bar lounge for a couple of cappuccinos to wait for 10 minutes while our room was arranged. The lounge also offers a “happy hour” in the evenings that lasted from 18.30 – 10pm and gave chance to meet other guests from around the world and relax and chat about the days exploits. We upgraded to a superior room and were situated on the second floor. Yes you have to get two lifts (the second is the smallest I’ve ever seen!) but really it was no hardship, it was more of a giggle to use. Plus if the lifts aren’t your thing they do have stairs! Our twin room overlooked the court yard and was quiet. Yes the room is compact but for all the amount of time we spent in there, it was a perfect base for us. We were given a complimentary bottle of wine and two apples which was a nice touch. The mini bar costs although it was easy enough to buy our own drinks and put them in there to chill. The shower was small but worked perfectly and towels were changed regularly. The room even came with a UK/US converters and sky TV. Every evening our sheets were turned and a slip of the next day’s weather and a couple of sweets were left, again another nice touch. The breakfast had a great selection and made a great start to the day. Remember, you are there to take in the sights of Rome, not to hang around a hotel all day and night. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Ronbeewacker
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small, get over it. This is Europe. Have you seen the size of their cars? The breakfast was absoutely surperb. Both the menu and staff were excellent. Want an expresso or capucinno? Done. Pastries, eggs, meats, cheeses. All there. Help with the metro or tours? Excellent. Need change? No problem. Walk to the Vatican. 20 minutes. Metro. 3 minutes. Metro to Vatican. 5 minutes. Trevi, S. Steps? 15 to 20 minutes. Happy hour and lounge are both excellent. Although I wouldn't call it Happy Hour, it lasts from 6-10pm! Overall, we loved the staff and hotel. Yes the rooms are small and the dual elevator requirement can be a little inconveint but compared to the other 4 star hotels we just stayed at, this one shines the most.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around--we still recomment it.”
Reviews.Author: elsoc
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome (also August 2007) and our second stay at Hotel River Palace, but this time we had our two teenage sons with us (ages 13 and 17). We loved our stay in 2007 and it was fun to view everything through their eyes this time. We were prepared for the very small rooms and warned our kids ahead of time. We booked two adjoining rooms which was great because our bathtub/shower sprayed water all over so we all ended up using the shower stall in their room. It was also nice to open both outer doors which made it feel like we were staying in a bigger room. Overall, the boys really liked the attentiveness of the staff, the 'unusual' breakfast fare (i.e., pastries available) and the fabulous location so close to all the major attractions in Center Rome. They particularly enjoyed the food in Rome and every single meal we had was wonderful. If you stay at River Palace, make sure you frequent the restaurants along the street. Across the street and to the right is Rustica Pizza. You will crave it long after your trip is over. Across the street and to the left is Osteria Gastoni. Order the spaghetti carbonara but also ask for their recommendations. Very nice, attentive owners/staff, and delicious food. Take advantage of the extremely helpful front desk staff at River Palace. Also take advantage of the fabulous location. No, River Palace is not the most luxurious hotel around, but they make up for it with friendly staff, excellent service and a great location. Remember, you are there to take in the sights of Rome, not to hang around a hotel all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladybird77
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel in September. We booked a room at this hotel in January and asked for a quiet room. On arrival just before 11.00 am we requested the quiet room and was told it was not ready. In fact we were unable to gain access to our room until after ten past two. The man on reception said there were just too many people arriving and departing. A 4 star hotel should be able to cope and not leave customers waiting for over 3 hours to gain access to their rooms. Our room was tiny even by city centre standards. The lift system was totally inadequate. One lift to access the first floor. However, the button to call the lift was not always responsive. The porter downstairs thought he could manage to work it, but after a few minutes when it still refused to work we climbed the stairs!!. Our room was on the 6th floor. There was only 1 lift to access floors 2 - 8 which was situated down a corridor from the lift to the first floor. This lift only held a maximum of 4 people, fewer if they had suitcases. The lift was exceptionally hot and airless and would be dangerous if it ever broke down. Breakfast although good was also a nightmare. There were 3 lines of tables seating a total of 36. The chairs were back to back so it was impossible for those not seated on the outside to leave the table without disturbing all their neighbours. There were also two additional small tables. On the Saturday morning we were at the hotel the seating was inadequate to cope with the number of guests wanting breakfast, and some either had to wait or eat in the bar. Yes, this hotel is clean, friendly and centrally located, but it is totally inadequate to cope with the volume of guests it holds and is certainly the worst 4 star city centre hotel I have ever stayed at. I do not normally complain - this is the first poor review I have written on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: ccookdo
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the "jet Lag" package at the River Palace. They met us at the airport (DaVinci) and a very nice driver took us to the hotel in a Mercedes. We were allowed to check in early and catch a quick nap. Getting around is easy, the Metro is 2 blocks away. The morning breakfast was included and they put out a wonderful spread. All the staff were friendly, and the room even came with an included converter for US appliances. Overall and outstanding place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leelasmom
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel were very friendly. The elevator was broken when we were there, and although they compensated us for the inconvience, after walking for hours around Rome having to climb 6 flights of stairs was a big deal. The room is air conditioned, but the bathroom isn't, which might not seem like a big deal, but when the humidity is 92% and it's hot by 9 a.m., it is. The hotel breakfast is awesome and the staff are very helpful. It is a great location to walk to and use the metro. They also have free internet and computer terminals to use. The bar is a great place to relax and meet fellow travellers. The only downside, other than the broken elevator, was that the beds were like sleeping on concrete. They were so uncomfortable that we ended up lying awake most nights - and not because of the jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MS624
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week trip to Italy. We stayed 3 nights in Rome at the River Palace. The hotel is nice, our room was a bit larger (still small by American standards) than many of the European hotels I stayed at. The room was very clean and better than average decor. The bathroom was roomy, but with the hand shower head and only a half glass around the tub, water would get all over the bathroom, but no big deal. The hotel provided complimentary internet access. However, it was wired access only but they provided an ethernet cable upon request. The hotel did provide an American plug adapter on the desk which was a nice touch. The breakfast was fabulous. The best of all the hotels we stayed in Italy. The hotel is conveniently located less than a block from the Metro/subway and Piazza Popolo. Although a number of the tourist sites were within a walking distance, it is on the out skirts of the core tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: royvalchester
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip abroad and I am very glad I chose Rome the Hotel was all you could ask for, friendly staff, adequate rooms, catered for all nationalities at breakfast very good choice. The happy hour in the bar during the evening was very welcome due to price of drinks. The Hotel we found was pretty central for getting around and the metro train was only at the bottom of the street. All in all it was excellent would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LottyLincoln
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our 10 year daughter stayed at this hotel in July 2010 and would rate this hotel very highly. Service good. Breakfast was fantastic. Hotel is spotlessly clean as are the rooms. Our room was small and it did look as though the single bed had been put into a double room. However, this was the only downside. Location was great - 2 min walk to underground and walking distance to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps; we also walked to the Basilica and Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FOHARA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary. The staff in the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful making us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. They gave us great advise about trips, local restaurants and how best to get around the city and see the sights. Nothing seemed to be a problem for them at any time. The room was not large but adaquate with a good sized bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The hotel is in a superb location, on the metro line, and within walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain (both best seen at night). A drink at any bar alongside the Piazzo del Popolo on the way back to the hotel is a must to watch the world go by!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: kaz041
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a break to see all the sites in Rome, and what a great choice, brilliant, staffs very helpful, rooms great, breakfast amazing, and the barman was fantatic, they have a happy hour for about 4 hours in the evening great. Would go back again without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: jennibears
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the River Palace Hotel and cannot envisage staying anywhere else. It's location means it's easy to get around the City whether on foot or on the metro. The service from the staff is excellent, they are extremely helpful and friendly. The choice at breakfast is extensive from cold meats/cheeses, cooked breakfast items and an assortment of sweet pastries. What was great for me is that they have water available in the restaurant served chilled and has not been standing around. The "happy 4 hour" (6pm-10pm) is great as are the freebie nibbles that you can help yourself too. We have stayed in a junior suite and the Borghese suite. Both were large, clean and comfortable. A nice touch is when the maid comes to turn down the bed, she brings a couple of sweeties and the weather forecast for the next day! We cannot recommend this hotel enough. Oh and yes, if you want a good meal go to the little family run tratatoria across the road. A Tourist menu for €13.00! and the food was excellent.... the only problem they close on a Sunday

Reviews.Title: “great service and convenient”
Reviews.Author: leisure_traveller_10
Reviews.Content: The only complaint is that the elevator was very small. Otherwise, the rooms were clean though small(to be expected in Italy). Convenient to walk or use metro. Breakfast was ample with variety. Our last day, they even packed us boxed breakfast without being asked. Staff were very friendly. Internet connection in the rooms and tv had some english channels. Make sure to visit Borghese gallery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lols80
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccommend this hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful and our room was very clean, spacious and well decorated. We were upgraded to superior rooms due to the package we booked so I can't say if all the hotel's rooms are the large size we experienced but our bedroom and bathroom were HUGE by European standards. There was a happy hour in the hotel bar from 6-10pm each evening with all drinks half prices and also nibbles and fruit free of charge, which was a pleasant surprise! The only thing I would like to let people know about is there is no iron/ironing board in the rooms so if you need to iron anything you must pay the hotel for a pressing service, a very minor issue but if I'd have know I would have been more careful folding items into my suitcase before I arrived! The staff were also very friendly, helping us with directions and restaurant reccommendations. The location is also excellent, just a short stroll from Piazza del Popolo but enough away from the hustle and bustle so you can enjoy a decent night's sleep. I visited Rome before and paid more for my stay and my hotel was nowhere near this standard. Very happy indeed and would definitely book a return trip to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: PaulBox
Reviews.Content: Delayed review, having just used trip advisor to book a holiday I thought I should make some contributions… We stayed in this hotel for three nights during a driving holiday last summer. I think the staff were the highlight of this hotel, very friendly and helpful. On arrival in Rome I noticed that the valet from our previous hotel (in Florence) had dropped his keys in my car. The team on reception contacted the other hotel and made arrangements for the keys to get back to him. This holiday was about getting out and about, not lounge around the hotel, so in most locations I had booked the cheapest room that the hotel had available. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade as the room we had reserved was very small, a member of staff escorted us upstairs to see both rooms. To be honest they were both pretty small so we decided not to bother upgrading. Although small, the room was comfortable, nicely decorated and had a good bathroom. There was a nice bar/lounge area where we took advantage of “happy hour” when the drinks were half price before walking to the local restaurants for dinner. There is an exceptional little restaurant just along the street (same side, on the corner opposite Piazza Del Popolo) it doesn’t look anything special, but the food is fantastic. Breakfast in the hotel was good but the room was very busy, we didn’t eat any other meals in the hotel. One afternoon, having walked many miles around the city, we fancied getting out of town. One of the guys on reception very kindly recommended a lake about 60 min’s drive and showed me how to get there. It was fantastic to laze in the sun for a few hours. The hotel has a secure underground car park, however the entrance/exit is very tight and they charge about €25 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: ziggyChatham_Kent_uk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome having spent a six day holiday with my husband and eighteen year old classics student son. The hotel is clean and the beds comfortable, tastfully decorated and has great air-con! The staff are friendly, helpful and efficient and the location is great - very close to a metro station and within walking distance of the centre - the furthest walk being 30 mins to the colloseum - use the metro to reach the vatican. The breakfast is delicious and available from 6.30 to 10.30 and the happy hour in the relaxing lounge bar from 6 to 10pm - they make a great mojito! Would not hesitate to recommend and would definately stay there if I am lucky enough to visit Rome again - put several coins in the Trevi fountain to ensure my return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with extremely helpful in a good location”
Reviews.Author: barrymooring
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located near Piazza Di Pololo in the northern part of Rome. As a bonus the hotel is about 5 mins walk from the impressive Villa Borghese - which is brilliant to stroll around on a warm sunny day. The room was large and with a rather grand décor. The bathroom was very spacious with double sinks, bath, shower etc Very nice indeed. The breakfast was excellent at this hotel. A hot buffet consisting of scrambled eggs, mushrooms, bacon, sausages, etc. A selection of cold meats and cheese. If that is not enough to fill your appetite there is also a huge selection of cakes, pastries and cereal. There was also a range of fruit juices and tea and coffee available. A wonderful start to your day! The staff were extremely helpful and always striving to make your stay as comfortable and stress free as possible. This is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolerichard
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were met with a very welcoming staff and immediately made us feel at home. The room was a little small but very comfortable and clean. The location is abit out of Rome itself but this area has just as much to offer with attractions closeby and the shops and transport. Close to the hotel is the park which is just beautiful. We had the best time here at this hotel and highly recommend the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but Big Service = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: thesecret_squirrel
