Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied by our 4 night stay at the River Palace the first week of July, and even returned for a final night after traveling in other parts of Italy. But be prepared, the standard rooms are very small, quite possibly as small as a cruise ship cabin. There is very little room to walk around. But after walking all day, we didn't mind too much. The elevators are also a tiny bit awkward. But the service was great, and made up for those quirks, for us. The staff were always friendly, helpful and welcoming. And the rooms were excellently appointed, with nice linens and towels and a flat screen tv. The mini bar was well stocked at reasonable prices, and the complimentary apples were a welcome fresh refreshment for hot, dehydrated travelers. One tip for the air conditioning (possibly depending on what direction your room faces) while you can adjust between low, medium and high, to max out the cooling, it's really important to keep the bathroom door and the curtains closed. In our room, the sun from the bathroom window would heat up the bedroom if the door was ajar, even with the a/c on. Kept closed, the a/c was sufficient to keep the room cool and comfortable. The free morning breakfast was abundant, with mouth-watering pastries and champagne, in addition to eggs, meat, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fruit and more. The evening happy hour was complete with ample finger food and great drinks. Internet was free and easy to use. The location was very good. Quick and easy to the metro, Piazza del Poppolo, bus stops and restaurants, but just enough off the busy areas to be quiet and restful. This hotel was a great decision for us.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is quite simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mikeb691
Reviews.Content: Having returned from Rome with my girlfriend I can honestly say this hotel is easily the best I have stayed in. The staff are an absolute credit to the hotel as nothing was too much trouble and they would always be happy to help. The breakfast is excellent and with a such a wide variety you don't know where to start. The location is perfect, and a happy hour between 6-10 make it very relaxing to recover from all of the sites. If you're thinking about staying here, just book it

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: stu29435
Reviews.Content: After a hot day traveling to Rome the cool clean lobby of the River Palace was more than welcome. The staff was outstanding throughout our stay providing restaurant recommendations and maps and helping with travel plans. The maid service and bell service were also top notch. Gotta be sure to put out the DND sign before going to the very nice dining room for buffet breakfast (included with our stay), or you come back to find your room cleaned while you were out. One drawback is the elevators - very small and you have to take two elevators unless your room is on floor 1 (note all floors in Italy start at 0 not 1) - I have been in larger phone booths. Hotel is adorned with art and paintings has a beautiful lobby for happy hour and a comfy TV room for watching sporting events (the World cup was happening during our visit). Two convenient computers are provided for internet access, boarding passes etc. and the lack of a printer is overcome by emailing anything you want to print to the hotel's email address. Location is convenient to the Metro and about a 15 euro cab ride to the Roma Termini or a 50 euro transfer ride to FCO airport. The room was nice - although a bit cramped even though we upgraded to the deluxe room (plus 40 euro/per). Nice feature was an AC / Italian power outlet for charging stuff. The deluxe room came with the spiffy terry robe and comfy slippers. The bathtub was too small for an american - might have even been tight for anyone over 5' and 100lbs. Shower was good but had a tricky holder that tended to slip and spray the entire bathroom.as there was no shower curtain just a half divider of glass. The standard room did not have a bath at all. Nightly turndown service was a nice touch with candies and a floor mat thing for your slippers. The food was good but not great - certainly adequate and plentiful - sometimes they were out of basics like hash browns and bacon. Room was quiet and cool - really important as temps were in the 70s for low at night. Slight noise from adjacent room plumbing on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Dreams do come true”
Reviews.Author: RosalindAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have been told by many people that it is impossible to find a good hotel in a good location in Rome at a reasonable price. Well they are wrong! The River Palace Hotel in Rome is as good as it gets. A lovely Hotel in a great spot, just steps away from the Metro and also one of the best piazzas in Rome, Piazza Del Popolo. The staff are friendly and happy to help with anything you need (thanks for help with the internet). They have Happy Hour every night which is great too. We booked the Vacanze Romane package and the value was incredible. Dinner at Fraschetteria Brunetti is not to be missed and the Eternal Rome tour was also fantastic. Thankyou River Palace for making us fall in love with Rome and with your Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: kayc63
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Europe we had 6 wonderful days in Rome staying at this hotel. Located just outside of the very old part of Rome across from Piazza di Poppolo (excuse spelling) we were able to walk down to Colleseum in one direction and Vatican in the other direction. Didn't need any taxis or transport to sight see at all. Also the Piazza has many cafes, restaurants and the Via Corsa has shopping. The River Palace has comfortable rooms (though not huge rooms if that is what you are after), provides a wonderful breakfast and in the evening has a happy hour that lasts several hours. But best of all are the staff who are really helpful and happy to help. We really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: makila10
Reviews.Content: loved it!! great location and food!! wished I could have stayed longer!! upgrade the room you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: rib571
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June and the hotel exceeded our expectations. It was spotlessly clean. The standard of service and friendliness of all staff was fantastic. the staff volunteered all sorts of useful hints and tips to get the most of the stay. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: bernibarg
Reviews.Content: great hotel, spotless, staff very friendly, excellent breakfast and very close to metro and centre.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!! As a cranky New...”
Reviews.Author: littlehurdler
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!! As a cranky New Yorker I expect the best, and I can honestly say you will not go wrong with River Palace! The location is centrally located to access the major sites and if you're not up for walking, the train is at the end of the block. And what can I say about Renaldo the bartender at Happy Hour!! AMAZING! New York bartenders could learn a thing or two from him!! His drinks are wonderful an excellent way to end the day. I got the deluxe room which was very spacious. What a wonderful touch of turn down service with the next days weather and a chocolate. I was truly thankful that i could watch american television from time to time whilst relaxing. You cant go wrong with the River Palace Hotel everyone is nice and extremely helpful. My only gripe and its not a small one would be to cook the bacon a bit longer....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Artagen
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Really charming, and well located (near piazza del populo). Staff was really nice and helpful and breakfast were really great. I recommend it to you if you want to stay some time in Roma...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: believer1313
Reviews.Content: Everyone in the hotel is accommodating and wonderful. They make your stay fun and easy. We stayed in the jr suite which is small but fun. We had a jacuzzi and a balcony. The view is great. The smell of Jasmine is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The River Palace Hotel ~ Excellent Location and Service in the Heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LLB05
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 20) and I stayed at the River Palace Hotel for 2 nights upon the recommendation of a friend who had stayed there 2 years ago. When we arrived from the airport, the friendly staff was happy to greet us, promptly checked us in, and gave us a great map of Rome highlighting the hotel's location compared with the major sights. We found our room to be immaculate and spacious (especially compared to other European city hotels!). The hotel is also very conveniently located within walking distance to everything, which was very important to us. In the morning, the River Palace provides a wonderful breakfast which included a hot and cold buffet presented in a beautiful manner in a lovely dining room. We also used the hotel's transportation to the airport, which was reasonably priced and extremely reliable. Overall, I have only great things to say about the River Palace Hotel, and would highly recommend it to all travelers headed to Rome. (Rick Steves... you need to add this one to your book!)

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times and this was the first time in a hotel. Normally I stay in bed and breakfasts but since we were traveling with other couples we thought it would be better to have a full service hotel where we could meet in the lobby. The hotel was Ok. It is rather old and very dated. I find that the B&Bs are newly updated and cleaner. The service was pretty good. We did have one problem where we wanted to open a bottle of our own wine in the lobby and they didn't want to let us even though the bar was closed. I thought that was rather silly. The breakfast was actually surprisingly good. If you like pastries you will like the breakfast. The breakfast room is very small but still a nice place to eat. There is also a little library where you can sit and watch TV or read some of the books travelers have left. Our room itself was a good size (superior room) and we had a nice window but again the drapes were old and dated and carpet very worn out. I did not care for the location. There is major construction in front of the hotel and the walk to get to the plaza nearby is boring and not very picturesque (you pass a Burger King). I prefer staying over by the Colosseum. All in all, not terrible but would not stay here again. There are much better places in Rome. If you do stay here go to the pizza place across the street and to the right. It is really good. Just grab a slice and go.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elliemae019
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located to everything. We walked all over Rome. Very nice breakfast every morning, happy hour in the afternoons, comfortable rooms and very friendly staff with most speaking good English. Ellyn Pensacola, FL

Reviews.Title: “very good clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: DERECHHAMELECH
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband, we got 3 nights, the street under constaction, ask for inside room till its over..but its ok to visit, the M metro is 2 minutes and Piazza Popolo is across the main street, all so close, good transportation, and the best is the staff!!! each one of them friendly, willing to assist , big thanks to Maksimilian and the staff. best breakfast!!, clean hotel. nice rooms, I took the superior. I will recomend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel that goes that extra mile!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbiead
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 days at the River Palace Hotel in April 2010. The first four days were planned, and we found the hotel lovely, well located, and hospitable. The last eight days were courtesy of volcanic ash - our flight was cancelled and we couldn't get home for eight more days. And, this is when we learned the true and amazing value of this hotel. The welcomed us back, arranged for a very fair rate for all their stranded visitors, and then proceeded to do absolutely EVERYTHING they could do to make us comfortable, help us handle the sticky details of an unexpected week abroad (dirty clothes, no prescription medications, no reservations, no plans, and general stress). The staff and management treated us like family, helping us to relax and discover their Rome and enjoy the unexpected bonus vacation. And, they became our friends. We could not have asked for a better experience, under the circumstances. In all our years of traveling around the world, we have never had a finer hotel experience and we would highly recommend this hotel to any visitor to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: wlfmn77
Reviews.Content: We had booked River Palace using credit card points so I didn't research much about the hotel beforehand. It basically had a decent location (as per the map) and didn't require too many points. My expectations were not very high, especially given how hotels in Rome can be a huge rip-off. However, the River Palace more than exceeded my expectations. First, the location is actually VERY central. It's not directly in the historic district, but it's literally a 5 minute walk to the Piazza del Popolo. The hotel itself is much bigger and well-appointed than I expected. There are 2 computers up front for guest use which include printer access and free internet. The reception was very nice and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was amazing! So many things to choose from and all incredibly good. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The only issue I had was that our room was very small, but the other amenities made up for it. A nice added bonus was the SkyTV that allowed us to view English-language shows (e.g. The Simpsons) without the Italian dubbed over. Not that we went to Italy to watch TV, but still a nice option. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay when in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Nainsi10
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here for a week in April and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Everyone at the front desk, the porters, housekeeping and bar staff were very welcoming, courteous and friendly. The hotel room was very comfortable, great shower pressure, and quality shampoos, conditioners, etc. The hotel was very clean, quiet and secure. The breakfast buffet was outstanding - great selection and friendly staff. The location was ideal - a short walk to the Metro, the Piazza Del Popolo, another short walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Del Corso. This hotel is an exceptional place to stay and will make your stay in Rome very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location, great staff......”
Reviews.Author: dlmw1
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for a 4 day stay and ended up staying longer due to the Volcanic ash problem. We booked the River Palace on the strength of previous reviews on Trip Advisor and we certainly were not disappointed. The hotel and rooms are small but this is to be expected. The room was ample, had a large flat screen tv with plenty channels (handy for keeping up with news on the volcano) and the bathroom was very nice (something I am very particular about!). The lounge area was lovely for drinks in the evening and even better they were half price between 6pm and 10pm. When our flight was cancelled the hotel put us up for the necessary extra days and even reduced the room rate, for which we were very grateful. We did hear some hotels were putting theirs up so a huge thank s to the River Palace for not trying to profit from peoples' misfortune. One other thing, should you need a driver while in Rome or for collecting and returning you to the airport, we can highly recommend Adriano Tavella. www.inlimorome.com Adriano was wonderful - extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat078
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days. The stay was excellent except for the first night... First of all the location: The hotel is situated near piazza del Poppolo which is in the ´´old´´part of Rome, and next to Villa Borghese which is a large green park. Location excellent, and situated near Metro station so even though we walked a lot, we could allways use the metro to get back. Nice restaurants near by, try the Gusto, we liked it. When we checked in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a larger room. After taking a quick look at both type of rooms, we decided to accept the upgrade to a superior room for an extra 20 euro. The rooms aren´t that big so a superior room at about 20sqm felt more comfortable. We were given room on the first floor,I think it was room 103, which turned out to be awfull. The room was situated next to the hotels second elevator, everyone passed outside our door in order to get a connection with the elevator for floors 2-8. All night we heard the elevator bell ring and people talking,laughing etc going past our room. The walls were thin so we could hear our neighbour snoring, (at least he was enjoying his sleep) and the plumbing were not so good as well. We could hear people flush constantly. At about 7 in the morning we were awaken by street construction right outside the hotel, the room was facing via Flaminio. This construction would go on until 6 in the afternoon.... We contacted the reception immediatedly and asked to be moved to a more quiet room and after that, our stay was exceptional. We got a room on the 8th floor with view over the city. Fantastic!!!! The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was big and had makeup mirror with light, shower with very good pressure and luxurius amenities. There was evening turndown service where chocolate was handed out as well as the weather forecast for the next day. Nice to have a heads up. Room was quiet and no thin walls here, I just think we were really unlucky with the first room. The breakfast was really good, allthough it was not possible to get dark bread. But besides that, there was everything else. The croissants were especially good :-)There is a happy hour from 18-22 were drinks are served for half price. Really good drinks and very pleasant/helpful personel. We really had a great stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: jibrunger
Reviews.Content: 4 nights on first trip to Rome. Hotel River Palace is in a GREAT location, just beyond the piazza de popolo and a block from the Flaminio metro stop. Very easy to walk the great shopping and sights off Via Del Corso (pantheon, spanish steps, world class shopping) and very easy to get the metro to Vatican (2 stops) and pretty much any where else you would like to go. The breakfast is very good and a great way to start the day. Service was excellent with good dinner recommendations and helpful in reservations. The free computer and internet was very helpful in booking time saving museum reservations that I didn't take care of before getting to Rome. A great place to stay and at just about $220/night booked through my travel agent, a good price. The rooms ARE small, the beds are hard, but you'll find the same in pretty much ANY European city. Unless you book rooms at the American chain hotels, beds will be a bit stiffer and rooms will be a little smaller than you are used too in the States. My wife and I are small (i'm 5'8", she's 5'4") so it works to our advantage, but a colleague who is 6'6" books exclusively at American Hotels for European Travel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome April 9, 2010”
Reviews.Author: honeymoon2010florida
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell all travelers that we went to this hotel on our honeymoon and from the time we arrived till the very last moment we left we were treated wonderfuly. We asked for a room upgrade with a balcony and were not expecting the room we received, it was amazing. The kindness we received from the front desk staff was overwhelming. They gave us great recommendations and were very friendly. We loved the fact that when we walked in the front door after site seeing the bellman and front staff were there with a smile. We also liked the lounge and that after a long day you could wind down with a drink and snacks for happy hour. We traveled Italy for our honeymoon and this hotel gave us the best service. It was located very close and walking distance to everything. We also have to coment that we observed Poliza (Police) everywhere and felt very safe at all times. Everyone there treated us with kindness and spoke broken english even though we had been practicing our italian. When you make your reservation at this hotel tell the Consierge the Hammonds sent you and and pay the room upgrade, you want to experience the balcony in rom 801.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique style hotel with excellent service and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cgarcia9
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for two reasons: The value for a lovely hotel and the excellent customer service. We had little mishap occur the first day that was more than adequately fixed by the staff and one of the hotel managers, Diana. She was superb and professional. The hotel is in a nice location off Piazza del Popolo right next to the metro,dining, Villa Borghese and two stops on the metro (5-7 min) from the Vatican.The rooms and hotel are finely decorated and bathrooms more than adequate and very clean. The daily breakfast superb. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisonmurph
Reviews.Content: The Riverpalace hotel is in a truly excellent location just beside the beautiful Piazza del Popolo with its many churches and splendid restaurants. From its location you can easily stroll through the ancient streets of Rome to the main sights such as Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and about 20 min leisurely walk to The Colosseum. The staff are plesant and nothing is too much trouble plus the breakfast is very enjoyable. All far flung areas of Rome are easily accessible as the metro is just outside the hotel. Rooms are very comfortable ,clean and quiet! The Borghese gardens and Palace are adjacent to the hotel and are worth a walk around for the tranquility and magnificent views of Rome. The amazing restored Ara Pacis monument is just a 10 min walk along Via Ripetta and well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the River Palace. We were offered a deluxe room for an upcharge which we took because the standard room was pretty small. Check in was easy and the staff were extremely nice and professional. There is a lot of construction going on in the street and I asked for a room that didn't face the street and it was no problem. The young woman who checked us in also gave us a very good map and pointed out the location of the main sites. The deluxe room, while compact, had a big king-sized bed which was very comfortable, wired high-speed Internet, a big flat-screen TV with a lot of channels in English, a desk, a safe, robes, slippers and a gorgeous marble bathroom with a tub/shower combo. There was also a mini-bar if you wanted to partake. The room felt upscale, as did the rest of the hotel. They provided turn-down service each night and they left the next day's weather report and chocolate on the bed which was a nice touch. Other people have talked about the elevators - you take one to the first floor, then a teeny-tiny one which is around the corner to the upper floors. It isn't as big a deal as you think unless you try to cram more than 4 people in the second elevator. We didn't have any problems with it. The front desk staff were very accommodating and helped me get a museum reservation as well as arranging a transfer to the airport. We were always greeted warmly when we came and went. I felt the staff would have been happy to help their guest in any way they could. I can't say enough about how helpful and kind the staff are. The breakfast was wonderful with a huge assortment of pastries, cheeses, meats, eggs, sausage, fruit, cookies, juice, vegetables, cereals, pretty much anything you would want. The breakfast staff were constantly refilling things and will make you a cappacino if you ask. They have a happy hour at the very nice and comfortable bar area with 50% off drinks and a limited sandwich menu. It was a nice spot to spend an hour or so before going out at night. The location is a little out of the center of town, and I was a little worried we would be too far from everyting, but there is a metro stop right there, and a bus stop. As it turned out, we could pretty much walk everywhere. We had no problem walking to the Pantheon area (maybe 10-15 minutes) as well as the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain (10 minutes tops), but I think the colosseum would have been a little far but a there was a metro stop right across the street. We took the metro to Vatican City and then walked back and it took us about 30-45 enjoyable minutes. The best part of the hotel's location is that it is right next to Piazza del Popolo which was so much fun to hang out in and people watch as well as visit the two churches. We loved getting a gelato late at night and sitting in this piazza by the fountain. During the day there was always something going on there with street performers, musicians, dancers, etc. Also, Villa Borghese is just up a flight of stairs and a wonderful place to hang out on a Sunday. So I ended up loving the location and didn't mind at all that we weren't in the center of town. A one minute walk down the street are two very good, inexpensive, family run restaurants right across the street from each other. We had our best meals in Rome at these two restaurants. There is also a rustic pizza place right there too and two cafe bars around the corner. In Piazza del Popolo there are many places to eat and get gelato (which is must do!) I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The room was small, but plush and very comfortable, the breakfast was great, the location was wonderful, and the staff were absolutely terrific. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bxgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Palace for 7 nights (March 24th-31st) and I was completely amazed by the professional staff and their willingness to always help out. While the room was small, it was cozy and well decorated. The only down side was the bed was too hard for me but perfect for my friend. Staff was always curteous and smiling. Every night we received chocolates & a card with the weather for the next day (the weather was BEAUTIFUL!!!). Never was a day where they didnt say "Good Morning" or "Good Evening" to us. Giorgio gave us the best resturant recommendations (Il Brillo Parlante, Fraschetteria Brunetti and the AWESOME Ristorante '34'). The hotel was was in walking distance to all the major attractions. There is construction work going on in front of the hotel (tram work) but it never bothered us. The Flaminina metro stop is about a block & a half away which was very convient. We are planning to return to Rome and the River Palace Hotel next Spring. I couldnt imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous river palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: miamul
Reviews.Content: my husband and I travelled to rome on March 20th for 4 nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and were fortunate enough to stay in the river palace hotel. I am a travel agent and have stayed in numerous hotels over the past 25 years and I have to say this is one of the best!! The location is perfect , very close to the flaminio metro which is only 2 stops to the vatican one way and the other a couple of stops to the trevi fountain. Very close to all the shops and restaurants on via del corso and within walking distance of most of the major sites. There are a number of restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel . Orsetto which seemed to be a popular local haunt is almost opposite and served very reasonably priced piazza and pasta absolutely ideal for a budget night out or lunch. The staff at the river palace are the most helpful and friendly I have ever encountered, nothing was too much trouble and they really made us feel welcome in Rome. Breakfast in the hotel is absolutely excellent a huge variety of hot and cold items available absolutely beautiful pastries and fruit and all beautifully presented in the lovely breakfast room. Our room was a double deluxe and was very italian in style as is the hotel , beautiful wood panelling , lovely ornate ceilings , marble bathroom very warm and cosy in style . It was spotlessly clean as is the entire hotel, and was extremely comfortable. Room was very well equipped with all mod cons including a flat screen t.v. with full range of sky channels. There is also a very nice bar which has happy hour from 6 to 10pm every evening, half price drinks and sandwiches , lovely free bar snacks and again excellent service. The staff organised a limousine service to take us back to the airport which i would thoroughly reccommend . Our driver Alessandro was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and gave us a hassle free transfer back to the airport for €50 which was worth every penny. The train coming in cost us €22 euros and with the cost of a taxi from termini would only be about €18 cheaper, the limousine transfer is definitely the way to go. We were sorry we didnt organise to be collected by him on arrival which the hotel will organise for you. The river palace is a fab hotel and I would not hesitate to reccomend it to anyone travellling to Rome. My advice would be to book a delux room as some of the others seem to be a little on the small size according to some reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous service, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: toroma
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome early morning and only had to wait a short time to get into our room. We had the choice of the basic room we booked or an upgraded room. We saw both rooms and upgraded to the much larger room for only 20 euros more each night. The staff was very helpful and courteous the entire stay. They brought us a fan and also a thermometer when I was sick. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and fabulous cappucino every morning. Great lounge area to relax in evening with adjacent bar. Our bed was very comfortable and the hotel is quiet. Metro stop right around the corner. Right across the street from Piazza del Popolo with immediate access to Via del Corso and all it's sights. This hotel is not in city center exactly but close enough to walk or metro/bus. Hotel also can arrange private car to airport, 50 euros for 2. Wonderful compared to the shuttle we took from the airport. Definitely was worth the extra 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MemphisTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was warm and friendly. Service was outstanding. The hotel itself was a nicely decorated small hotel conveniently located near the Borghese Gardens and the Spanish Steps. There were pleanty of of opportunities for shopping and eating within walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast was included in the daily charge and was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat after me: PER - FET - TO!”
Reviews.Author: piglette33
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel has impeccable staff, and I'll take a second to make myself guilty of favouritism: Giorgio, mille grazie for being that one step over your average receptionist. The location was perfect, the breakfast was perfect,daily weather report plus chocolates were delightfully surprising (I may have raced my boyfriend to the door in a few instances). It's within walking distance to mostly everything a tourist needs, especially when said tourist is wearing comfy shoes. The rooms have LCD tvs and Sky Satellite, and the city has thousands of years worth of history greeting you at every step. Needless to say, you will not get bored. One microscoping thing I'll have to mention though, the rooms can get a bit stuffy, but that's nothing that turning on the AC or an open window won't fix.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrek1
Reviews.Content: I have to concur with many of the reviews of this hotel. The location is close to all major sites, and to the metro station. The staff is extremely courteous and friendly. The buffet breakfast is great and plentiful. The room we had was small but cozy, flat tv, reasonable size bathroom. Nightly turn-down service and a card for for the next day weather. Good happy hour from 6:00 pm til 10:00 pm, Half-off on drinks There are many trattorias and coffee shops nearby. Free Internet wi-fi around the lobby, and wired on the rooms (front desk provides cable) Will definitely return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, best service, we'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: primrose30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Piazza de Popolo- Metro and buses within 1 min walk, and with in walking distance from many attractions. still- the rooms are very quiet. the rooms are very small but spotless and well acquit+ the service was wonderful! the big fuzzy towels were changed twice a day, and chocolates and the weather report for the next day- on your pillow. Breakfast was amazing! cakes, ages, fresh fruit and veg and assorted cheeses, sausages, cereals and cookies and re-feels till 10:30! The stuff is as friendly as can be, and there is a general feel of generosity :) other facilities we enjoyed: free Internet (wifi and two computers) and free print of documents, and the best thing: Happy hour at the beautiful hotel bar- 50% off on all drinks and sandwiches + free peenuts and crisps- was wonderful after a whole day of walking around the city... all and all- we had a great time and will try to stay here again next time we're in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can!”
Reviews.Author: yarddoggie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 nights in Rome staying at the River Palace. The room was one of the smallest we've had in Europe. That is the only negative thing I can think of to say. Fantastic, friendly, and helpful staff would have made staying in a tent a pleasure! But this wasn't a tent. A combination of them managed to make a reservation for the Uffizi gallery in Florence for us the morning before we'd go. Well appointed throughout and very clean even to the point of a pleasant sent in the elevators! Breakfast was great too with eggs, bacon, and hash brown potatos for those who like this and a terrific selection of bread, fruit, and pastries. Wireless in the public lounge area and wired internet in the rooms. Location was fantastic. Close to all the primary tourist spots of Rome. A very short walk to Popolo piazza and Borghese park. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Find, just perfect for what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: jules4732
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the new tramway works outside the hotel, inside the welcome is warm and friendly. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. Breakfast was superb, better selection than I have seen in some higher class hotels. The cappucino was excellent. As others said the rooms wre fairly small, but spotless, chocolates and next days weather report on your bed. Some complained of hot rooms, we just made sure our heating was off, Happy Hour was from 6- 10pm, making a glass of Prosecco 1.5 Euro's, so after a days sightseeing it was perfect to unwind. Nothing was too much trouble and they did recommend a fantastic new restaurant opposite La Sella Del Diavolo, husband and wife run, intimate, fairly expensive but superb food, group of 8 390Euros. Will definitely be coming back to both when next in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Hotel!!! If I could give it a rating above excellent I would!”
Reviews.Author: Monique1980
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time in Rome and mostly because of how great this hotel was. The staff were wonderfully helpful, the room was was beyond comfortable and the breakfast served were the best we had all holiday. The location is ideal and close to restaurants and shopping! I will definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome! We will definately stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “They have it all figured out...”
Reviews.Author: skierajs
Reviews.Content: Everything about the River Palace hotel seems to have been extensively planned and thought through to ensure that we had an enjoyable stay. Our experience was basically seamless. Upon arrival, we left our bags with one of the employees. While waiting for our room to be ready, the hotel manager gave us a tour of the first floor amenities and also showed us how to get to all of the major sites on a free (yet very detailed) map. They offered us a "deluxe" room for an extra 25 euro and showed us both rooms, but we opted to stick to our original booking. We did not feel pressured to take the larger room. The "classic" room was small, but it did have a queen-size bed that was quite comfortable. Besides the size, the room was excellent in almost every way. It was extremely clean and everything felt brand new. The 32" LCD TV came with Sky TV and the shower had great water pressure. My only complaint would be that the shower water temperature was not stable (probably affected by other other guests using their bathrooms at the same time). The hotel has a "happy hour" from 6 to 10PM every day, which means half price drinks and sandwiches. They also put out a substantial amount of free food during this time. It was a welcome way to end a long day of touring to come back to the hotel and enjoy a perfectly mixed drink for about 3 euro. The lobby lounge was comfortable, although the furniture in the lounge and upper floor hallways did show some wear. The included breakfast buffet was bountiful and clean. There were a wide variety of options including eggs, hash browns, sausage, canadian bacon, cheeses, cold cuts, bread, and pastries. Drip coffee was free but you could order espresso. To top it all off, this hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance to many major sites (very close to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps) and also near many excellent restaurants. The Metro stop was less than 100 yards away and connects with Termini station (for the train to the airport and many other destinations). The concierge / hotel reception was knowledgeable and provided several good restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT-PERFECT-PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMALIA7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classy hotel, clean, and a few steps away from the metro station, "Fermata Flaminio" -Piazza del Popolo. The service of the staff is EXCELLENT. Everyone- from the reseption desk to the cleanig lady has a large smile that makes you feel even better. If you need any directions, they are more than glad to give you. The room was a deluxe double room, spacious and they had little shampoo,shower gel and shower caps (like most hotels do) PLUS conditioner-musk, qtips, and many more little stuff that i loved. Breakfst is for kings- great variety of food and fruits. I also adored the little details- the light in the wardrobe, the weather forecast for the next day left for us on the bed written on a small card. This is what all hotels should be like.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: VaBenny66
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay the week before Christmas. The rooms are small but well furnished and comfortable. My wife simply loved this place. The breakfast was perfect fuel for our daily explorations of Rome. The hotel is in a good location with easy access to the metro and within walking distance of major sights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again. The only draw back was that the room was too hot. We had the window open every night. We will definitely try to stay there the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: NewmanWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Palace for 3 nights. From the hotel I recommend you catch the Terravision bus into the Centre of Rome which costs 8 euros return. When we arrived in the City we had a taxi to the hotel which cost 28 euros for 4 people. However on the way back to the airport we caught the tube (which is 4 stops from the hotel to the Centre) and that cost 1 euro each so was a lot cheaper. The hotel was located down a side street but had an excellent location for sightseeing. For example The hotel was about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and about 30 minutes walk to the vatican/St Peters Square. The hotel staff were very friendly. The hotel offered a room with free internet access, a breakfast room, a lounge and a bar which done really good happy hours. The breakfast was continental and was very nice. The rooms were a lot smaller than on the internet but they were clean, had nice decor and were cosy. Please note if you are going for more than 3 nights then wardrobe space is limited. Food and drink prices around the Sightseeing attractions can be very pricey, best to look down the side streets where you will find fine cuisine for better prices. The restaurant across from the hotel is very nice and the staff are friendly. Sorry cannot remember the name. Rome Sightseeing - Wow

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: papaphila
Reviews.Content: Checked in after long over night flight from New York. The staff made us feel right at home. We stayed in the Borgesi Suite. Very luxurious, with a comfortable sitting room, separate bedroom and large bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub. Room also included a huge roof top terrace overlooking the sights Rome. Great complementry breakfast served in beautiful breakfast room each morning. Super Happy Hour each eveing from 6:00 to 10:00 pm with half priced drinks. Good location, just steps from the Piaza del Popolo, major bus routes and the Metro. Within easy walking distance to Spanish Steps. Just a quick ride to the Vatican. My wife and I loved the quiet elegance of the River Palace. We would definetly stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic! Old roman look mixed with modern convenience”
Reviews.Author: Speedo1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only two minutes walk from the metro, and 40 minutes walk to the Colosseum. The metro is fast and cheap €1 for an hour (how far can we go in the uk for a pound?) The receptionist was very welcoming and throughout are stay very helpful and polite. The room we had was a superior which gave us more room, a bigger bed and the biggest TV I have ever see in a hotel room (32” LG flat screen!) This room would be described as average in size for most modern city’s, but you have to remember that old cities have smaller rooms! that’s why we booked the superior. We are experienced travellers and the River Palace is in our top three hotels we have stayed in; considering this hotel was only a 4 **** it is worthy of more. Breakfast was great just what you need to set you up for the day. There was a massive selection of sweet pastries and drinks, along with all the usual breakfast items. This is a continental breakfast so limited hot food but there is just enough to make a small English. I would defiantly book this hotel again and would recommend it to friends, family and work colleagues. If your staying in Rome STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, better than most rome hotels”
Reviews.Author: nix34
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes walk to the subway, 5 min walk to the beginning of the shopping/main streets. hotel is better than the typical hotel in rome, bathroom and bed are very clean. of course like most hotels in rome have a bit worn carpert, but no problem. the breakfast is really good. staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Service, Nice breakfast, Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kuminda
Reviews.Content: We've booked this hotel through Hotels.com, Booking had no problems at all. Hotel was easy to find. However, it would be easier if they had the name of the hotel out side the Hotel. Reception staff and the South american BellBoy ware wonderful. They helped us for sorting out the luggage problems we had with the Air Line. They ware ready to provide all the support required at any time of the day. Biggest negative is the size of the Room, and the view from the room. If we are consider differnt hotel next time in Rome, this will be the Only reason. Room was very tiny. The floor was carpeted with an OLD carpet that is clean, but not i very good condition. Bathroom was of good size, but the design of the shower+Bath is not perfect. We end up spilliong whole lot of water all over the bathroom when we take a shower. I am little confused why this hotel is rated 4 stars. Where I come from (Dubai) this hotel would barely pass for a 3 start hotel considering the room configurations and facilities available. But te wonderful service from the hotel team probably would justify the extra cost we paid. I would recommend any one to go for this hotel, if you are getting a good price for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: lobbmcfarloand
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a beautiful smaller hotel just off of the Piazza del Popolo. This is great location for walking everwhere. If not, subway station is right there for your convenience. We have traveled Europe many times and know the typical room is small, so that was no surprise. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The staff was very nice and very helpful. Breakfast was very good with many choices. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location good service”
Reviews.Author: isa209
Reviews.Content: we really liked our stay at the river palace the location was great because it wasn't in a very busy or noisy part of the city and it was sooo close to the metro which is a definite plus!! The breakfast was great it and so was the service they also have free internet down at the lobby which i totally took advantage of.. the only bad thing was they didn't have early check in which was horrible for us ..we had just flown for about 13 hours and we arrived at the hotel about 11 am my face dropped when they told us our room wasn't going to be ready until 2pm ..seriously? i guess i was used to the u.s where they check u in at any time..so yeah it sucked that we couldn't take showers or freshen up so we were stuck with a map they gave us to go explore the city for 3 hours all jetlagged and tired.. oh yeah and one more thing i had put the do not disturb sign on the door the next day while we went out cuz i didn't want our things moved around ..but when we came back to our hotel room we found the door wide open with the housekeeper in there cleaning up and moving our things around.. oh yeah and they have the tiniest elevators u will ever see! But those things are just little things we got over and didn't let it ruin our trip..over all we loved staying there with their small rooms and all and we would probably stay there again ..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: RSinNYC
Reviews.Content: conveniently located right next to a metro station. walkable distance to quite a few landmarks. excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: RDEMurrellsInlet_SC
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, handy location near the subway, comfortable beds, large delicious buffet breakfast, tasty snacks and reduced drinks during happy hour and all of this was only exceeded by the courtesy and assistance of the day front desk manager and his entire staff. This is one of the best values and hotels I have stayed at in my extensive travels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “If we go back to Rome would stay here again .”
Reviews.Author: mrnormal
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just off the piazza di popolo but in a quiet street. Limo service from the airport a bit pricey but worth it since we arrived late and were at the hotel 40 mins from getting off plane at ciampino. Got a great deal of 3 nights for price of 2 over a sunday. Front desk very helpful and friendly - recommended good restaurants not too far away and happy to advise on sighseeing tips in general. Superior room size was fine and very clean. Breakfast was superb and happy hour 6-9 in the evenings was ideal before going out to dinner. Only gripes were minor - towel rail was not heated so ordered clean towels every day and the bath needed some re-sealing but thats it. The hotel layout has ben commented upon on this iet but its quirky rather vthan a problem. We were on the 2nd floor and could get everywhere quickly. You can walk to everywhere in the city easily but the metro is less than 5 mins away. On leaving we wlaked 5 mins to the piazza to get ataxi back to the airpotrt for a fixed price of 30 eur. All in all the hotel was a major contributory factor to a great stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Posizione perfetto”
Reviews.Author: chriskats
Reviews.Content: At the end of a perfect hotel in location.Just a few steps from Piazza Dei Popoli and Pincio. Very very close to metro station "Flaminio" and with easy access to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jspice
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the River Palace for 3 nights in Oct 09. We were greeted by a lovely, helpful lady at reception (i've forgotten her name!) who gave us a map and talked us through how to get to all the sites, find the best restaurants etc. We had a superior room which was small, but was of a very high quality. The breakfast buffet was served between 6.30 and 10.30 and was great, loads of choice etc. Location was perfect, we walked to the Vatican (20 mins), Colosseum (35 mins), Trevi Fountain (20 mins) and loads of other sites. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Finally, if you're flying with Easyjet you can purchase bus tickets on the plane (8 euro return) which will take you from Ciampino airport to the Termini station. From the Termini station take to the tube to Flaminio (1 euro). The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Flaminio tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, rooms comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: losangelestravelmore
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be a great base location to see the sights in Rome. Everyone working at this hotel we found to be helpful and friendly. Have no complaints and found it to be an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than a bread box”
Reviews.Author: durhamjw
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while nicely appointed, leaves little room to move. Our room was smaller than the cabin on the cruise ship that preceded our stop in Rome. You had to inch your way around the king size bed and step in and out of the bathroom to let the other move in or out. From now on it is going to be American size hotels in Rome. The staff was also a little less helpful and knowledgable than you would expect from an upscale botique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the River Palace”
Reviews.Author: calicath
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the River Palace, Oct.1 and 2nd. We were very tired after our long flight. What a pleasant surprise the River Palace was. It is very warmly decorated with alot of woodwork, wallpaper and warm colors. The staff was eager to greet us. They spoke english well and immediately showed us around gave us a map and pointed out all the major sites to us. Our room was small, but normal for europe. very clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was very nice, shower was small but adequate. Our room was quiet with a lovely courtyard we looked onto. The breakfast was wonderful. Big, well decorated breakfast room with a wide array of hot and cold items along with wondeful pastries. The minute you step out of the front door there are restaurants and shops everywhere. Took about 20 min. to walk to trevi, spanish steps, pantheon. Lots of good restaurants and sites along the way.. We really loved this motel, only wished we had a few more days there.. We felt so welcomed. It was a great value for our money.....I hightly reccomend this motel. you will not be dissapointed. .........They also have a wonderful little bar with happy hour every night and a nice sitting room to relax in...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: BedrockBucks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the River Palace Hotel for a four night break. Decor and service were both excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a good choice for breakfast. The happy hour, which was 6 until 9, was great value and included free bar snacks. The hotel was very close to the metro, which saved a lot of walking. The room we stayed in was well decorated but very small, so would recommend an upgrade to a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MITIJ
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the River Palace Hotel. The lobby and sitting area are lovely and charming. There is also a bar that we did not use. The room was charming and not a terrible size by European standards. Although, one of our friends room was extremely small. The location is quiet and during our stay the road was being repaired so it was a little inconvenient. The sheets were sumptuous, though. This hotel is close to the Borghese Gallery, but not much else. The breakfast, included in our price was hearty and quite good. Of all the hotels we stayed at on this twelve days in Italy, this hotel had the best breakfast and breakfast choices. The showerhead was very strong which is always important. Would I stay here again? No, I think there were better choices closer to the hubbub. If you want to stay farther from the mad rush of Rome, then maybe this would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel with wonderful staff in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: vmcrane
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the River Palace Hotel for 4 nights. I spent a number of days looking for the right hotel in Rome. Well let me save you the trouble-look no further, this is a wonderful hotel. From the moment we entered the lobby we knew we had made a great hotel choice. The front desk staff greeted us warmly, check in was quick and our room was just as we expected. All staff members at the River Palace were courteous and kind. The location is excellent as it is a block away from the Piazza de Popolo and across the street from the Villa Bourghese. My husband and I walked everywhere-the vatican, the coloseum, trevi fountain, the forum.... The buffet breakfast which is included is great with both hot and cold food. We asked the front desk to recommend restaurants twice and both were good choices . Good food, very close and reasonably priced. I would stay here again if I were going back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely baroque gem in a perfect location, great service and very comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: bellaromaciao
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the River Palace and found it to be the perfect hotel for a Rome vacation. I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor and Expedia prior to traveling and the reviews were overwhelmingly positive and now I understand why. The location is great as you have easy access to the 3 main streets running north/south. It's quiet and they have great a/c. The service was first class and friendly from the evening turn-down service to advice on site-seeing. The rooms are typically small but manageable and the beds are extremely comfortable with luxurious linens, a very important item when one is out walking for 10-12 hours a day. Showers have great water pressure. The included breakfast was wonderful and nourished us all day and happy hour with hors d'oevres is an added plus. All in all, I would highly recommend the River Palace hotel and look forward to staying there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not for the faint hearted.”
Reviews.Author: pdharte
Reviews.Content: The River Palace Hotel in Rome is a lovely hotel and the staff are really lovely. Having said that I would never stay in this hotel again. We had been travelling through Italy for two weeks, staying at six different locations along the way, in magnificent hotels. We ended up in Rome, having stayed in Rome many times before. We stayed in the River Palace Hotel, which has the smallest double bedroom in any hotel we had ever stayed in. We have been travelling for thirty years and this room was unbelieveable. We could not pass each other in the room, we had to move aside if one wanted to get by. We came home with bruises all over our bodies from banging into furniture, and the bathroom is an utter joke. It was claustrophobic. We were on the eighy floor and asked for an upgrade, but they had none. Thank god it was only for two days, I honestly dont think we could have lasted any more. We were delighted to leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: coantrimtripadviser
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the River Palace Hotel. This was our second stay at this hotel and it is every bit as good as it was four years ago. The hotel staff are excellent and nothing was too much bother, not that anything was wrong anyway. The rooms are spotless and perfectly adequate for a city break, although some might think a trifle small but really, how much time do you want to spend in it anyway? Decor is nice and cosy, with mini bar, safe, flat screen TV with Sky etc. If you are like me, breakfast is important and I wasn't let down, continental with loads to choose from. The hotel is in a good area close to the Piazza del Popolo, perfect for shopping and sight seeing. All in all, a very good value for money hotel in the heart of Rome. It would be difficult to get much better without spending a fortune. Oh and by the way, the hotel bar's happy hour from 6 to 9 (long hour!) is great for a pre diner drink as all is at half price!! Enjoy the River Palace, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location- Great Hotel/staff”
Reviews.Author: OfficeJewely
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights from 12th September before heading off to Perugia. The location was excellent and we managed to see most of the main touristy sites. The hotel has an excellent Bar area and Happy hour was 6-9 which we availed ourselves of before heading out to dinner. The staff were extremely helpful and could not do enough for you . The rooms were excellent, really comfortable and the breakfast was wonderful We hope to return to Rome in the future and would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again or recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “warning! do not stay here- is not a 4 star hotel- horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: 02Lexus
Reviews.Content: if you are even considering staying at this hotel- please be warned! it is so awful that i am writing the review while i am here! this was for our honeymoon and our 1st room was so tiny and dirty and backed up to a busy road with construction and it was after an upgrade- how insulting! after complaining and the manager arguing with me- our 2nd room was just as bad if not worse- the smell and hairs all over the bed and shower made me gag. this is NOT a 4 star hotel- i could say so much more but do not stay here! location was not all that great either!

Reviews.Title: “Where was the river???”
Reviews.Author: JustmeHouston
Reviews.Content: Being my first trip to Europe, I was shocked at the size of the room and mostly the bathroom. We even got an upgrade! After getting adjusted to bumping into my husband at every turn, we enjoyed our room. The view from the room was of road construction, not what the name suggested (RIVER palace), but turned out to be a great location. We enjoyed being close and walking to the sights. The hotel staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perks for Rome”
Reviews.Author: dawsoniv
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was awesome, the hotel staff great, free internet, both on the lobby computers and in-room. The hotel also has a great bar area with 6-9 pm awesome drink specials from great bartenders. My only knock is the choppy layout was difficult to get baggage to and from the room via two elevators. Close to shopping and tourist areas too. The rooms are small but get completely dark with their curtains, and they have US and English channels on the satellite tv in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel location was ideal and staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: muirheadman
Reviews.Content: great location; the hotel is 2mins walk from the metro and the city bus tours.10min walk and your in the heart of the city where you,ll see all the sites. the hotel is very cozy has all you need and more for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gee_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small but comfortable, pretty and very clean, and with a nice personal touch to the room service. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A couple of computers are available for internet access. The bar is beautiful and surprisingly less expensive than most of the local cafes and restaurants. Breakfast was very good and there was a wide variety of food and drink on offer. The air conditioning wasn't fantastic in our room, but the one in our second room was effective. The hotel was located very close to the Piazza del Popolo and to the Flaminio Metro station (5 minutes ride from the Termini train station), which meant it was a great and central base for touring Rome. Within walking distance of all the major attractions and always a short Metro ride back when you've run out of steam! We tended to get a 1Euro (valid for 75 mins) Metro ticket that got you to/from historic sites and was great value for money and the system was really simple to use.

Reviews.Title: “OK Choice”
Reviews.Author: hmak
Reviews.Content: The River Palace Hotel is a acceptable hotel. It is a bit worn looking. When we arrived, they upgraded us to their top floor suite with a terrace, which was a nice surprise. The terrace was large and had views of the Borghese gardens, but the view of the street below was anything but bucolic. (There was also a dirty rubber glove on the terrace that was an unpleasant find!). It has a pretty good location just a few blocks from the Piazza di Poppolo. The staff is very nice and helpful. They offer free internet access which we didn't find anywhere else we stayed in Italy. They have a strange elevator system. You have to take one elevator to the 1st floor, then wind your way around the halls to another one to get to any other higher floor. This production takes a while. There was some kind of jackhammer construction going on on the hotel roof. In the morning we heard a lot of noise. There was construction on the street as well. I'm sure this won't always be going on. Overall, this hotel was O.K., but I don't think we would choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good standard hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FrankyD&Sonia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in December 2007. I bought the flights and the hotel package seperately and had no problems doing that saving a fortune in the process. Having read numerous reviews on various hotels in the area I finally settled on the River Palace due to the number of positive reviews. We arrived at the Hotel mid afternoon following a painless flight and transfer (always get the hotel to collect you from Campione Airport - the hassle getting a cab at a reasonable price from the airport is legendary. The hotel was a very pleasant surprise and one of those moments where you feel like you are getting more than you actually paid for - nice feeling. The rooms are quite compact as its an old building but the bigger rooms are those which have a bath - not the ones with a shower. We discovered this when we moved rooms due to the aircon packing in on the first day. Food - very good although a bit of a scrum down at breakfast. Location - very good and fairly central. All in all a very good hotel and a great place to visit - highly recommended. Frank & Sonia

Reviews.Title: “well done!!”
Reviews.Author: maggot136
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the river palace hotel for one week 20/7 - 27/7! very kind and helpful staff, amazing building and decoration , very clean, hugh variety of choices in breakfast., on the whole i was very satisfied.i had a great time at this hotel and i'd like to thank all 4 receptionists fr their assistance in any matter mr.m. mr.a mr.s mr. g !!!best wishes for the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place for a Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wordhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace Hotel for four nights in July 2009. It was absoulutely great! A perfect place for a stay in Rome. The Location is right next to the Piazza del Popolo - just a nice little (maybe 15 min or so) walk from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. We did not use bus or metro once. We walked to the Vatican, The Colloseo / Foro Romano, Trevi-fountain, and so on. Everything is in walking distance. But ok, we do enjoy walking. Our room (we had a superior room) was nice, clean and cozy. And not small. The breakfast was the best we have ever had in any of the places we have stayed in Italy. The service at the front desk was good; they f.ex recommended two restaurants nearby that were absolutely perfect: "AdHoc" and "Al 34". They also told us that Trastevere was a nice and quite cheap area to have dinner in the evenings. It was! Perfect! Every evening we even had a card with the weather forecast for the next day on our bed when we got back to the hotel. The staff at River Palace did their absolute best to make our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with helpfullness of staff”
Reviews.Author: FranBrighton
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel's location to be within walking distance to all the main sites (apart from the Coliseum) and there was a tube station at the end of the street for those that need it. The hotel's breakfast was very good offering a wide selection including hot and cold items. The breakfast was available 6.30-10.30am which meant you did not have to rush. The hotel bar offered a very good "happy hour" for three hours in the evening which was popular as all drinks were half price and bar staff very helpful. The reception staff were excellent at advising you of where places of interest were and the easist way to reach them nothing was to much trouble for them. We stayed in a superiour room which was small but had everything we needed in it. Compared to other european cities we found rome to be expensive but itdid not spoil a wonderful break.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cameronspain
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, two lifts, yes; we had expected all this. We hadn't quite expected such nice decor in the lobby and bar. The location was also great as many of the other reviews say, just a block from piazza di popolo and the metro stop. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. When we were there, they had an apertivi service going in the bar from 6 to 9 with half price drinks and an apertivi spread, which was really wonderful after a hard, hot day of Roman summer sightseeing. Kudos to the very competent bartenders. The bar is really quite posh too, so apertivi became a highlight of our afternoons. AC was great and could easily be too cold. The breakfast spread was also amazing--for shame, American continental breakfasts! I'm really shocked at a couple of the negative reviews I've read here; I'm not sure we could have had a negative experience here even if we had tried really hard. We did, however, get a great summer rate on the room, and I might have had different expectations if I had been paying $400 per night. As it was, however, it was by far the best place I've stayed in Rome and an a steal at the price. Halfway through our stay the lower level lift was down and one of the computers did not work, but this didn't inconvenience us much and hey, it's Italy; if everything were to work perfectly, you'd be missing out on the genuine Italian experience. It's a pity only the whiners get offered free nights at the hotel; how about it, management? :) (Although I suppose that could be considered buying good reviews...*sigh*. As for full disclosure, I have not been offered any free nights in exchange for this review, although I did consider writing a scathing review to try my luck.)

Reviews.Title: “Response to extremely dissappointed horrible reveiw dated 14th july”
Reviews.Author: simDerby
Reviews.Content: After reading the above reveiw while browsing on trip advisor I could not believe I was reading about the same hotel we stayed at last year. Our experience was totally opposite to the reveiw posted. The staff went out of their way to help us with any thing that we needed, from marking the quickest route to the vatican on the map they provided to informing us of the times the open air opera started. Although the rooms were on the small side, they provided us with everything we required. The heavy drapes were an excellent blackout from the heat of the day. Breakfast was excellent (maybe this persons requirements would be better suited by the macdonalds diner) and as for the size of the lift , maybe its time for them to start a diet. We have no hesitation in recommending the River Palace Hotel and hope to stay there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very small rooms, bad tour company advice”
Reviews.Author: Maxmillian_8
Reviews.Content: Oddly enough, my major concern with the River Palace is when we asked for advice for a Rome tour guide, the staff suggested Carrani Tours, which is just this side of a rip-off. We should have checked our tour companies in advance (plenty of warnings on tripadvisor) but we thought we could rely on advice from a hotel of the quality of the River Palace. When we checked in we were given the option of selecting a larger room. When we were showed our room, it was very small, but we figured we could live with it since we would not be there much (the "closet" was only 12 inches deep and the bed blocked opening the closet door so we never used it). You guessed it, when we checked out we were told that was the larger room and we had upgraded. To their credit, the River Palace backed down when we told them we did not know and had not agreed to any upgrade. That said, the location was in a nice area, great Metro access, and walkable distance to most major sites. The hotel is well appointed, the breakfast excellent, and other than the bad tour company advice, the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: molly0003
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The decor throughout was stunning, especially the bedroom and the bar area. Location was excellent we walked everywhere we could but there was also a tube station at the end of the street. Beware of pickpockets though as I had my purse stolen at that very station! Thankfully the incident didn't dampen our trip, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: BarnyardReading
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally situated within walking distance of many of the sites. The metro was two minutes walk from the Hotel which meant visiting other sites easy. The Hotel staff were very helpful giving us a map and showing us where the sites were. The room was rather small but room enough for our needs. Using two lifts to the room was a bit inconvenient. The decor looked a bit tired and in need of refurbishment but didn't bother us too much. The air con worked fine and cooled us down very quickly from the heat of the day. Breakfast was superb with many choices, the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Dissappointed....HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: volntitan
Reviews.Content: Not sure if they planted a bunch of reviews to get a good rating, but I thought the place was horrible. First if you hope to go to the hotel and get recommendations of where to eat, how to do something, where to buy something, forget it. They are nice enough, but ZERO help in that. When we asked how we can get an international operator, they said they didn't know how. Then on to the elevator. Tiny, tiny, tiny. But hey, it's an elevator. Then rooms. Our room was a jr. suite. Very dark and very tacky. The 2 windows, when you peeled back the layers of curtain, looked out on an small empty "courtyard" with a couple of plants and weeds. There was hardly room to put stuff and the beds were ROCK hard. Felt like those beds in the dept. stores where they show off the bed spreads. Horrible. Then the shower. It is a bath with a hand held shower head. It had this glass partition that covered maybe a third of the bath. The water pressure was very strong which is a good thing, but then you end up with water EVERY where and then because the seal isn't very good, you end up with wet carpet in the room. AWESOME. That was our room. My folks room, the AC didn't work hardly at all. They came up and "fixed it" and still didn't work. They eventually, after a ton of begging, moved to another room for the next night which was moderately better, but the hotel acted like they were doing them a huge favor. The free breakfast was what you pay for....nothing. Undercooked bacon, watery eggs, burnt pastries. The front staff was fine, but others were cold and seemed like they could careless. They claim to have internet access, but the wired port in all rooms we tried (3) didn't work, so had to snag random unsecured wireless locations from around the hotel. The location is OK, but not in a great part of Rome. Dirty and tons of graffiti. This is absolutely the worst 4 Star hotel I have ever stayed in. In no way should it be considered 4-star. It is 2-star at best. It is clean enough, but do not think you are getting anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, 3* - 4* experience!”
Reviews.Author: Brandycat
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here from 19th – 22nd June ’09 to celebrate my 30th Birthday. The hotel is situated a couple of minutes walk from the metro station and Piazza Polpolo. We had booked a Delux room but it wasn’t ready when we arrived (bit too early) so we had a drink in the bar and within 10 minutes we were informed that a room was ready. The room was very small (and that was a Delux!) but clean. We had a room overlooking the road / tram line (look to the right and you could see Piazza Popolo) but there was no rad noise to be heard in the room (3rd floor). The room was decorated in a very traditional style with fabric wallpaper, however because so much of the room is the same / similar colour (yellowish) it did feel a little claustrophobic. The bathroom was clean but poorly designed – the situation of the sink and the toilet made accessing the toilet a bit of a challenge. The shower was a joke – the shower head is located on the wall in the centre of the bath whereas the shower screen is located at the far end of the bath so water goes all over the bathroom. In our room the shower head would not stay up until my Husband fashioned a quick fix using the belt of a dressing gown provided by the hotels! The service in the hotel was great, and the lobby, bar etc beautifully decorated. However, other areas of the hotel could certainly do with a re-vamp (the corridor carpet / lifts etc). Upon check in we were given a very comprehensive map of Rome and the Receptionist took time to highlight all the major attractions (including telling us about the not so touristy areas, where food & drink was cheaper etc), and was more than happy to answer all our questions. We ended up using the hotel’s map far more than the one we’d brought with us! Breakfast is served in a small dining area – you may have to wait for a table. There was quite a large selection of food including cereal, fruit, pastries, cold meats and cooked. The quality of the cooked breakfast wasn’t great but I was more than happy with fruit and pastries! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. We rated it on TA as 4* as our first impressions of the reception and bar area was that of a 4* hotel however we felt the rest of the hotel was more on par with that of 3*(in desperate need of some TLC in rooms/corridors and other public areas). The hotel is in a great location and allows you to walk to many major sites: Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain (approx. 20mins), Pantheon (approx. 25 mins), Piazza Navona & Campo de’fiori (approx 25 mins). It’s a 2 minute walk to the nearest metro station to take you to the Vatican, Colosseum and more!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: gillymp
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel using a combination of tripadviser and expedia, and it all seemed too good to be true - excellent reviews and a really decent rate for a city hotel. We knew the reviews said the rooms were small, so we upgraded to superior rooms. These weren't massive either but were lovely rooms of a more than adequate size for a sightseeing holiday. Couldn't fault the hotel at all - beautiful decor, spotless rooms that were well serviced, a lovely lounge & bar area, free internet, great breakfasts (with fabulour espresso - just ask for it), and just a few metres from Piazza del Popolo & the metro stop. I'll definitely be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RaleighMotraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an awesome location in walking distance to Spanish steps (10-15min), Trevi Fountain (10-15 min). We also walked about 30-45 min to Vatican. We took the subway to the Coloseum, there is subway stop at the end of the block that the hotel is on. The hotel is nice, staff friendly, b-fast good, rooms small, quiet block.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Skiranger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to Piazza del Popolo, The staff and generally helpful and friendly. The value is probably OK in a city where most hotels are a bit pricey. The usual small-ish Roman room. There were one or two issues though. Most rooms require you to take two elevators and walk along a corridor. Both elevators were small and showing their age a little. If you have a room on the first floor then you would have to endure a lot of noise from the people walking to reception or the breakfast room. The breakfast was good, but the room was too small for the size of hotel. The bar was generally good, except during Happy Hour when the one member of staff simply couldn't cope with any more than a few customers. A 25 minute wait just to get served because of the time taken to make a few cocktails - they need to sort this out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: PeterCJ16
