Reviews.Content: Ten of us were attending my sister in laws wedding in Rome and as my wife and I had used the River Palace several times in the past recommended it to the wedding guests as a good base for their stay.We weren't disappointed.The staff were excellent and went out of their way arranging transportation,looking after luggage and in general making it a special occasion.The hotel is right beside Piazza del Popolo which is within walking distance of The Spanish Steps,Trevi fountain,Pantheon etc.If you are looking for a comfortable,reasonably priced,centrally located hotel with a friendly atmosphere and extremely helpful staff for your stay in Rome I thoroughly recommend the River Palace. I must also mention Restaurant Canova across the Piazza del Popolo from the hotel.They arranged the evening meal after the wedding and the food,service and atmosphere were all excellent.They even organised a wedding cake at short notice

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Would got back tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after a tour of Italy, and based on reviews on Trip Advisor, and weren't disappointed. It was wonderful. We arrived early, and didn't expect to be able to check in, but the staff couldn't do enough to get our room ready for us almost immediately. The rooms are quite small, but beautifully decorated. The location is perfect, close enough to walk everywhere, or to catch public transport if you choose to. There is free internet, a real bonus in Europe, and a happy hour in their very comfortable bar area, with free snacks. The staff made numerous calls to transfer companies when we had no copy of our airport transfers (another story!), to locate the company and ensure we were picked up on time. Breakfasts were great - toast would be good though - and there were plenty of places close by to eat out which were reasonably priced, or within a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, and a great Happy Hour!”
Reviews.Author: borymas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early June 09. It 's in a good location, only five minutes' walk from the Via del Corso, ten minutes from the Spanish Steps. It was easy to get to (train from Fiumicino to Termini, four stops on the Metropolitana to Flaminio), though the entrance is so discreet we nearly walked past it. All the staff were unfailingly cheerful, courteous and obliging, the room was quiet and comfortable (though the AC struggled a bit), and the breakfasts included tasty fresh fruit and pastries. The coffee was poor, though; ask the staff to bring you a cappuccino. The best thing was the happy hour, with half-price drinks from 6 to 9 pm and plenty of sandwiches and nuts to keep you going till dinnertime. Oh yes, and free Internet access. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: catwalk724
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Palace for two nights at the end of May. This was our first stop on our 3-legged trip to Italy. We had heard some pretty bad stories about the hotels in Rome in general, so we weren't expecting much. So, you can imagine we were pleasantly surprised when we walked through the lobby and were greeted by Georgio at the concierge desk. The lobby was clean and welcoming and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is central -- within 3 min walking distance to the train and just a few minutes further to Piazza del Popolo. You can also walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain if you're up for a 15-20 minute stroll. It's particularly lovely in the evening. The best part of our stay was the amazing breakfast spread (complimentary). It included eggs, meats, cheeses, fruits, veggies, pastries, and juices. It was really a great start to each morning!! River Palace had the best breakfast out of the three different hotels we stayed in throughout our trip. Overall, nice hotel. Good price for the location. The rooms are tiny, but we expected that, so we weren't too disappointed. They had free internet with several computers set up in the lobby - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful except for the shower”
Reviews.Author: CoralReef
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a Deluxe room at the River Palace Hotel for 140 €, about six months in advance. I thought this was a pretty good deal for such a nice hotel, especially since their rates just kept going up with time. When we checked in at about 10 AM, there were no Deluxe rooms ready, but they offered us immediate access to a Superior for 20 € more per night. I hadn’t booked a Superior because I didn’t think a few additional square feet of space were worth 20 €, but it’s a different story when you arrive jet-lagged and grimy. We basically paid an extra $84 (20 € per night for three nights) just to get a shower right away. At the time, it seemed like a bargain! Just be aware, if you get a good deal, you might have to pay more if you are not willing to wait for your room class. The River Palace hotel facilities, staff, and room were all very, very nice. Not too small for a Rome hotel room, and every amenity you could ask for-- including a digital safe, Sky TV, thermostat-controlled air conditioning, and bathrobes. They even provided turn-down service with chocolates, weather forecast card, and a linen towel by the bed to step on. I wasn’t fond of the “musk” scent of the shampoo and conditioner, but they were good quality. The only issue we had was (ironically) our $84 shower. I would call it a “sprinkle” rather than a “shower”. The water pressure was low; and even with the cold tap turned entirely off, the water was more warm than hot. The only other "problem" (if you can call it that!) was that the room was so quiet and the blackout shades so good, we overslept the first morning and missed our Galleria Borghese reservation. Free Internet in the lobby was a plus. The hotel breakfast was fabulous! Even better than last year’s hotel (which was very good). In addition to the standard breads, cheeses, cold cuts, yogurt, cereals, muesli, milk, juices, and fruit, they also offered hot dishes such as scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon. All delicious. You could get a cappuccino with some effort to make a request, but their regular coffee was so good that I only bothered once. And their pastries were incredible! I still miss their hazelnut cookies, and the chocolate mini-pies with shortbread crusts. We often skip lunch while sightseeing, so we really enjoyed having such a substantial and yummy breakfast to keep us going. Location was good-- only a couple of blocks from the Flaminio metro, and a 15-minute walk from the Centro Storico. Very nice luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with superb buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ms_aouda
Reviews.Content: We were extremely satisfied with this hotel. Although the location is not at the very center of town, you can walk to the metro within a few minutes and walking to the centre only takes around 20 minutes. Our room was small but cosy, and we appreciated the little stuff such as a few crunches of chocolate and a note of the weather forecast that were left in our room every day. The breakfast was superb, I still remember the extended choices that were offered on the breakfast buffet. Those helped us prepare little sandwiches as snacks while going through town. The staff were helpful, we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start our vacation”
Reviews.Author: desertorthodontics
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a pleasant stay here. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was amazing. The hotel room, though on the smaller size, which seems to be the norm for hotels in Italy, was quite pleasant. The decor was beautiful, both within the hotel lobby and the room itself. A bonus was the complimentary computer and internet in the lobby. Another bonus, happy hour at the bar- 2 euro's for a full glass of wine. The location was towards the northern end of the major attractions, but very close to great restaurants and shopping. We love to walk, and everything for us was within reasonable walking distance. We'd come to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: KittyandG
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the River Palace in February 2009 after reading the reviews on here, and getting an excellent rate from Expedia. Given the rate that we paid, we weren't expecting too much from the hotel, but we were so surprised when we arrived! The check-in staff were really friendly and helpful. We had got an early flight into Rome, and although our room was not ready when we arrived at the hotel (around 10am), they allowed us to store our bags so that we could go and explore the city. The room was small, as many people have said in their reviews. However, it was very smart and clean, and had everything we needed. After all, we were there to see the city, not to sit in our room, so it really wasn't a problem. The continental breakfast included in our room rate was fantastic! In my experience, continental breakfast usually consist of a limited choice of breads and cheese, but the breakfast at the hotel was extensive, with a wide range of meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal, even sausages and bacon. There was also some amazing fresh cakes on offer. Location-wise, we couldn't have asked for more. Just a short walk was the Spanish steps, and all the main sights were an easy walk down the main street. The hotel also benefits from its proximity to the Villa Borghese, a lovely park which provides a bit of a break from the busy city, and is definately worth a visit. The hotel is only 2 minutes from the Flaminio metro station, which is only a few stops on the metro from Termini. We got the Terravision bus from Ciampino airport to Termini, and from there we took the metro to the hotel. This was considerably cheaper than getting a taxi from the airport, and was very convenient. We were very impressed with this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous Hotel with Incredibly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eghow
Reviews.Content: This was, without a doubt, the most luxurious place we stayed in Italy. It is expensive and don't get the basic double. The deluxe is the lowest you should go here as the basic has no room except for a bed. Although expensive, it isn't really that expensive by Rome standards and it was incredibly beautiful, quiet, clean, friendly and helpful. It was just two blocks from the metro and convenient to get just about anywhere. I cannot say enough good things about the staff, from the bell hop to the consierge to the wait staff. They were all super friendly and helpful, made us reservations and made phone calls and helped in many ways. The breakfast there is the only "american style" breakfast we had in Italy and it was very good (also offering Euro style). There is a happy hour in a lovely rececption area with free snacks in the evening. We LOVED this place. I absolutely recommend it and, in Rome, you should pay the extra to have a lovely, quiet ,accomodating place to come back to after a hectic day of touring!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, good location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BobnDoris
Reviews.Content: It had been some years since I had been to Rome and my husband had never been, so we were unsure where would be best to stay. Our preference is generally a little further out of the main city to avoid lots of noise etc, but not too far that main attractions are not within walking distance. River Palace was a perfect location for this. A few minutes walk from Piazza del Popolo, approx 15 mins walk from Spanish Steps, and we were able to reach the Colosseum within around 35 mins reasonable pace. The loby and bar area of the hotel are very nice and the staff very friendly, welcoming and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite for a first night which was a lovely surprise. We didn't know what to expect from the Classic rooms of the hotel but they were very pleasant and clean and sufficient space for a City break. The rooms have usual general facilities (hairdryer, safe, flatscreen TV with Sky, aircon, minibar) but no iron/ironing board. The hotel does offer laundry service, but at additional cost. Wired Internet access is free in the rooms. The hotel bar offered Happy Hour every night from 6pm - 9pm with all drinks half price, which seemed to go down well with the guests as the bar was generally busy during this time. Breakfast was nice with the choice of continental, cereal, fruit, scrambled egg, bacon etc. But worth mentioning, and is generally the only fault we could really find, is that during peak times the food can take a very long time to be replenished. Bread would run out and it would have to be pointed out by several guests that it had and then you could expect to wait until the serving staff were ready to bring it out! Same went for crockery with cereal bowls often running out. This was inconvenient, especially when queues start forming waiting for food (as it was totally self-service) and generally you just want to get out and start your day. That being our only negative comment, we would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would definitely stay again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules1968
Reviews.Content: Booked the River palace after reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor and getting a great rate on Expedia. It definitely lived up to expectations, and then some! On arrival, greeted by very helpful staff, giving us good tips about restaurants/transport etc. Very impressed by our room - had been upgraded to a deluxe as I had requested a twin room. Not huge, but very comfortable and a fab bathroom with great shower. Only gripe was the lighting was a bit dim, but who cares - was just a base for seeing fabulous Rome!! Nice chocs on pillow at night with next days weather forecast. Lovely breakfast. Even better happy 3 hours from 6-9 - a bargain so we made the most of it. All drinks half price including cocktails, which were brill and definitely the cheapest in Rome. Lovely complementary nibbles too. Concierge and reception really helpful as they were happy to print off boarding cards for flight.Great having the internet to use anytime also. Great location for seeing all the main sites. One tip would be to pre-book your transfers from the airport etc. The hotel quoted 55 euros but after reading tripadvisor went with Romecabs (45 euros) and it was a fab service - very professional. Another wee tip - try to pre-book your tours - we got so much out of pre-booking with RealRome tours - tiny groups and a real enthusiasm for Rome - Gerry was brill. Anyway if you're considering the River palace - go for it - you won't be disappointed - I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A place to remember...”
Reviews.Author: CvsV
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and excellent and professional staff. We got an room upgrade. Yes, rooms are not that big in Italy, but is was nice for a couple of days. The room and bath room were clean and you will find a lovely chocolate on your pillow when you return in the afternoon. Nice to have a drink in the bar downstairs after a day of walking through town, with a little snack that is presented to you. You can arrange taxi service from and to the airport for a reasonable price. This way, you are sure that they take the shortest way... The next time we are in Rome we will definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I found this hotel years ago”
Reviews.Author: cgiuffre
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome many times, and this is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms are of course tiny, but beautifully decorated, with great big flat screen TVs. The bathrooms are all marble, chrome, and brass...just stunning. I wish I had such a bathroom in my home. The location is great...far enough away from the touristy areas, but a nice walk to everything. It's near the subway too, which worked out well for us. Believe it or not, the streets around the hotel are very quiet, which isn't too common in Rome. The side of the hotel that our room was on faces St. Peter's Basilica, which is a gorgeous site, day or night. The staff is smart and helpful. The public areas are just as beautiful as the rooms, very modern and hip. Saving the best for last: the breakfast, which is of course included. Forget everything you know about hotel breakfast in Italy, this has to be seen to be believed. In addition to the usual cereals and fruit juices, they had all kinds of pastries and hot buffet choices, all fresh from the kitchen which adjoins the dining area. Super clean, excellent quality. My girlfriend and I couldn't wait to get downstairs every morning. Delicious. The hotel prices in Italy drop significantly after Nov. 15th. I can't believe how much we got for our money in this hotel. I have spent so much more for so much less in the past. I can't recommend the RPH enough. We will be staying here every time we go to Rome from now on. The only thing wrong is that there are a fair amount of sea gulls that nest on some rooftops situated near the hotel, and they make a racket at sunrise, so if your room is close to a nest, you'll wake up with the birds.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, good location, but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: KingDoody
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the River Palace. We booked a Deluxe Room through Expedia and glad we did. It wasn't huge but was fine for a city centre hotel. Good Points: Very friendly and helpful staff Good location, no more than 30-40 mins walk from all the major attractions Room and communial areas clean and well kept Bar - very nicely designed and the 3 hour half price drinks were brilliant! Not so good points: Lift system is crazy, a small lift from ground to 1st floor then an even smaller lift from floors 1 to 8. At busy times it can take you 15 mins to get to reception. If you want palatial rooms this is not the place for you, but rooms are well decorated and clean. Breakfast is fine - but does not vary so after 3 mornings it can get a little monotinous. The hot food is also not kept very hot. Tips Make best use of the happy (3) hour - excellent value and lovely bar If you can afford it, upgrade to a Deluxe Room, they're not huge but you'll benefit from the extra space Make sure you go to Ostia Antica - it's a train trip out of room, but absolutely fantastic The open top tour buses are good value - 2 day ticket for 18 Euros. Visit the main attractions out of peak hours, we queued for an hour to the Vatican mid morning but when we came out ay lunchtime there was no queue at all. Buy a joint ticket for the Colosseum and Pallantines at the Pallantines - the queues are a lot shorter there. Metro is cheap and efficient but not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: fromlondon97
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, the hotel was in a great location, our room was clean, modern and certainly big enough. Staff checked the room twice a day and the overall service was excellent. As we travelled over Easter they served Champagne for breakfast on Easter Sunday - a nice touch. We had a great time and would certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and was pretty happy. The room I stayed in was in the 2nd floor and it was TINY. The twin bed was next to the wall with one small end table. At the foot of the bed was the flat screen TV on top of the mini bar. There was a small desk and if you pulled the chair out, there was literally no room to move around. I had one small carry on and was able to store it outside of the bathroom. Had I brought a bigger suitcase I would not have had enough room to put it anywhere. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very cozy. The room was very nice compared another hotel I stayed in. The bathroom was also very small. The European shower was so small and if you are a big person you probably would not be able to get through the doors. They only provide one big bath towel and one hand towel (not a plush towel, material is like the cloth napkin). They also do not provide a wash cloth. It has a hairdryer and the beauty products are very nice (Etro). It does not have an iron. The exterior of the hotel is under construction and when I first saw it I was very worried. I did not hear any construction going on the whole time I was there. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel offers free internet service which I appreciated. The only problem was one of them was always not working. The breakfast was very good. However, it served the same things day after day. Even though breakfast was a buffet I felt uncomfortable filling my plate or go for seconds because there was someone walking in/out of the dinning room/kitchen constantly. I did not enjoy my breakfast as much because of his/her presence. I understand they have to clean the tables or refill the food but I did not think they needed to be there every minute. There was always plenty of food and empty tables. There were 3 tables seated at the most the entire time I was there. In the evenings, a maid came around and passed out a piece of chocolate and the next days forecast. The last night I was there no one came to clean my room. I notified the lobby and was asked if I wanted it cleaned. Because I was so tired and it was so late, I did not care and all I wanted was a clean towel. One was brought up to my room immediately. I really liked the location. It is not in the center of everything, however, the Metro is 2 to 3 minutes away and there is also the tram. It takes less than 5 minutes to get to Piazza Del Popolo. The Borghese park and villa is around the corner (the property is quite extensive). Spanish Steps and Via Del Corso (high end shopping) are all within walking distance. I walked everywhere and it did not bother me. If I could get a decent price, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Briliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: palcol
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the location, the service from the hotel team, the breakfast and the style of the hotel, Very clean hotel, very helpful staff. felt like we were staying at a much more expensive hotel. Gold leaf detail on ceilings along with hand painted sky ceilings in every room. Beds quite firm however staff soon came to our room and added two big duvets for us to sleep on which made the bed much more comfortable with no fuss at all. Interesting route to the room, we upgraded to a double deluxe, not a massive room but enough for the two of us (the standard room must be really small) ended up on the 7th floor. Have to take two lifts to get there as hotel is made up of several old buildings, however you could never tell. You must go down the end of the road about two blocks to experience the best pizza in Rome. Hand made while you wait, the hotel staff will soon direct you.

Reviews.Title: “Better than they say!!”
Reviews.Author: joeker26
Reviews.Content: Awesome Breakfast, Good clean room - small though!! Super friendly staff!! Cheap happy hour cocktails!! Clean, lovely decor, all round fantastic stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as they say”
Reviews.Author: trip_too_far
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given (804 or 805, can't remember) was tiny. I mean there was just enough room for a bed and you could trip over that when you entered the room. And that was a Double Classic. The bathroom was small too. So we asked to change and took room 205 for an additional €50 a night. The rooms do not have complimentary drinking water or tea/coffee making facilities. This is very poor for a four-star hotel. The rooms do not have wifi access but you can borrow a cable from the front desk and going online is free which is great. The staff are really friendly and welcoming. The buffet breakfast was good with mix of cereals, fresh fruit, tea/coffee, juices, eggs, bacon, sausages, cold meats, yougart, and bakery products. Moving around the hotel is crazy. You have to take one lift to get between the ground and 1st floor and then a second tiny tiny tiny lift to get from the 1st to the other seven levels. Not good for those in wheelchairs, with pushchairs or claustraphobics! It was really annoying but there are stairs. Location is ok - the number 19 tram goes close to St Peters and the Flaminia Metro is 3 minutes walk. But next time I'd want to be nearer the centre instead of so far north of the heart of Rome. There's a Burger King at the corner which is very expensive compared to the ones in London but just one shop before that is a nice Italian restaurant that is cheap and does good pizzas and pastas. Overall I would look for another hotel before staying at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: tyke98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a family trip - all I can say is that we were treated to excellent service for the 4 days we stayed there. The reception staff in particular were friendly, helpful, funny and kind. The bar staff were also excellent - I have to say that staying in this hotel made our stay in Rome really enjoyable. You are right near the city centre, and can walk to many sights. Breakfast is excellent, and the hotel is spotless. If I had to find fault with anything (difficult), I would only say that the rooms are a little on the small side - but then again when you are in Rome, you are not in your hotel room for long!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, small room, walkable to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: RSChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights. The hotel is about two blocks away from the Flaminio metro A line stop which is four stops from Rome's main train station (Termini stop). [When you come out of the Flaminio station, look for the Burger King which is on northwest corner and walk 1.5 blocks north on Via Flaminia; the hotel is on the left]. The front desk was very helpful, speaking English well and giving good recommendations for a restaurant near the hotel (across the street and 1/2 block north past the stop light) and another one near Piazza Navona (D'Orso 80). We were in a classic queen room. The room was tiny (the walls were within 2-3 feet of the bed), but had a large LCD TV. The bathroom was small with a small 3x3 foot shower stall. The breakfast in the morning was good (6:30-10:30am) including eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, juices, fruit, etc. The hotel is in walking distance to various sites (Vatican 25-30 min, Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain 15-20min, Pantheon 25min, Coliseum 40 min, Gallery Borghese 20-25min).

Reviews.Title: “A Very nice and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherrhay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice adn fairly convenient when exploring Rome. We arrived at the hotel around 9 a.m. and could not check in until 3. The conceirge gave us an excellent map to use while in Rome. The map was better than the one I purchased prior to the trip. As with most European hotels, the room was tiny. The bed was hard, but I got enough rest. The shower was small but the bathroom overall was very nice. I don't know why you would want to spend a great deal of time in a hotel room when you are in Rome anyway! The maid service was also pretty good. They have evening turn down service with chocolated that my husband enjoyed. The hotel happy hour is excellent. It is half off drinks from 6-9 p.m. We did that three times over 5 nights. The breakfast buffet overs a variety of foods and it is nice to get something to eat before going out to sightsee. I enjoyed having convenient Internet access off the lobby too. The conceirge booked two restaurants for us which was nice. As most people stated, the hotel is next to a metro station. We only used the metro to get to and from the train station when we went to Venice. The metro does hit some interesting spots, but we walked everywhere. There is what I consider the main street of Rome (Via del Corso) that goes almost directly to the Coloseum. The other 2 street branch off to the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain or Pantheon/Piazza Navona. The hotel is directly North of Piazza del Popolo which offers two nice restaurants and a coffee cafe where you can get a quick bite to eat. If I were to go to Rome again, I would consider staying at this hotel again. I liked the location. There isn't a lot a can do about the room size or the lack of a king size bed, but overall it was a great hotel. I would go into further detail about Rome itself, but I wanted to focus on just the hotel in this review. Don't hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: At the end of January 2009, my wife and I embarked on a European tour, where we visited London, Athens, Rome, Venice, Vienna, Paris, Amsterdam, Oslo, and then we popped back to London. We chose all of our hotels based on reviews that we read on this website, so it is our duty to come online and at least write a short review. Tripadvisor was a Godsend, and we swear by it now. This hotel was almost like a renaissance themed museum. Marble everywhere, polished wood and trimmings, statues, busts, paintings etc. We stayed for three nights in the room that is one grade above standard (superb? Deluxe?), and we found that the room was somewhat small compared to some of the other hotels on our Eurotrip. My wife felt that the room itself was loud and overdone, since there was bright yellow everywhere. I was not bothered one way or the other. There was everything advertised: safe, LCD tv, tea and coffee etc. The toiletries, although of good quality (product of Milan I think, if that is synonymous with quality) were huge tubes of everything in similarly gaudy fluorescent greens, oranges and purples. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but everything seemed to be covered in either gold or marble, which compensated for the small space. The shower was in the bathtub, like so many hotels these days, so don’t be surprised if everything gets wet. Oh, don’t forget that the ‘C’ on the taps actually means that it is the HOT water: I learnt that the hard way. The breakfast was your standard buffet, with bread, cheese, butter, jam, cakes etc. Nothing special, but sufficient to fill your stomach. The service was excellent, in that our rooms were cleaned well, and the concierge/front desk was always very helpful in assisting us. This hotel redeems itself by its excellent location. All things Roman are but a short to one hour walk away. Whether it’s the Steps, the Collisseum, the Palatine, the Vatican, the numerous obelisks etc etc, you are never far away. Failing that, the underground station is only two minutes walk anyway, and is well connected to literally any of the landmarks. (The Pantheon is a bit out of the way though, so you will need a bus, or you will have to settle for walking.) Overall, this hotel is a good tourist hotel if you are willing to sacrifice room space for location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen90
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the River Palace and if we visit the city again would stay at the River Palace without hesitation. The staff are friendly and speak excellent English. The rooms were clean and well furnished, breakfast was excellent. Rome itself is fairly expensive, to find a hotel bar that charges less then the city is unusual and then to reduce the prices by half in happy hour (6pm -9pm each night) was a bonus. The hotel is slightly out of the centre but all the sights are within easy walking distance or you can use the metro or tram which is only a few minutes away. There are a few restaurants in the immediate area and many more a short walk through Popolo square.

Reviews.Title: “Great on all counts!”
Reviews.Author: cristinag1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights and couldn't have been happier. The hotel was in a great location--a few blocks up from the Spanish Steps, right near the Piazza del Popolo. There is a subway stop on the corner, and when we needed to get somewhere quickly, we hopped on that for 1 Euro each way. The lobby was nice and there was a neat, trendy bar on the ground floor. The hotel was clean and quiet and the service great. The night we checked in, we asked what the incredible smell was, and they told us it was the kitchen baking the pastries for breakfast in the morning. The breakfast was incredible, as they promised, fresh baked pastries, eggs, meats, cereal, yogurt, and on and on. The room was nicely appointed with a marble bathroom. My only concern is that the room was small, so my advice is, that if you can afford it, book one of the larger rooms if space is a concern for you.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoo2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second trip to Rome. We chose the River Palace because of the great reports on this site and once again we were not disappointed. We took the train from the airport to termini and then the metro, 2 stops to Flaminio. Exit the metro right at the end of Via Flaminia, and a few minutes later arrived at the hotel. Check in staff were very pleasant and although our room wasn’t ready (we arrived around 12:30) we left our luggage and went off to explore. The location of this hotel is superb, steps from the metro station and also walkable to most of the sites in Rome. We opted to take the metro to the Colloseum and Vatican and walked back. Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona are all within easy reach. Our Deluxe room was standard European city size, but with lots of little extras. Fluffy robes, slippers, nice smellies and an evening turn down service with little chocolates & the next days weather forecast. Bathroom was lovely, with large towels and good mirrors. Only negative that I can think of, is that the bathroom socket was the only one that we could fit our European adaptor into, it didn’t seem to like the other sockets in the room. Room also had a safe and adequate storage space. LCD tv with a few english news channels. The staff in the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was varied: Fresh coffee (Cappuccino to order), teas, several juices, fresh pastries, fabulous cookies, real fresh fruit, cereals, meats & cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages and DIY toast. Everything you need to set you up for a days sightseeing. This hotel is fab and we would definately recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: Robert333
Reviews.Content: Right off Piazza del Popolo, this hotel is a hidden gem. It is situated in a good location for walking access to the Vatican and all major sites. Friendly staff and efficient rooms that are elegantly appointed. Great breakfast buffet. Happy hour for guests at half-price. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel; one complaint”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: I was concerned that the room would be very small after reading these reviews, although I knew that typically hotel rooms in major cities are on the small size; it just makes sense because property is at a premium. We were upgraded to a 'deluxe' room for no extra charge, so not sure how the other rooms compare. This room wasn't huge but was perfectly adequate. Again, it's a big city so we weren't expecting, nor did we need, a huge room. The room, and the hotel, is beautifully decorated and very 'Italian'. Bathroom was lovely, everything very clean. The dark window shades cut out all the light in the room, which is great for sleeping-in and getting over jet-lag. Service was excellent and staffl very friendly and happy to help out tourists. Location was perfect; we walked almost everywhere, although there is a metro and bus close by. It's a great spot though, to walk day and night. Hotel lounge/bar is nice to sit and have a coffee or drink after a long day. Only complaint was that at night, people got off the elevator and talked very loudly so we were often woken up with that noise. It would be nice if the hotel could somehow do something to stop that.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing about the room was the big screen tv”
Reviews.Author: k0k0911
Reviews.Content: I went to stay at River Palace Hotel with the bf expecting a decent sized room but what we got was the smallest room I've ever been in. There is hardy any room in the bathroom to move around in and 3 flies greeted us in the bedroom and the bathroom. The television shut off randomly and the hotel staff was no help as they couldn't understand the English we were speaking to them. After spending a few hours getting rid of the flies we asked for a pot of hot water which we were told would cost us 8 Euro. I guess we had been spoiled by our previous stay at the Victoria Palace in Paris, France that had provided us with hot water to make tea with every single night. I'll have to write their review next which can only be met with praise. Continuing on the carpet in the hotel room looked like it has never been cleaned and the light in our wardrobe would not shut off. My bf had to stick the other end of a hanger in from the side of the wardrobe to turn the light off. I have not had the breakfast yet but I would definitely not come back here for a future stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “If this is rated as the 55th best hotel in Rome-I would like to see the other 54!'”
Reviews.Author: abc123Staffs
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively for business and pleasure and am very critical on what a hotel offers, customer service levels, location etc. From initially making the booking back in July 2008, countless emails asking questions about room facilities, weather etc to our recent stay, I can not fault this hotel in terms of location, quality, room size, extra touches etc. The staff are unique as they are very very friendly, will joke with you, ask if you have had a nice day, go out of their way to say good morning and goodbye but somehow are also totally professional at all times. The rooms are beautifully decorated, lots of extras such as chocolates at night, bathrobes, slippers, mini bar, lovely toiletries etc. The hotel is well maintained and appears quiet homely, lots of places if you just want to sit and relax, read a paper etc. Breakfast is lovely, coffee, fresh fruit, the usual continenatal breakfast with fresh toast, bacon eggs etc-more than enough to set you up for the day sightseeing. You are not rushed at all and the waiting staff are very accommodating. Location is great, we walked everywhere-we were exhausted but it was a lovely way to see the city. Food prices are about 10-15 euros for pizza and a glass of wine but you will be satisfied with this for lunch and at night on the opposite side of the piazza de popolo (2 mins from the hotel) there are some lovely places to try. Hi Res restaurant for a very special occassion and Canova for a lovely, good quality reasonable pasta or pizza dinner with a nice wine. I prebooked Presto tours for our tour of the Vatican-worth every single penny. Ryan was fantastic and I think if we ad done the tour alone it would have been a sheer waste of money as we would have just wandered around the museaums randomly. At the colloseaum you will be approached by tyour guides, they all seam friendly, no pressure and we chose one who saud her boss did the tour and was English speaking, he did speak English but had such a strong accent (Italian I think) I really struggled to hear what he was saying. They then included a free tour of Palatine HIll-this was so boring! the place was amazing -full of history etc but the guy who did this tour talked as though he had swallowed a history text book- if it wasn't so cold, muddy and windy up on the site we would have fallen asleep! All in all, if you cant get a tour for this with Presto tours, do it yoursfelf and get an audio tour for about 4 euros. Rome was amazing and if I was to visit again, I wouldn't stay anywhere other than the River Palace Hotel (many thanks to Diana and all the staff there) and I would do all the yours through Presto (many thanks Ryan). Hope this helps...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: odysseus77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have never been to Europe, so we put ourselves in the hands of a travel agent who booked us into the River Palace; OK by us, what did we know? The River Palace location is just perfect: Located just outside of the north gate of Rome, the entry way to the Piazza di Popolo, it is with in walking distance to all the most interesting sights Rome has to offer. The staff was absolutely wonderful. The front desk personnel are all english speaking and were very helpful especially when it came to recommending a place to eat and making reservations. If we had a question, or had a request, they could not have been better in making sure we were satisfied. The room we had was very clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. My wife and I are already starting to plan our next trip to Rome, and we will, without reservation stay at the River Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ochrisc
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay in Rome. Friendly staff (Sergio was at the desk upon arrival) from concierge to housekeeping. Room (#703 which is facing the street) is nicely decorated and was made twice, one in the morning and early evening. Chocolate and weather forecast left on the very comfortable bed after each evening room-makeup is the best. Carpet a little worn down but still okay. Warm breakfast and abundance of pastries are a welcome delight. Located near the metro (Flaminio) with enough pizzerias to satisfy sudden cravings. Piazza del Popolo is 2 blocks away then continues on to the Spanish steps - Trevi - Pantheon - etc. St. Peter's Square (Vatican) is 2 metro stops (or you can walk to it passing through Castel D'San Angelo. The Colosseum and Roman Forum are not easily reached by foot but easy to reach using the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic River Palace”
Reviews.Author: squashedlemon
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is - friendly staff who welcome you both when you arrive and later after returning from a busy trip around Rome. Breakfast is a simple buffet but well done, with anything from pastries, cereals and fruit to bacon and eggs. The bar is a nice relaxing atmosphere where there is anything from great wine and cocktails to a good selection of single malts! Rooms are compact (Superior), but cleaned to a good standard with a nice firm bed. Even a card with tomorrows weather report was placed in our room every day. The hotel is to the north of Rome on a quiet street, close to Piazza del Popolo. You can get to all the attractions if you like a good walk. Alternatively there is an underground within 5 mins walk which costs about 1Euro each way. In addition, you can take one of many bus tours available round town, which are really useful as you can hop on and off as you like. In our experience we tried the Green Line tours and would recommend using someone else. They not only had poor audio, which was out of sync from where we were, we found they didnt complete the full tour either so we ended up walking. Of course this has nothing to do with the hotel, which we would recommend highly. A very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: madiolosa
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. Bathroom nice, all marble, and good size for 2 people. Our bath had a full size tub (be aware not all rooms have this). The lobby/lounge/bar area was very nice. Friendly helpful bartenders. Drinks and free appetizers were also great for happy hour. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: speeddaimon
Reviews.Content: My first time ever out of the US and the travel agent booked us in this hotel for the leg of our honeymoon. The shower was the best we experienced in Rome, the bed was the most comfortable, the breakfast was expansive, and the location was very good. While it wasn't centrally located compared to many of the sites, it was across the street from a metro station, around the corner from a tram stop, and a short walk to a bus stop. The desk staff was unbelievably helpful and made our stay very memorable (just don't try to ask about the nearest market, we ended up at Porta Roma, a US style mall). I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about staying in Rome and that doesn't mind walking a bit (isn't that what you're in Rome for anyway?).

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: loveitaly50
Reviews.Content: The River Palace is a great little hotel located in a quiet area near the Piazza del Popolo. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were small but well appointed and clean, and the location can't be beat as it is just a short walk to the Metro, which takes you anywhere in Rome you would want to go. There is a lovely bar that is open every evening and their breakfast buffet is the best we've ever had - everything so fresh and a wonderful selection! We would definitely return to the River Palace on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for Rome”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaChic
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip out of the country. Went to Italy with my husband and parents, and we all LOVED the River Palace. Great location, just across the street from the Piazza Del Popolo, shopping, etc and 1 minute walk from the Metro. Fabulous breakfast each morning, and inviting ambiance in the hotel bar each evening. Great service, very friendly staff. Small rooms, but the quality and decor made up for it. I would return to this hotel again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb ambience”
Reviews.Author: ZXgirl9
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. From the moment we checked in the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side but beautifully appointed and the bathroom was likewise small but luxurious. The fridge was on the small side, and the TV was oddly located in a cupboard and didn't have great reception, but you hardly come to Rome to watch TV! We loved having exquisite chocolates and a weather forecast left on our pillows every evening. The breakfasts were superb. The hotel's location just by the Villa Borghese Park was wonderful as I could go for a run every morning. The hotel is minutes from a metro stop and on the main street into the heart of Rome if you want a long walk past lots of enticing shops. The only slightly odd thing in the hotel was the lift situation which was a bit 'Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator'--two lifts required for upper levels, with doors that opened on different sides depending on the floor--but we got used to it soon enough. There were two computers with free internet access for guests in the foyer which we appreciated. Overall, we were extremely pleased with our choice and would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redandwaiting
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a perfect location just 100 meters from the metro and the Piazza del Popolo which leads directly to the bustling streets full of designer boutiques. All of Romes tourist attractions are within walking distance with the Colosseo and the Vatican city easily reached via the metro if you don't fancy the walk. The Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the small side but more than addequate for your stay. They are spotlessly clean with all you need from a hotel room. The Breakfast was plentiful. Just what you need for a day of sightseeing. I would recommend you try a bowl of Carbonara for lunch in one of Romes many wonderfull resturants. Also I would recomend a guided tour of the Vatican Museum. It cost 45 euro each and you got a headset so you could hear the guide. the tour lasted 3 hours but flew by with fasinating information and stories. Deffinatly a must and the best 45 euro spent.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wai to go back”
Reviews.Author: jp1martin
Reviews.Content: "Max", front office manager, and the staff at the River Palace are tremendous. Very polite, efficient and informational. We stayed the end of Nov. The rooms are European sized but quite nice. The hotel is located nicely for our needs, one block from the metro and 1.5 blocks from Piazza Popolo. Just beyond Popolo there are three avenues to walk down with many restaurants and lots of shops. Spanish Steps are just a 15 minunte walk away. One Euro buys 75 minutes of unlimited travel on the metro which translates to up to three Roma sites one could see. The breakfast, which is included, consists of excellent fresh pastires, scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon along with colds cuts and cereal and more. The best breakfast we had on our European trip. River Palace will be our hotel of choice on the next trip to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A slight disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FinlandElina
Reviews.Content: I was expecting quite much from this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and the fact that it claims to be a 4 star establishment. Based on what I had read about the size of the rooms I upgraded my single classic to a superior double for single use. The room was ok but nothing more - the airconditioning was "off" due to the time of the year (what kind of an excuse is that?!) and the phone in my room was not working. There was a light in the wardrobe that was supposed to switch off automatically when you close the door but the door was a bit broken so I had to push the night table towards the door to get rid of the glooming light from the wardrobe that bothered my sleep! The bathroom was small but clean and the towels were of good quality. The breakfast was by far the best value in this hotel - it was rich in choices and fresh. I would not stay again in this hotel. Next time I visit Rome I will book something closer to Pantheon / Piazza Navona with hopefully a better price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: jmnra5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while awaiting our flight out of Rome. We had previously stayed in the Campo De Fiori section of Rome and were looking forward to getting the flavor of a different area of Rome. The room was fine, nothing special, just okay (although the carpet was a bit dirty in the hallway), the turndown service at night was a welcome surprise. Unfortunately, the hotel restaurant was closed and we were not impressed with the ones suggested, several blocks away, by the front desk. The area is a block from the Piazza in a 'bit' of a rundown/less desirable section. However, this is Rome and all you need to do is walk one or two blocks in a different direction for a different restaurant, store or view. The bar and piano player was a nice bonus while awaiting to go out to dinner and the breakfast was one of the most comprehensive in all 4 of the hotels we stayed in Italy. All in all, we think the prices paid were a bit high for an aging hotel that was just a bit off of a more desired location.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lbgizzmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome on our honeymoon and stayed at the River Palace for 4 nights. We had a personal note from the hotel Manager with a box of chocolates waiting in our room which was an appreciative warmth after having traveled from Canada. We loved this hotel and everything it provided. We loved that you had access to free internet and in-house computers. Always pleasantly greeted by staff and the breakfast and food selections were delicious! Location worked well for us and our “must see” tourist destination spots. The restaurant was not open but that didn’t put a wrench in our plans. Highly recommend to others!!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravellers2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the River Palace and found it to be excellent. Unlike other posters we found that all of the staff we dealt with spoke English. It was an excellent place to stay- we would go there again. Only downside was that the restaurant was closed (and looks like it is closed for good) but with so many restaurants in walking disgtance it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: KeswickTraveller
Reviews.Content: How nice to find such a gem in a city of tourist hotels, some good, some bad and most of them just plain overpriced. We found this hotel to be an ideal tourist base. Well staffed, multi-lingual reception and well prepared rooms together with an excellent breakfast all combined to make our three day stay very enjoyable. A great location 20 minutes (but you will take longer) walk through Piazza del Popolo to the Trevi Fountain via Spanish Steps and on the edge of the Borghese Villa & Gardens. 100 metres from the Metro for Vatican etc. We were four in party and found local taxis inexpensive and very easy for dining or just escaping the crowds and going back to the hotel. The hotel has an unprepossessing exterior and small rooms but, as another correspondent commented, you are in Rome so why spend time in your room, for heavens sake!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let little mishaps upset you and you will be just fine ;)”
Reviews.Author: TrinityNicosia
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for 5 days to Rome and we wanted to see everything! The location of the hotel is excellent, so it was possible to walk to almost every possible tourist attractions. The hotel is supposed to be in the very centre (and apparently it is) but the neighbourhood looks quite deserted and scary (we were told it was like that because it was August). I was aware of the size of the rooms in this hotel (thanx to TripAdvisor) but we were pleasantly surprised to get an upgraded room for free (103) which was enough for 2 people, suitcases and shopping bags! The staff is nice and willing to help you but they don’t speak English at all! I mean, they understand you but they cannot utter one understandable sentence. They believe they speak English but the strong Italian accent makes it completely incomprehensible for me. Anyways, I found it sweet rather than annoying  Besides, they knew it was our honeymoon and we expected to find a bottle of champagne next to the bed or at least a fruit platter … there was nothing though. Before going to River Palace I read ALL the reviews on TripAdvisor and now I agree with most of them. I was afraid of the elevator, but having the room on the first floor was a big relief for me. The air-con worked fine (except for the first night when there was a major power cut which left the hotel with no electricity for over one hour at 11pm! It was quite amusing for us to see all the guests in their pyjamas having good time in the hotel bar  The room was very clean and the service was excellent (chocolates on your pillows every evening will be very tempting …) Since we did NOT find any good place in Rome with good pasta or pizza (SERIOUSLY), we were very happy to see a small restaurant right next to the hotel (Flaminia 9, as far as I remember, the same side of the street) where we would eat two delicious, generous portions with a JAR of wine for 25 euros!!! We highly recommend this place for dinner after a long day of walking. So, don't let little mishaps upset or disappoint you and you will be just fine:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Littel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rusty35
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August and really liked the location and the attitude of the people at the front desk. Giorgio was exceptional and Andrea was a great help too. Breakfast is terrific there. But everything comes at a prize, so please be ready for a more then modest room size.

Reviews.Title: “Little treasure in hot hot rome”
Reviews.Author: Trixyv
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff - went out of their way to help us. Really good breakfast, always well stocked and fresh. Great location in Rome - really close to all the sights (particularly spanish steps and trevi fountain). Rooms were small but big enough for their purpose, cleaned daily with fresh linen - the little chocolates on the pillow and daily weather predictions were a nice touch! Well worth its price, really cannot find a bad work to say, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A gem - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bjayyy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Palace for four nights to celebrate my wife's birthday and our 25th wedding anniversary. This a real gem of hotel. It is well maintained and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were well above average. Its reception and bar areas are very impressive - althought he bar is a little pricey. Having seen the reviews about the size of the rooms I upgraded to a de-lux room - a good call and I would reccomend doing so.The rooms are beautifuly decorated and complimented by the classic ensuites. The staff are very friendly,thoughtful and helpful. The evening turndown service acompanied by a little box of chocolates and the next days weather forecast were nice touches. Its perfectly located close to Metro/trams/buses and also within walking distance of a number of the major attractions. My wife received a beautiful book on Rome on her birthday. This is a unique little hotel and stands head and shoulders above the bigger chains offerings. It is one of the best hotels I have used and I would recommend it unreservedly. I certainly intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: I booked the River Palace Hotel through Thomson City Breaks and was really impressed with the hotel. Before making the booking I checked out the reviews on Trip Advisor and also booked a tour of the Vatican through Presto Tours which I can highly recommend. The room was fine but the bathroom was on the small side, but how much of your holiday do you spend in the bathroom!!! The room was very clean and I liked the chocolate left on your pillow every evening, a very nice touch. The staff were very friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to family and friends, and I am sure I wil return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not ethical”
Reviews.Author: MNCFOX
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after 20 hours of travel with our 2 teenagers. We had contacted the hotel for an early check-in (we were arriving at 11:30 or 12 and check-in wasn't until 3). They told us that if we had wanted early check-in, we should have booked the room for the previous night. Ok, well, that's understandable, they can't know when the people who have the room before us will actually check out, even though I am more accustomed to hotels making at least some allowance for earlier arrivals. We also arranged for an airport transfer through the hotel concierge. We thought that after 20 hours of travel, we would be in no condition to figure out the best way to get to the hotel. It was EU$80 but we considered it worth it. Well, we arrived exactly on time, but there was no driver there to get us. We waited at the doors just outside of baggage claim for 20 minutes, with no driver. We finally decided to take a taxi. Imagine our surprise when we were checking out of the hotel and the clerk informed us that they were expecting us to pay for the airport transfer. Of course we refused to pay for a service we didn't receive, but they charged my credit card without my authorization. Now I will have to go through the whole dispute process with my credit card company. It was definitely not worth all of the hassle I will have to deal with now!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to start each day and finish each night”
Reviews.Author: chirodoc2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and it was fantastic, in fact it may have been one of the best hotels I have stayed at in Europe. Truly nice staff that helped us with dinner reservations, tours and any other info we needed. Our room was not ready when we arrived, we arrived about three hours prior to check-in time, but we waited only 15 minutes and were shown to our room, bags waiting for us in the room. We chose the standard room, with a queen bed. It was quaint, definitely not large, but it was comfortable, clean and air conditioned. There is a nice bar in the hotel and the breakfast was very good. On Friday and Saturday night they had a wonderful piano player, very nice to relax while having a drink at the bar before going out for dinner. It is only two blocks from Flamini Metro station and two minutes from Piazza di Popolo. It really can't be beat for the location and definite class of this hotel. I have stayed elsewhere in Rome and you cannot do much better than this. A bad hotel can wreck a great vacation, this one truly enhanced it ours.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bobcag
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean, nice tile modern and comfortable, but very small despite an upgrade. Conceige staff very helpful, cont. breakfast sig. above average, much more than we expected and very good quality, fresh fruit salad, eggs, pastries, hotel in a great location and accessible by metro Two complaints: we booked four rooms, and were placed on three sep. floors. We asked for a recom for dinner for 9 and was referred to Porta di ripetta... I understand that the us dollar is weak, but compared to all other rest. in rome and during our visit to Italy, this was the most dissapointing. Averaged 40 american dollars) PP for one course , small portions, mostly pasta dishes and 2 appetizers, the conceige staff needs to be more thougthful about their rest .recom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Worth the Extra $ for the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: lbom
Reviews.Content: We booked The River Palace Hotel through Northwest World Vacations. The reservation came with a standard room... but having read on this site about how small the rooms were, we opted to pay the additional 50Euro per night for an upgraded (larger) room. It was a good decision. Some key observations: *The hotel is very clean and well maintained. There is a nice lounge off of the Reception area near the bar... the furntiure is modern (updated from what they have on their website at the moment). *The location is ideal - right near the Metro station and Piazza del Popolo. *The Hotel provides a continental breakfast in the morning, but it is much more than a standard continental and provides eggs, bacon and sausage as well as a full-line of pastries, yougurt, juice and fruit. We were very pleasantly surprised. *The front of house staff is pleasant and accommodating. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived (10:30 a.m. due to early disembarking from our cruise), but the Consierge gave us a good local map and recommended some options while our rooms were being cleaned. We only waiting an hour and a half to clean up our rooms... which was nice as they expedited them. *The hotel has nice umbrellas available to use while you are in Rome. It rained a bit while we were there, and they just offered one to us to use while we were out and about. You just return it to the umbrella stand when you return. Nice touch... *We had dinner in the hotel restaurant two nights... expensive... but this is Rome and we are American's with a weak US Dollar. The pasta was excellent, and plentiful... but the meat course was lacking and expensive. I should have just had the pasta and it would have been sufficient. Some negatives... *Television could be better - I know, you are in Rome and not there to watch TV... but one can only watch CNN for so long. *In the Lounge - there was only one English-language newspaper... it would have been nice to have a few more copies available. *No washcloths... if you haven't heard already, bring your own washcloth to Italy if you use one... they are not generally available and they do not have them at The River Palace. Nearby... There is a family restaurant just down the road from the hotel that has fantastic pizza and salad... the best. I can't remember the name, but it is right across the street from the Metro and right next door to Burger King. Make sure to have a meal there... very reasonable and friendly staff. My husband had the veal and loved it. All in all, it was a great location... and for that alone, I would stay there again. It was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Devon-GirlCrewe
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me and took me to Rome & this hotel for my 50th, fantastic! We got a taxi from the airport as we don't speak Italian & thought this was easier. Advised to get a "White Taxi, & make sure they have a meter" cost us 60 Euros with a tip and driver was very good and informative. As most other reviews have said the room and the bathroom is TINY, small but perfectly formed. You are not in your room long so not a real problem. The bed was very comfortable, air-con worked fine, and the little touches of the turndown service, the chocolates were a treat. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and if we do go back would definately consider this hotel again especially because of the location to the sites. If you go the Vatican which I'm sure you will, go EARLY, and be warned they have strict codes for clothing. No bare shoulders (strappy tops), no shorts (although the long golf type ones were being worn). Ladies were told to go & buy a scarf to cover up & then queue again, so please be warned. The weather was extremely HOT while we there, make sure you use sunscreen and wear a hat when out & about, the usual stuff really. A real bonus is you can drink the water and there are drinking fountains dotted all over the place. We got a taxi back to the airport, and walked to the Piazza del Popolo at the top end of the Via del Corso, there seems to be a taxi rank there, we asked the driver how much to the airport, cost us 45 Euros, so worth asking. The only problem all weekend was the 4 1/2 hour flight delay to come home! All in all a fantastic weekend, saw alot of the outside sights, can't wait to go back and see some museums & Galleries. Take comfy shoes you will need them and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Gin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the River Palace during a business trip to Rome, with two work colleagues. When we got there we were told that due to a mess up (certainly not caused by us!), our requested rooms were not available, and we had to stay in “simpler” rooms. Those turned out to be no bigger than 10’ x 6’ with even smaller bathroom! That for the bargain price of €280. We were told that as they had already paid the travel agency (I guess that means the commission), there was nothing they could do and they could not lower our rates to the standard rate for those rooms, which sounded like one of the worst excuses I have heard for some time. We were told that “when” we returned on a future trip we would get an upgrade – not a chance! Whilst I would say that is not an awful hotel, for €280 it does not deserve more than one TripAdvisor star.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Dublingirl78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my mum at the end of April 08 for 5 nights. Booked the hotel due to the number of positive reviews it had received, which was unusual in Rome! Very happy with our stay. Great location beside Piazza del Popolo meant that exploring the city was quite easy - you could always find your way back! Staff at reception were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants etc. Be careful when ordering a taxi at the hotel - we were taken the long way round to our destination and were charged almost triple the fare as the previous night for the same destination at the same time. The staff in the restuarant and bar were very professional (great gin & tonics in the bar with lovely snacks). Room was small, as expected in Rome, but was very clean and comfortable. Only small problem with air-conditioning, which started dripping one night onto one of the beds. Once brought to the attention of the front desk, it was taken care of immediately. Would very happily recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: StevieHinckley_OH
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very attractive and everyone was very nice. I did not feel the bed was very comfortable for the price of the hotel. We were upgraded to two single beds instead of one full size bed. The location was close to the Spanish Steps . The Vatican was about a 20 minute walk and the Coliseum was about a 30 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Oasis in Crowded Rome”
Reviews.Author: ppconnell
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor, we booked it for our last night in Europe following a cruise. I can say that the good reviews are accurate and that this is a great small hotel. It is immaculate, well-designed, and pays great attention to detail. The decor is a very nice mix of modern with the traditional and the location--two blocks from the Piazza del Popolo-- is very good. When we checked in, we were accomodated immediately, although we arrived hours before check-in. We were offered coffees in the very spacious lounge area while our room was prepared. Our room wasn't too small at all, and was beautifully painted and upholstered. The bathroom was spotless and lined in gorgeous marble. We asked them to book us a car and driver to take us on a private tour of the city, and we were very pleased with the company that they deal with. We had a charming and knowledgable guide show us the city in a comfortable luxury sedan. The two drawbacks that we encountered were that the air conditioning in our room didn't work very well and that our Pay TV didn't work. Since we were catching a very early flight, we decided to make it an early night and watch a movie. Since Pay TV didn't work, we had to stay with CNN for an English-speaking station, and had to endure an overly warm room. In the scheme of things, not a terribly big deal. The hotel offers turn-down service with Godiva chocolates and a little card that gives guests the next day's weather forecast. Again, a small but thoughtful touch. The buffet breakfast was a good assortment of both hot and cold items. Again, the room was charming and the service and small touches were wonderful. There is free internet service in a little front room, which thrilled me, email addict that I am. When we checked out, Giorgio at the front desk asked how I would rate the hotel and was genuinely interested in my answer. I told him of our two glitches in the room and that my advice was to make sure that everything worked properly for their guests. They certainly seem to have everything else running in good order: good service, cleanliness, good design of the rooms and public areas. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in what we in America would call a "boutique" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: shellNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four from the U.S ( my children boys were 8and 9 at the time). and we had an amazing time at this hotel. While the rooms were small they were clean and very comfortable. What makes this such an amazing place is truly their staff! I was very nervous about roaming around a city with children in tow where I spoke very little of their language but the staff were so good with directions and help that we became very comfortable. The hotel is in a very safe area and I felt at ease even when my husband was not with me. Some friends had actually stayed at other hotels closer to the center but they had to watch there belongings as they were pick pocketed. I felt like are location was relaxing and where more Romans actually lived. It was also not so far off from the attractions at all and Rome has a great Metro system. I also noted that a lot of the guest were people who visited Rome freguently or had family members there.This is a hidden gem. I loved it !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time and well worth it”
Reviews.Author: srlgh
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel and we decided to go back due to its great location and friendly staff. The hotel is by the Piazza De Polopo and the start of the Ville de Corsa, the main shopping road. The hotel had changed a little since our last stay and have now added a lounge at the front of the hotel with free internet access on their computers and slightly changes the deco around the bar area. We flew into Da Vinci airport and took the train and metro to the hotel and this stops just a 2 minute walk from the hotel, although if you are a family of 4 or more its much cheaper, and quicker, to get a taxi if you book through the hotel before as it took us just under 2 hours to get from the airport to the hotel going via train (including waiting for train etc) where as taxi took less than 30 minutes! (and that was the fast train we got!). As we had arrived early at the hotel they kindly looked after our bags for us and put them in one of our rooms which was already ready for us. The hotel give you maps and information about the hotel and Rome and are very very nice. The rooms are small but you're not going to stay all the time in your room in Rome as they're is so much to do. The rooms are very nicely decorated with marble bathrooms and are very clean. You get a selection of shampoo, conditioner, bath foam, body lotion and little boxes of shoe shine, cotton buds etc. and they are very high quality. There is a mini bar with drinks ranging from 2 euros for a bottle of water, 3 euros for coke and more for the alcohol, there are also biscuits, nuts and other snacks from the mini bar to. At night, around 9pm in our rooms, the maids came in and turned our beds back, put a mat on the floor by our bed and left Godiva chocolates on our pillows (1 per room). This is a lovely touch, the only disappointing thing the second time we visited was that they no longer give you slippers and a dressing gown in your room but we did mention this to them and they made a note as they are always looking to improve on the hotel. The hotel had made a slight error with out room booking but were very apologetic and repaid us with a meal as instead of 2 double rooms they gave us a twin and 2 singles. The food in the hotel was nice for both breakfast and dinner. Breakfast is a selection of pastries, bread, cold meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, cold boiled eggs, fruit, toast, cereal, yogurt etc... you name it, they virtually have it all! You can also pay extra for freshly squeezed orange juice (the orange which is on the side of the buffet is more of a squash) or for omelettes, eggs and other items on the menu but theres so much we didnt want anything else. The dinner was much better than the menu sounded... for example the chicken breast with mushrooms wrapped in pork cheek was just chicken breast with mushrooms wrapped in ham/pancetta. I would definitely go back there a 3rd time! The staff are so nice, the only bad thing... if you can call it that is not having the slippers and dressing gown, although you don't need it as the rooms were a comfortable temperature and they do have heating and aircon if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewDayTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace hotel for four nights in September 2007. The hotel was really good quality, a very enjoyable stay. The staff were helpful and the cocktails in the bar were good, as was breakfast. Our room was clean and comfortable although previous reviewers are right that the rooms are tiny - only just room to walk round the bed and nowhere to store a suitcase. The location of the hotel was great, within easy walking distance of everything and less than two minutes from the underground stop. Despite being so central, there was no noise at night so no problems with a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: beck_hoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the River Palace Hotel. Chose the hotel based on previous Trip Advisor reviews and price. The hotel was fantastic, very clean, helpful staff, value for money and an excellent hot buffett breakfast. The only drwback being the quirky lift up to 1st Floor, then getting a different smaller lift up to the other flors. I guess this is the only workaround in an old building with strict planning laws. We were a group of 7 adults with 3 double rooms and a single room. All double rooms were average size for a European city, but the single room was quite compact. Our luggage got mislaid from Gatwick, so the hotel staff kindly took care of it for us. Whenever we wanted to eat out, again the hotel staff, besides recomending the hotel's own restaurant, give us their own reccommendations which proved spot on. The hotel is located just outside the old city wall, 5 minute walk to a Metro station, or 15 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay.”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghNomad
Reviews.Content: Our son booked us in here for three nights to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary. As part of the deal we were collected at Ciampino airport and dropped at the door. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Almost everyone spoke good English. Some Tripadvisor members have criticised the size of rooms. Ours was compact but perfectly adequate. The bathroom was good. Everthing was spotless. We liked the weather update cards left every evening to help plan our day trips. The hotel is well placed near Piazza del Popolo, Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Infact we walked to all the major attractions with reasonable ease, thoroughly enjoying the experience. The only downside was our poor king prawn evening meal. They were still nearly frozen but quickly replaced with better fare. Apart from that we loved the place. Our room faced Via Flaminia but the traffic noise didn't seem obtrusive

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Classy”
Reviews.Author: kmr47
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome once before and stayed at the St.Regis which was great. With the Euro being so high and St, Regis had no special rates we decided to look for a cheaper place and I was a little worried. I researched and decided on River Palace and actually have to say I enjoyed Rome even more this time. I felt comfortable at the hotel and was able to relax after a hectic day touring. The staff is wonderful and attentive to every need. We booked the Celebration package and it was well worth it. The restaraunt serves a great meal with lots of presentation . The piano player on Fri & Sat night is unbelieveable. We enjoyed the bar and the great entertainment those nights.My only problem would be the heat was a little intense in the room.The rooms I had read were small; I did not find this to be so. I was very satisfied with the room. I will for sure stay there again when I visit Rome. Move over St. Regis even though they are smaller, River Palace is just as good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bjca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and the room was very ornate but very clean. They were also smaller than expected but not enought to cause any problems and had everything we needed. Have to say the lift was a bit of a laugh as it struggled to fit a couple of people in! Reception staff were very helpful and knowledgable with nothing a problem.
