The location was great and found we were able to walk to all the the sites. As for food, wouldn't like to comment on evening meals as we ate out but breakfast was great with a good choice. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in the River Palace”
Reviews.Author: mclean1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the River Palace from 29th Dec 07 - 5th January 08, taking in the Roman new year celebrations. My family had a very positive overall experience at the hotel despite one problem which almost ruined our stay from the start. Before going into my review of the hotel itself i will get this out the way. I booked our stay through laterooms.com as they had the most favourable rate. For the seven nights we stayed there we were offered the rack rate for three of these nights and a good rate for the remaining four. To cut a long story short, upon arrival we were informed by the receptionist that the full cost of our stay was wrong and that we had to pay 50 Euros extra for the extra bed for our child for these four nights. This amounted to an extra 200 Euros on top of the 1600 Euros we had paid for our stay. I booked our stay 3 months in advance and Laterooms were in good communication with me via email and i used this to ensure we would have a double bed for ourselves and a single for our child. I also made sure the rate was confirmed. After talking to Laterooms they told me that they had had a conversation with the hotel themselves to confirm this rate and that if i liked they could trace the recorded telephone conversation with the hotel to prove it. Anyway, i booked into the hotel on the Saturday and i was told by the receptionist that i would not be able to query the extra cost with the manager until he was back on duty on the Monday. This is fair enough, being a small hotel, although i would expect there to be a duty manager on at all times to deal with problems. It took me all of 5 minutes to show the manager my confirmation on Monday morning before i was assured that i would only be charged the rates i was originally quoted by Laterooms, so full credit for their customer service. If only i could have had it sorted out straight away i wouldn't have spent the first few days of my holiday thinking i had a large chunk of my spending money gone already. Why the hotel felt that i would have to pay the extra 50 euros for the four cheaper nights for a bed that was already in the room i have no idea. I'll put this down to bad communication between the hotel and their booking agent, laterooms. THE REVIEW Ok, now for the review.... The location of the hotel is excellent. Just at the top of the Piazza del Popollo (where much of Rome gathers to bring in the new year), superb links to most of the city via a Metro stop just 100m down the road. As previous reviewers have noted, many of the main attractions are literally minutes away. The Villa Borghese and the surrounding grounds just above the piazza are beautiful as well so be sure to check that out. The hotel itself was a little warm and i couldn’t work out how to cool it down so i spent most nights with the window open. None of us could sleep properly until i realised this and as soon as we had a small breeze in the room we slept ok. The satellite television had two English speaking channels, eurosport (terrible picture) and CNN (American news!). Yes the rooms are little (even by European standards) but the decor more than made up for this, i have never stayed in a more beautifully decorated room before. Breakfast was reasonable, although if you are a bit towards the end of breakfast time you wont have as much choice. If you got there in good time you did have a good choice however so i would say that it was above average. I though the little bar, although very quiet was cute. The barman working here was very friendly and chatty. I didn't eat in the restaurant, we chose to eat out every night to try all the little restaurants dotted around Rome. All in all Rome was itself our favourite holiday ever. The River Palace managed to just live up to our high expectations despite starting our holiday off badly. Lastly i would like to say that if you book via a booking agent please call the hotel itself to check the rate is correct. There is nothing worse than arguing with the receptionist before you even get into your room. I would be happy to answer any specific queries relating the hotel/location via email: canufeelthefunk@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hozkhar
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the River Palace as a first stage of our honey moon. It was very good, even when the room was small as many others in europe the service was almost perfect. We got to the hotel at 9 a.m. in a taxi from Fumicino airport that they helped us to book . The taxi charged us 65 euros and was a mercedes benz with a kind driver. Even when we got to the hotel so early they gave us the room, 802. The room was good, but if you need more space you can book a bigger room. We just got to the hotel to sleep. It´s very well located, 100 meters from a metro station, and from Piazza del Popollo. Also you can walk to all the atractions in less than 20 minutes. The breakfast was the best of the hotel. They prepared scrambled eggs, bacon, saussage, jam, salame, jellys, coffee, juice, bread, and a variety of cheese. We did not tryed the restaurant because the day that we were about to eat inside it was closed, saturday. We payed 140 euros per night and I consider this quantity good for the service that we got. I booked the hotel in their website. I had problems with the air condition and with the security box but they were not as bad because we did not called the reception. Ps. The godiva´s were amazing every day in our room, They give them for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: Lots of nice touches”
Reviews.Author: Smuppet
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent long weekend stay in Rome, and this hotel was ideally placed for what we wanted (Close to Stadio Flaminio for the International rugby game, and a stones throw from the metro with easy access to all the main attractions – However, we walked to the Vatican via many of them, and didn’t find that too much of a problem, although it was a long walk!) The hotel supplied us with a good map on arrival, so getting around on foot was pretty straight forward. The hotel was clean with nice décor, and we found the staff helpful and very pleasant. Bar was comfortable and service good. We found the hotel to be peaceful, with little road noise, although we asked for a quiet room and this overlooked an inner courtyard, so we had no view: which wasnt a problem for us. The rooms were small, even with an upgrade, but we expected that from the other comments about Rome in General. The hotel offered a lot of nice touches, such as free internet access, lovely toiletries, and fab bedtime chocolates – I’m easily pleased! The breakfasts were mostly nice, but the day we had an early start for the plane, we found it not as good as they weren’t quite ready for the early birds (No tea, no fruit salad or meat & cheese out ready) However the tea crisis was quickly rectified! The restaurant in the hotel was quite nice, but there are better places closer by. (Recommend Ristorante Porto di Ripetta on Via di Ripetta: An excellent fish restaurant with excellent staff and service.) All in all I would happily stay here again, and would happily recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Frilford
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, 5th to 8th Feb 08. Having read the reports prior to travelling i agree with the majority. Hotel was great and the staff really friendly, anything you need to ask was no problem. We had a really nice room, 102 however it was on the main street so was noisy. We asked to move and there was no problem, we moved to another room that day. The location is north of the city centre but ideally placed 100/150 metres from the underground and an easy 10/15 minutes walk to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The Vatican is 1Euro on the underground each way, only 2 stops. Would recommend the open top bus (110), there are a few companies that do this but this one you can hop on and off all day, runs 0830 to 2030, about 15euros each, and covers all the main attractions. You won,t see the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps from the bus as they are in areas with little traffic passing, however one of the stops is adjacent so easy to get off and walk to them. Just along from the hotel is the Piazza Do Poppolo, and from there 3 streets that run towards the centre of Rome, each street is lined with shops and restaurants. We found eating and drinking can be expensive unless you look around. Some restaurants will charge 25/30 euro for an average bottle of wine and 5-7 euros for a bottle of beer. If you look around you will find cafe/restaurants that charge a good deal less, a caraffe of house wine 6-10 euros and beer 3-4 euros, depends on you budget, we did both and the food was good all round. Taxi from Ciampino should be around 30/40 euros, the driver will start at about 50 euros, so you might need to barter. Cost us 40 euros. We ot the Underground back to the airport 1 Euro each, then onto a bus for 20 mins, 1 Euro 50 cents each, dropped off right outside departures, easy. All in all a fabulous trip, and would recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome............”
Reviews.Author: ShelYorks
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend the River Palace Hotel. We booked a classic double room and although small (as excepted), it was decorated and furnished to a high standard. Room always warm, quiet and spotlessly clean. As I was celebrating my birthday whilst there, thought it was a lovely touch to receive a box of chocs and birthday wishes from the manager (along with the usual box of chocs left on the pillows each evening). Breakfast was good with enough choice. Just a warning though, if you stay over a weekend you may end up having to queue for some time and then find the staff are somewhat overwhelmed by numbers of guests - we had to keep asking for simple things such as dishes, cereal, cups, glasses. Don't let this put you off as the remainder of our stay during the week days was fine. All in all a superb hotel in an excellent location - minutes walk from Piazza del Popolo and easy access to all other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2007
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here in February 2006. Excellent hotel, centrally located with attentive staff. Walking distance to the central tourist areas, very close to the best shopping in Rome and to the Vatican

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia and got a great rate. We booked for a standard room and we were able to upgrade to a deluxe room for an extra 20 Euro per night. Good thing we did - we saw both rooms and the regular room is very small. It did have a great view of Rome though. The deluxe room was much bigger with a big bathroom and a nice tub. Overall this is a great hotel, however I didn't love it. A few things troubled me. 1) We arranged to have a car pick us up @ the airport through the hotel. The car never showed and when we complained at the hotel, they insisted that it was out fault. After some arguing, they agreed not to charge us. Ridiculous, as it was their fault. 2) Even though we had arranged for the upgrade before we checked in, they still assigned us to a standard room. We had to show them the email confirming the upgrade before they would move us. 3) The elevators in this hotel are crazy. You have to take an elevator to the 2nd floor and then you have to take another elevator to floors 2-8. The second elevator is tiny and can only get 4 people max in it. There was always a line waiting for the elevator. When we moved rooms, we moved to the second floor so we could just walk up and down the stairs. 4) Breakfast was okay, but one day we ate late and observed something odd. Breakfast closed at 10:30 and by 10:15 the staff was guarding the pastries. At exactly 10:30 they slammed the breakfast door shut and took all of the pastries for themselves, even though there were still guests in the breakfast room eating. 5) The front desk was useless when it came to tourist attractions. Thank goodness we had been to Rome before and had a blackberry with us! They gave us all the wrong times for attractions and a few times I had to tell them that there opening and closing days were incorrect. If you stay here, double check all of of their information. 6) The bar staff was rude. And this is the only place in all of Italy that Ihave been served a drink without so much as a peanut. The bartender looked put out at all times. 7) the hotel is loud. If you try to sleep past 9 you hear the room doors slamming every 10 minutes while the maids clean it. Annoying. All in all, it was a pleasant stay. There are lots of nice touches here - it is very close to the Spanish Steps. The Godiva turn down service and the welcoming chocolates were lovely. The bathroom amenities were nice. And for the money it was a great stay. It's just has some quirks that could be easily fixed. It seems like their staff needs to go back to school to learn hospitality though! I would stay here again, but only if I couldn't get something else at the same rate somewhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at River Palace”
Reviews.Author: KGJB
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from an amazing 4 days in Rome. I went for New Years celebration and for my mum's 50th birthday with my family and boyfriend. We arrived at the hotel at 2.00 pm and we had a drink in the bar area which was so clean and spacious. We went to our rooms, and although they were slightly small, it was the nicest room I've stayed in. The decor was beautiful, it had everything we needed, a gorgeous bathroom, and the maid brought you boxes of chocolates every afternoon which were delicious! They made it a very special stay for my mum's birthday and were generally very nice and helpful! They even let me practise my songs on the grand piano as I was singing one of the nights! Breakfast was fantastic, location was brilliant, and I would definately consider staying here on y 3rd trip to Rome. I hav stayed in many 4 and 5* hotels around the world, and this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah52
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel for a reasonable price in Rome. In fact I don't think we could've found anywhere better for the money we paid. The finish of the hotel was to a really high standard, the reception staff, concierge, bar staff, in fact nearly all staff we encountered couldn't be more helpful. The turndown service with chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day was a nice touch. The location is excellent. Within minutes of a metro stop and a 10 minute stroll at most to the Spanish Steps. The only downside was that the service at breakfast was a bit hit and miss. However certainly not bad enough to be a major concern and the food was of a good standard. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: firebladebod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Dec 15 - 18 th 2007, we had booked the Celebration Package for 500 Euros. The reason we did this was mainly because of the inclusion in the price of 1x transfer and a meal for 2 in the Hotel Restaurant. I had read that the Taxis operating between Ciampino and the City basically try to charge what they like if they think they can get away with it TIP. The local Government has passed ruling that the journey will be charged at no more than 30 Euros - tell the taxi driver that you know this and you will get no probs. The collection from Ciampino was problem free and the driver took on a bit of a detour around the interesting sights on the route to the hotel. The Hotel itself was a nice surprise and the photos on here dont really do it justice. The staff are without exception excellent although a little overrun at times in the Restaurant especially at breakfast time. The room we expected to get was an upgraded one from the Classic, to be honest I dont know if we actually got the upgrade as offered or not. On the first day / night we could not get the Air Con to blow warm so had to contact reception who sent a man who couldent fix it and so we were given a room change next day. All we had to do was to pack our cases and go about our daily routine as normal - when we got back they were in our new room. Now this room was laid out difrerently, was bigger and had a bath - which is part of the upgrade offer (our original room was shower only ?!?) Anyway the heating worked so we were happy. The Bar is pricey with 6 Euros for a local 0.33 beer and 7 Euros for Heineken. I know its a city and I know its a Hotel Bar but please dont try and convince me that beer costs that much. TIP. Make sure you confirm that the price list you are looking at is the same one as the barmans looking at - apparently the "Computer" which is responsible for updating the bar prices had been lazy and had not produced up to date price lists for the tables in the bar guest area ??! Hello - anyone at home here !!??? Also make sure if you need to drink Heineken, that you are given Heineken and not the Nastro Azzuro "by mistake" The restaurant is very well run and produces very good food. Unfortunately my wife is a Coeliac sufferer and once we had made this clear to the management they produced a Gluten Free 3 course meal for her without fuss. Breakfast can be a bit of a battle trying to avail yourself of all the usual things like plates, (always usefull and glasses (ditto) but once this hurdle is cleared its full steam ahead. The location is very good with all popular sights and amenities within 20 mins walk. The only complaint - and it is only minor is the TV setup. Its got too many foreign language channels to be any more than mildly interesting to English speakers. I mean how long can anyone listen to CNN without going stark raving bonkers. There is also Eurosport but again how much of minority sports can be suffered at a sitting. There are a number of pay to view film channels - but most of them you would not want you kids to watch. So a bit tedious mostly. Theres also a minibar which in our case simply served as a stand for the TV and could have been left out of the room amenities in favour of something more usefull. - Does anyone ever need a chocolate bar in a hurry in the middle of the night anyway - I dont know ?! Getting around was a bit puzzling at first as the day ticket we bought had "Metrobus" on it - OK is it for the Metro ? (underground) or the Bus ? (overground) - we were sent to 3 different Stops at the junction down from the Hotel before asking a local what it all meant. Shortly thereafter we were on the Metro on the way to our destination and the mystery was solved. Eating out - bear in mind if you sit outside it costs extra on top of the food price, and if you sit inside its less - simple as that ! Overall a very enjoyable experience, having read a great many reviews on this site for this holiday and most others, I have to say you get what you pay for mostly. Dont go with huge expectations and be reasonable regarding what you have paid for the holiday. Do your homework and in my experience it will pay great dividends. SUMMARY: We loved this Hotel and were surprised by the high standard of the whole deal. If you have paid for the Celebration package make sure that you get what they offer - in particular the rooms, they are all "compact" but some are more compact than others. TIP The rooms with BATHS are bigger. TIP If the Air Con isnt doing what its meant to - tell them immediately. TIP The rooms on the outside (street side) are fairly noisy (more so if on lower levels) The rooms on the inside (overlooking an internal patio area) are quieter. Neither option has any awe inspiring views. 8/10 for this Hotel - I would recommend it to a friend. Frank Delacoe

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some problems”
Reviews.Author: john026
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, friendly staff and metro around the corner, the standard room which we booked for three nights was tiny. Our room was at the end of a corridor on the third floor, it was roasting (in December!) and to make matter worse the air con was not working. We had to open the windows to ensure the room cools, but in spite of that we did not feel comfortable. One needs to be careful while taking a shower because they were very tiny. The breakfast room was not of an adequate size to cope with the number of guests arriving at the time we were there at the weekend. On an average we had to queue up for approx 25 minutes before we could get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traxstar
Reviews.Content: Hotel River Palace Its on a very good location, just the start of via del corso, 1min by walking, where the Piazza del Popolo are. The hotel is very elegant, so clean, have air condition, personal code lock case, fridgerator, and tv. We had a double standard room, so one big bed with like and half meter from the wall to the bed. The room is kinda small but it wasnt any negative for us, only if you have a very big luggage, the bathroom is very small but clean and have warm water and 2 toilets (i dont know why, maybe for kids). Stand up and put your arms up from left to right, thats how the bathroom are, for us it was ok but for fat americans it might be too small. The breakfast (6.30 to 10.30) was excellent, bread, eggs, cheese, bacon, hams, alot of cakes, drinks and so on.. We stayed at the top floor (8th) so we didnt heard any sound from the street, but its barely any traffic outside the hotel. The elevator take you to the first floor and the rest you have to take another elevator to take you up. Didnt hear so much sound from the other rooms, its like every other hotels in america or asia. I recommend this hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: GMRiga
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for just 4 days on a short break and chose this hotel because it had good reviews on Trip Advisor. And once again, TripAdvisor did not let us down. The hotel is well located almost in the very centre of the city (on a better edge). It is not so close to Termini station, but we thought it would be of advantage because the area near the train station is a bit dodgy. It took us 7 minutes by taxi to get to the hotel from the Termini station upon arrival, but when we were departing Rome, we just took the tube - the tube took like 10 minutes alltogether, the tube stop is just around the corner from the hotel. this was the 2 times we ever used public transport in the centre of Rome. We walked to all tourist attractions from the hotel - Vatican is about 20 minutes walk, Coliseum 20 minutes walk, too. The main shopping and dining area is 5 minutes walk (walk out of the front door, go right 50 metres, cross the road, cross the square after that and here you are! Easy and convenient! The receptionists in the hotel are superb - very friendy and helpful - full marks to them! The hotel exterior at first got us slightly worried.... until we entered the building. I can say that most buildings in central Rome look, let's say, not to the best of the conditions, grafitti is popular almost everywhere but this is kind of standard, I guess. Inside of the hotel is very clean, tidy, and beautiful. Yes, Americans may think that the rooms are tiny, but you have to get used to that - it is Europe and similar situation is in most cities. Breakfast is great + the youghurts and deserts are just wonderful. It was enough for us to last until the middle of the day of intensive sightseeing. Thanks to the hotel management and staff for supplying us with great and positive memories!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The River Palace”
Reviews.Author: elynnw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 3 nights at The River Palace. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - they gave us a map of Rome right when we got there with all the major attractions and train stops. We had to travel with our little Yorkshire Terrier - traveling with a dog can be stressful - but the River Palace was more than accomodating - they even left us a little doggie bowl in our room! The room and bathroom were beautiful, and very clean. We stayed on the street side of the hotel - and it wasn't loud at all. We got a box of Godiva chocolates delivered to our room every night, along with a card advising us of the weather for the next day which was very helpful. The breakfast was delicious - and there was a big variety. We didn't take advantage of the piano bar, but it looked nice. The location was great - right around the corner from Flaminia Station (4 stops from Termini, 2 stops from The Vatican (Ottaviano)). Look for two yellow awnings as you're walking down via Flaminia - one of the awnings has a backwards "R" and a "P" on it - that's the hotel. Not too difficult to spot as it's not a very busy area. It was about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and right next to Piazza del Popolo. We would definitely stay at the River Palace hotel again. The only small complaint we could possibly have was that the room's temperature couldn't be controlled (that we could figure out anyways). It got extremely hot at night, no matter what we tried to do to change it. It wouldn't stop me from staying here again though.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with certain aspects”
Reviews.Author: vaxxy
Reviews.Content: Hi, we were so hopeful about the River Palace! I know people say "you don't go to Rome for good hotels" but I just love coming back to a nice room after a long day out. When we arrived everything looked fine, it was very clean, easy to get to (metro just around the corner) and receptionist was friendly on arrival. We had booked a standard room which was IMPOSSIBLY small. I have stayed in some small rooms before, probably of the same size as this but they looked bright and welcoming whereas this was dull and stuffy. Our room was at the end of a corridor on the top floor, it was ROASTING (in November!), no air con working, sea gulls squawking outside and TV didn't work well. We're not ones to complain usually but the heat in the room was just unbearable. We complained and they did various things like send someone to clean the air con filters etc etc and we ended up 2 nights in that room out of our 3. We didn't sleep well for those 2 nights and were shattered during the following days, this ruined our break a bit. I must say at this stage, the reception staff were all very nice except for 1 who was down right rude to us on several occasions. He is that bald guy called Georgio and he has no business in the hospitality industry. We were finally moved for our 3rd night to a room with working air conditioning but only after we timed our next complaint to when Georgio wasn't on shift. He was totally useless, rude and looked down his nose at us the entire time. The room we moved to was lovely and cool and on the 1st floor instead of the 7th (1st to 7th floor lift is an experience not to be missed). Pros: breakfast friendly reception staff excl. Georgio nice bar/sitting area good location (if you only have a couple of days and are trying to see-it-all, this may be slightly too north for things like the Colosseum and Forum, if you have time it's perfect. Cons: DON'T stay in this hotel unless you are getting a deluxe room or suite, the standard rooms are depressingly tiny. took us 2 days and countless complaints to get moved they switch air con off in the winter (if you get a hot period it's very uncomfortable) although that's fairly standard in Rome Georgio Getting a hotel in Rome is a bit of a minefield but all we needed was a cool clean room to sleep for the 3 nights. We weren't very happy with the River Palace and wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: CardiffJulia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at River Palace for 2 nights for less than £100 B and B. We had a free upgrade. Room 206 was beautiful and spacious, bathroom was beautifully equipped and spotless. View was of a small courtyard so not fab but it made it quiet at night and we spent very little time actually in the room because of all the exploring we were doing. Breakfast was delicious and varied and all the hotel staff were very courteous. Hotel was located approx 100yds from Piazza del Poppola so was great for walking to many of the main sites - Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Vatican city all within a half hour brisk walk. One gripe only about the hotel - when the heating was turned on it became unsufferably hot and we were glad we had a room overlooking the courtyard as we needed to have the windows open all night. Tip - although the hotel staff are more than willing to organise a taxi to the airport the price is 60 euros. You can walk to the Piazza del Poppola 100yds away and get one for 40 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel with a great Location at an incredible price”
Reviews.Author: Jared&Rachel
Reviews.Content: We Booked our trip to Europe for 2, including flight from Charleston, SC to Paris, 3 nights in Paris, flight from Paris to Rome, 4 nights at the River Palace, and flight back home, taxes, fees, and insurance for $3200.00 and stayed at the River Palace Nov. 5-9th. We were very happy with the River Palace. One of the nicest hotels we have seen. The rooms were very ornate, lots of marble, Godiva Chocolates every night, free internet, a wonderful breakfast every morning, a great bar and lounge, fantastic front desk, very close to the Spanish Steps and Metro, a great location. This hotel is unbeatable for the price and location. It is rated #30 out of 1100 hotels in Rome, and all 29 ahead of it are far more expensive and not a better location. The restaurant across the street, all Orsetto, had very authentic Italian food at very affordable prices. The rooms are small, like all hotels in Europe, but we just slept and got ready in our rooms. The rooms were very clean and the bath products were high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basia-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip. The location of this hotel is perfect for siteseeing. Part of the charm of Rome is being able to walk to most attractions. We received an upgraded 'celebration package' since we were on our honeymoon and it included a pickup upon arrival by their driver from the train station which we found extremely helpful. As part of the package, we also received a complimentary cocktail and dinner for two at their restaurant Ziro. While the service was impeccable, the food was just average. The package included a free upgrade to a double room with king bed which was very clean and adequate. The bathroom was gorgeous. The breakfast each morning was outstanding. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1959
Reviews.Content: Great location....one minute walk from Piazza del Popolo; 10 minute walk from Spanish Steps; great shopping streets (Corso)....clean....extremely friendly and helpful staff....free internet....very small room (607).....the size of my bathroom (literally)......we paid 260 euro for one night ($327 Canadian)....arranged for a private car with the hotel to bring us to airport for 60 Euro (very reliable service). Try for a larger room and it's a great hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: adriananyc
Reviews.Content: Great Location, right off of the subway. Very Close to Spanish steps. Delicious breakfast included with fresh pastries and a wide variety of juices, breads, cereals, fruits. Reception was very helpful and honest, made great recommendations. Treated us like celebrity clients - very warm and accomodating. Free internet. Room was nice and bathroom was modern, but very small - too be expected for a large city on a small budget. Lobby area was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel.”
Reviews.Author: elsoc
Reviews.Content: Luckily we booked this hotel despite a terrible photo in the Holiday House brochure. When you pull up, you may be a bit dismayed by the look of the building and the neighborhood, but hang in there because this place and the location is great. The hotel is very clean and well cared for. Rooms are a good size, quiet and and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Special kudos to Diana at the front desk, but everyone was wonderful. Continental breakfasts were good, with lots of pastries for those with a sweet tooth. The location is unbelievable as you are one block from the Piazza Poppola, and the Center of Rome. The Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, the Coliseum, amazing churches and good restaurants are all within walking distance. There are lots of very good restaurants as you wander the center of Rome. But, make sure you stop in for a slice of pizza at Pizza Rustica across from the hotel, and you must have a meal at Osteria Gastone across the street. It is a small, friendly restaurant with delicious food. (Try the Spaghetti Carbonara. Delicious!) This hotel is so worth it, and if we travel to Rome again, we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rome, River Palace and Ziro...”
Reviews.Author: rchanel
Reviews.Content: Rome looks incredible. Even too many things to visit. The Vatican and its museums, The Ara Pacis with the Valentino's expo, the Colosseum and the forums, Piazza di Spania, thousands of boutiques... We should have stayed much longer. What an incredible city and what a nice hotel. The perfect location, the most helpful and friendly staff (especially Sara and Daniele), spotless rooms and marble bathroom (not huge, but neither so small), cozy lounge area with bizarre sculptures and paintings by an african artists, free of charge internet lounge and least but not last a marvelous restaurant called Ziro. Good for breakfast, excellent for dinner. We had the best meal of our trip through Italy. Sara insisted in showing it to us and sincerly suggested to give it a try. At the beginning we didn't even think about it because we wanted to go out every night and discover the most out of this amazing city, but at the end we did try it and we must admit that she was right, I'm still dreaming about the king prawns. We will definetly recommend the River Palace to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, friendly staff, and very close to the subway”
Reviews.Author: Guinn's
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace from August 24th to August 27th, 2007. First, let me warn you that August is a VERY hot month in Rome. Two of the four days we were there, it was over 100 degrees (without the heat index). This is typical in August, so be prepared. Make sure that you bring lots of sunscreen and clothing that will keep you cool and comfortable. Things we liked about the hotel: great location that was close to the subway (the subway is essential to get to things like the Vatican andthe Colosseum), clean rooms with lots of towels, turn down service everyday with Godiva chocolates, great spa/bath products in the bathrooms and a quick and tasty breakfast in the morning. We only disliked one thing. The hotel was not very close to any major sights, so you had to take the subway to get to everything. This was not a problem during the day, but it was a problem in the evening. The subway closed down each night around 9 PM (the official Rome subway signs say that it is open until 10, but we NEVER found a subway stop open later than 9 PM). So, each evening, we had quite a long walk to get back to the hotel. This wasn't a huge problem for us, but other people might have a problem with this. However, many hotels are far from the main attractions, so this is a common problem for tourists in Rome. Overall, I would recommend it others and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HooyooMooyoo
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in Aug07 for my dad's 70th and found it very comfy and extremely friendly. It is about 100 mts from Piazza di Popolo and the reception we got was outstanding. Sara the receptionist is one of the best in the business, I travel A LOT and it doesnt happen often to find such friendly stuff in general. Night shift, house-keeping, porters, all are extremely helpful and speak good or at least some English. Though I took a double classic we got upgraded to a twin delux (superior) and I found it very good. YES, the rooms are small but come on, do you come to Rome to ride horses around the room??? The bathroom is marble, we had a shower and bath and the only minus is their little air con.. in Aug it is a pain in Rome so make sure priopr to your stay that it is working propoerly! other than that I had a lovely stay. Oh, and brekkie, good efficient and filling. if you dont stay there long split your day in 2,after brekkie go to the Vatican which is only 2 stops away(Flaminia metro station is right at the corner) and then walk via Castel del Angelo to Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori(great Blue Ice gelati!) and Pantheon. then back to the hotel, shower, nap and go on the tube to Colisseum (4/5 metro stops away) and walk along Foro Romano to Piazza Venezia and then on to di Trevi and the Spanish Steps. Late afteroon/evening are when these look at their best! But in reality.. the best way to explore Rome is to lose yourself in its narrow streets and just wander around.. Ciao and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Greta hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dlobo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days and really enjoyed it. Staff were great, spoke english brilliantly and were always helpful. Rooms were spotless. Location was great -just slightly away from the crowds but less than 10 mins walk from the Spanish steps, Via Condotti, Villa borghese. Would definitely recommend staying there

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jtriefen
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 7 members of our extended family and the staff treated us all like part of their family. We ended drinking in the bar / lobby area ever night and our final night eat in their restranunt, where we had the best meal of our 2 week trip. By far the best hotel we've stayed in ever! The room are very pretty as well, but I recommend upgrading. The smallest room is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pangadon
Reviews.Content: Hi Have just returned from the River Palace Hotel, Rome. Picked this hotel because most of the reviews on Trip Advisor were positive so reckoned it should be ok. Was not wrong. It was our honeymoon and when we arrived at the hotel, they had given us an upgrade to a deluxe room free of charge. When we got to the room a box of chocs and a welcome message was waiting. We stayed in Room 204 which overlooked the courtyard. It was lovely and quiet. The lifts are rather small but as we were on the second floor we usually walked up the stairs. Breakfast was good, with the usual choice for continental. I wouldn't describe the juice as 'fresh' as we know it in the UK, it tasted more like the reconstituted juice you can get, but it was certainly drinkable. Coffee was good. Waiters were very helpful and friendly as were all the staff in the hotel. The room although fairly small (not a problem to us as we were out most of the day sightseeing anyway) was spotlessly clean. Sheets were changed every day (I've been to quite a few 4* hotels over the years and believe me, not many change the sheets every day!). Would definitely recommend this hotel as we felt it was excellent value for money (without the free upgrade). Should mention that the Pizzeria Restaurant a few doors down from the hotel (on the same side) also gave excellent value for money if you like typical italian food (ie, pizza, pasta, antipasta etc). We ate there most nights. Usual cost of a two course meal for two with a bottle of wine was around 20-25 euros. Only warning I would give is, if you decide to get a taxi from the airport to the hotel, make sure you know what you will be charged. As it was our honeymoon we decided we would take a taxi rather than the shuttle bus. Big mistake. The taxi cost us 90 euros (47 euros on the meter when we stopped), charge 90 because we had 2 small suitcases with us!!! Also, look out for people at the Spanish Steps who catch you unawares (well, naive gullible people like us!), and charge 50 euros for a piece of string. Yes, my new husband fell for it - I couldn't believe it. Would rather have given the money to the beggars on the street of Rome (and there are lots of them)! Well, that's our review. Recommend Rome, it's a beautiful city with lots to see, you'll certainly need a full day to see the Vatican, if you can stand the crowds. Without a doubt, intend to go back to Rome and will be staying at the River Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aldarofr
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel close to main shopping areas but nice and quiet, Everyone complains about the small rooms but ours was fine ,not sure if we were upgraded. This is one of the cleanest Hotels we have ever stayed in and the staff are very friendly. Breakfast is great and there is free internet accessin the lobby. Only one small point the pillows were not that great but you could always take your own.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, brilliant air conditioning, good location”
Reviews.Author: terese77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of all the main sights of Rome, and it is just a couple of minutes walk to the metro station. My only complaint is that the room was very small, but it was clean and had everything we needed, with a very nice bathroom. The air conditioning was brilliant, especially as it was 35 degrees all week! All staff were really friendly and helpful, and they even kept the bar open for us on our first night! Breakfast was also very nice and was available from 6.30am so you can get up really early to see all the sights!! Hotel has two computers in the lobby with internet access which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casa1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the River Palace in June. I was very impressed with the staff from the beginning. I booked the reservation directly with the hotel via email. Diana could not have been more helpful. We exchanged several emails and she assisted me not only our room selection and reservation, but the best location to drop off our rental car, transfers to the airport, etc. Once we arrived at the hotel, we found all of the staff to be exceptional and very intent on making sure the guests were comfortable. They were also anxious to know if there was anything they could do to make future hotel stays more enjoyable. We had a Deluxe room. The room was a bit small, but plenty big enough for two people. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The bathroom was small and the lightting was a bit dim (hotels should really ask women to help them with bathroom lighting) but the bathroom was clean and beautiful with floor to ceiling marble. The room included a free safe and turn down service at night with Godiva chocolates. The elevator from the 1st floor was extremely small and the air conditioning never quite cooled the room as much as I would have liked - but I realize that both of these things are just the quirks you live with when staying in older buildings. This is not to say that the River Palace looks old - the rennovation was wonderful. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary, so we opted for the Celebration Package. I'm so glad we did. The dinner at Ziro was AMAZING. Asia was the perfect host for our dinner and the chef was fabulous - the food not only tasted divine, but the presentation was beautiful. The breakfasts were also delicious with a variety of meats, cheeses, pasteries, etc. The location of the hotel was good for us. It is not in the center of Rome (so it was very quiet), but it was very close to the Piazza Del Popolo and the Metro stop and bus stops were also only a couple of blocks away so we were able to get anywhere in the city very quickly. The walk from the hotel down Corso (major shopping) to the Colloseum was also very doable - if you like to walk. We ate a fabulous restaurant our last night in Rome. I can't remember the name of it, but it was recommended by the front desk and it was easy walking distance from the hotel on Rippeta (ask them and they will know). Overall, I would recommend the River Palace when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: KRURAN
Reviews.Content: Beware this mega turkey! 1. Impossibly small rooms. Having travelled extensively through Europe, this was by far the smallest 4 star hotel room I have ever stayed in. We had a deluxe room, but despite this, opening the closet door meant one could not walk past the bed & thus from one end of the room to the other. 2. Lifts: The hotel occupies 2 seperate buildings. So if you stay above floor one you have to change lifts at the first floor. The second lift is so small that no more than 3 people can fit. This is especially inconvenient when it is used by the cleaning staff as well. Twice during a 3 days stay did we have to wait about 10 minutes after breakfast to use the lift as the cleaners and their equiment occupied it. 3. Breakfast: Bread was often semi-stale. Also, this was the first time I have ever had bad coffee in Italy. They also dont offer refills, you have to help yourself from an 80's style filter pot in a corner! 4. Concierge: Friendly but utterly clueless about restaurants. 5. Location: Central it certainly is not as descibed many times on this site. Few taxis in the area. Asking the hotel for a taxi = 7 euro surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cool rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Leeds38
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights on our 1st trip to Rome. It was very hot ( weather forcast said mid 30's but felt at least late 30's in the sunshine as no breeze most days) so the air conditioning was wonderful when we came back to change for the evening. Didn't eat in the hotel but menu looked good. Walked most places although would have preferred to stay even more central than this as our feet were bruised on the last day with all the walking. Staff very polite. Rooms clean ,small but good sized wardrobe,good shower ,backout blind and free safe. Didn't hear any noise at nights. Got the metro to St Peters on a Friday at 10.30am - queued right around the building but moved quickly. After looking around, didn't realise had to join another massive queue to get into the Vatican. went back on last morning in Rome to St Peter's dome at 8.30am and we were the only people there - it was wonderful and would reccomend the extra effort in getting there early ( as it get's hot in the small staircases too later in the day) Really reccomend getting coloseum ticket from the Palatine - no queue at all there and only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Overall best hotel we used in Italy”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: The good: very helpful and friendly staff, including bartender & breakfast room. Safe in room. Well decorated, very clean, close to transportation, but just off the main tourist areas. Good gelateria, pizzeria and restaurants used by locals; also places to buy fruit, meats, breads, and metrobus tickets. Metro & buses 1 block away; but could walk to Vatican, Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, P. Navona, etc. Choclates & weather forecast each night; welcome chocolates the first night. Large sizes of shampoo, soaps, etc. We would stay here again. Not so good: small rooms with about 2 feet around the bed, little storage (a wardrobe), bath tub that most would consider small, with slightly fussy plumbing (knocking sound when handle for shower turned the wrong way), and small hairdryer that needed to have button depressed to use. The breakfast: usual selection of meats, breads, cereals, juices, coffee, sweets, yogurt (not outdated as one reviewer mentioned - they were probably confused by European dating with day first, not month). We have pictures, but those on the website and posted by others are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, & we didn't even get to stay there”
Reviews.Author: kojis_travels
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were asked to wait for just a moment so that they could check us in & were directed to the lovely lobby & bar area. About 2 minutes later the manager came over & very apologetically told me that there had been a booking error with a group of travelers that were part of a coordinated Holiday tour & they no longer had room for us. One would think this would have been upsetting, but before I could even think about it the manager explained that they had already booked us in a hotel of equal rating just across the Piazza & had upgraded us to a Junior Suite as well. Just what we would have asked for & it was already done. Not only that but the bellman escorted us across the Piazza & they delivered our luggage by taxi on them so that we didn't have to lug it ourselves. Even though we didn't stay a night my husband & I were extremely impressed with their service, as has been mentioned in other reviews. My husband is a stickler for service & can have a short fuse if service is poor, he wasn't even miffed at the situation. That alone speaks volumes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, polite, but way too small”
Reviews.Author: Stanforddjkl
Reviews.Content: Just north of the Piazza del Popolo this beautifully positioned hotel boast quietness, superb furniture and decor, and excellent polite staff. BUT, it is a four star hotel with absolutely tiny rooms. And the en suite - boy if you think the room is small, try the bathroom for size! Getting in and out of the shower was a joke, and there is no bath. Clean it may be, some of the towels were like large J cloths and pretty urgh! The rest of the hotel, and staff were terrific. We drank in the bar, and had a very good meal on the last night. the staff helped us set up a visit to the Borghese Museum and checked taxi's for us. Low star rating purely because the room was so small with no facilities that one would expect of a 4 star (press/nice TV, drink making facility)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wch10
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other write ups on this hotel we felt that we had made a very good decision when booking our room at the River Palace and upon getting to the hotel we were assured of our decision. The hotel itself is great the elevator that everyone keeps mentioning is small but we never had a problem during our 5 night stay. We stayed in a deluxe room #205 and it fit our needs perfect. All of the staff at the hotel were great; internet was easily accessible in the front lobby. The breakfast was good, you do need to ask them if you want a cappuccino though or you will end up with their version of American coffee. They had turn down service for us every night with a hand printed card giving us tomorrow’s weather and Godiva chocolates. They are excellent at the little things. Another nice touch was the note in our room welcoming us to the hotel. I cannot think of a single thing to complain about just a fantastic stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone the value is superb. If you are debating about hotels pick this one you will not be disappointed. For the money you cannot go wrong. The hotel is right next to the Flaminio metro stop and 10-15 minute pleasant walk from Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. Also if you are an Angel & Demons buff the first church mentioned Santa Maria del Popolo is right there in Piazza del Popolo. Have a great stay in Rome and if you take the stairs in the Piazza del Popolo to the Park you have a great view of St. Peters. CIAO! Sorry have picks but the file is to big if need send me email and I will get them to you.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent shower head”
Reviews.Author: houderoni
Reviews.Content: Super fancy. kinda pricey 320 dollars a night but included direct transportation to airport and breakfast. fantastic and complete breakfast. beautiful lobby and awesome bathrooms with good shower head. elegant artwork has two computers with fast internet. great location in north west of rome. 5 min walk from spanish steps and rome,s main shopping promenade. elevators are small and slow. must change elevators to get up to room - perhaps for security reasons, but its not a bad area of town. though it is a bit disconnected from tourist attractions such as the colloseum and pantheon, overall it is an excellent pick. would stay here again - especially if with a girl i want to impress. ps designer shampoo from milan - smelled great.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Rome and it was great”
Reviews.Author: ceaserlk
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. It was nice that they could speak and understand English well. The room was very clean and efficient. We enjoyed the quiet street and the hotel was restful. The breakfast had a lot of options and it was very good. We found the hotel to be in a good position being close to the subway and easy to walk to the main points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: rokkij
Reviews.Content: If you like marble, you'll LOVE the River Palace! This is a gorgeous hotel. Rooms are adequately large, comfortable and complete. We found the shower unnerving, but that was minor. The elevator change from floor 1 to the upper floors only served to drive us to walk the stairs which were spacious and easily available. The food is wonderful, the service is top line. Every care is addressed, every requirement cheerfully solved. We were within minutes of the Metro, the main sights are in easy walking distance, the River close by, the piazza a quick step away. This is a great place to be when you're just beginning to know Rome. The staff of this hotel go out of their way to make your stay not just pleasant, but memorable. You can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Big is not always best”
Reviews.Author: bridget48
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful four days in Rome. We booked this hotel after checking reviews on TA. So glad we took the advise. A warmer welcome would probably be difficult to find. People have complained about the lift. We were on 8th floor and did'nt once have a problem or have to wait. Our room 802 was on the top floor as requested and overlooking the courtyard. It was very quiet with only five rooms up there. The room is very small, but has everything you need so long as you don't want to move around to much, that is the only reason I have'nt rated the hotel 5. As previously stated by others the location is very convenient, and the breakfast very appitising. Cooked breakfast is available at a supplement, and looked lovely. However I'm not sure you would want to start trekking Rome on a full stomach. Would certainly recommend this hotel, so long as people are aware that the standard rooms are very small. We used the shuttle to get to and from the airport - excellent service - kiosk straight after customs - £10.80 pp each way

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Right on Mark”
Reviews.Author: MeisterBerger
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy including a 4 night stay at the River Palace. I booked based on the reviews I read and was more than satisfied. Staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms and common areas were very clean, modern, and in very good condition. Room size was typical for a European hotel but the bathroom was much larger than I expected. Breakfast was standard but food quality was excellent. Flamino subway station was less than a 5 minute walk giving easy access to all the sites. It was also a very easy walk to the Spanish Steps and not much longer to Trevi Fountain. The Vatican was also within a longer walking distance but easier to get to via the subway.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: snbWolves
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a 3 night stay in Rome at the River Palace Hotel and found the hotel to be excellant. After spending many hours on the internet searching for a hotel I finally settled for River Palace and went with my fingers crossed that it met our expectations. As soon as we walked into reception and was greeted by very friendly staff, I knew I had made the right choice. The staff are very welcoming and helpful and speak excellant english. The decor is impressive and everywhere is clean. After reading the reviews on the hotels in Rome I was a little concerned about the size of the hotel rooms, ours was smaller than your average hotel room back in England but it was comfortable with nice finishes and just had a little room around the bed to walk. The bathroom was spacious and shower worked perfectly. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed the breakfasts, they were continental, with plenty to choose from. I would recommend you contact the hotel before you stay to arrange airport transfers, (which they will gladly do), we got a taxi outside the airports and he charged us 65 euros, on the way he was trying to tell us about the sites in broken english and we felt he was doing this just so he could charge us extra at the end. After an early get up and plane journey I just wanted to sit back and relax and take in the sites not spend the journey trying to guess at what he was saying. Anyway, the hotel arranged a private mercades car for our return journey for 60 euros which was air conditioned and much more comfortable. We found it cheap to eat the pasta and pizza in Rome, but the drinks were extremely expensive, a medium beer and coke cost on average 10 euros. Some bottles of wine are quite reasonable though much to my boyfriends' delight!! You get pestered a bit by men trying to sell you useless bits of junk and flowers but they are easy to get rid of and will just go to the next person if you ignore them. All in all, an excellant stay and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy experience in a splendid hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sonny_Crockett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Palace Hotel over the Easter, and were expecting great things having read the reviews. We were not disappointed. It's a magnificent hotel, true to Rome's architectural decorative splendor, yet with modern and classy furnishings. We were offered an upgrade to the only suite in the building with a private balcony and hot tub for a discount, as the previous booking had fallen through. We gladly accepted, and it was magnificent with our every need being fully catered for. The panoramic views over Rome, The Vatican and the beautiful Villa Borghesi make this suite one of the best I've yet stayed in. The location is just superb, right opposite the Villa Borghesi park, Flaminia Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain with the main fashion shops just a few minutes walk away. - Food was magnificent. The set six-course evening menu for 2 was quite simply one of the finest meals I have ever had. Breakfast was very good and tasty, with a wide range of choice. Staff were genuinely friendly and always cheerful and happy, without overdoing it. All in all, I could only find 2 things wrong - first of all the creaky lift from floors 1-8 (which we got stuck in for 10 minutes) and the lightbulbs which didn't work on our balcony. However, those things were minor distractions, and certainly not enough to detract from what was a truly wonderful vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “friendly refuge”
Reviews.Author: timidtravelerUs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay in the River Palace Hotel. I recommend it highly. It gave us a friendly refuge from an awesome and complicated city. I was dismayed at first at how tiny our room was. But, I unpacked , used the closet space, and found we didn't need a lot of room to sleep and relax. Everything was clean. The marble bathroom was small, too, but well designed shower made it useful. I soon adjusted to small space. Opening the window served to cool down the room and make it very pleasant. We were in room on inside court. I slept with windows open each night, and was not bothered by noise. The staff were friendly and helpful. I realy appreciated this, as our first Roman encounters were not friendly. The customs officer really acted as if our passports were contaminated. It was nice to feel welcomed by the hotel staff. Breakfast was fine, and a convenient start to our days.. Friendly waiters. I enjoyed the fruit salad offered every day. There were selections of nice pastries. On the savory side, I really enjoyed little pastries of meat and cheese. I loved the juice, especially blood orange juice. As I did not have a computer, I appreciated the free use of computer in lobby. We, too, received a weather forecast and chocolates every day. The Villa Borghese was very close, and a fun place to take bike rickshaw rides. We took city buses and metro or walked everywhere, and found this place a little off the mainlines, although the 116 and the metro were only two three blocks away. I enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location ...but...”
Reviews.Author: lsl327
Reviews.Content: Hello, we are a married couple 36 and 54 and live in the US. I like this little hotel. Don’t let the location put you off. I was worried about it being too far out of the city center but in reality it is very easy to move around the city from this location if you are willing to use the underground rail or walk. If your goal is the Vatican it is perfect using the underground. It is in more of a neighborhood than other locations and I like that. It felt safe and there are great little restaurants on the same street. As for the actual hotel. It was a nice room with all the comforts of home, minus a large shower. We were in a room on the second floor and our shower was tiny, but we are both small people so it made us no matter. The water pressure was fantastic. We did have a bit of trouble with hot water for a whole day, but they fixed it and all was well. It was aggravating for the day it happen, but in hindsight it was no big deal. Every night we had turn down service with a hand written weather report and Godiva chocolates on the pillow. It was a nice touch. The bed is a little hard, but it has been my experience in Italy that it is normal to have a firm bed. Maybe not at the Ritz, but in normal accommodations it seems to be the standard. The breakfast was plentiful and we always had a table right away. Please remember that you are in Europe and not the US and the breakfast ideas are not the same. I love the cheese and ham and my husband loved the fruit mix. We are easy to please. The one thing that we would complain about and would keep us from staying here again was… the door slamming. The doors are very heavy they are on automatic closing hinges and everyone seems to think it is ok to let them close on there own and slam shut. It is very rude and not helpful from 10pm – 3am for sleeping. It would rattle the walls it was so loud and I can sleep through most anything but not this. I would contemplate changing my doors if I were the owner of this hotel. Please be courteous to the people around you and realize that you are sharing space with others and don’t slam hotel doors, or in this case let them close on there own. If were not for this one problem, we would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is a lovely hotel, clean, good location and a nice staff. Rome is great city and makes for a stimulating vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jack.hens
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a four night stay at this excellent hotel. As many other featured reviews mention, the rooms are indeed tiny, but we decided the lack of space wasn't important to us, we were in Rome to explore not to sit in our hotel room. The staff is without exception very helpful and efficient; whomever looks after guest relations certainly does a very good job. The continental buffet breakfast featured plenty of choice and was very very good. Overall, our lasting impressions of the hotel are the attention to detail, efficient and friendly staff and cleanliness of all rooms and public areas. The hotel situated about 100 yards from Piazza del Popolo, makes it a walkable location to most if not all of the major attractions. We are both in our late 50s and we did walk everywhere; St Peters, the Coliseum, Piazza Navona, etc. For those less ambulatory, the metro system and local buses to most attractions are at Piazzale Flaminia, no more than a 2 minute walk. For a view of the rooftops of Rome walk up to Pincio - ask the staff for directions - about 10 minutes from the hotel. You will then be in the gardens of the Villa Borghese a lovely place for a stroll. We would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone. As said at the start of the review, the only (minor) negative was the room size but we did stay in a standard room, so perhaps a superior room would provide more space. One other piece of advice would be to use the limo service booked via the hotel for the return trip to the airport especially if like us you have to travel back to the airport during the evening rush hour (personally, I think Rome's rush hour lasts all day). The 60 Euro cost was more than worth it - the limo uses the bus/taxi lane so is able to avoid many of the long queues at traffic lights - and meant we arrived in good time for check in.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cyclist62
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in Rome for my Husbands Birthday. I emailed the hotel before we went, to see if they could upgrade our room because of his Birthday. We had a prompt reply advising they would give us a nice room and do something for his birthday. I don't know whether they upgraded us or not, but the room was nice and bigger than I expected from reading the reviews, with a lovely marble bathroom with shower. They also left him a box of chocs and a note from the Manager wishing him a Happy Birthday, which is a lovely touch. We did not have the lift issue as we were on the first floor in Room 101. The only down side was we were on the front of the building and had the usual city traffic noise, however it was not enough to keep me awake after lots of sight seeing and a few glasses of vino rosso! There are rooms at the back facing an internal courtyard and I suggest these may be quieter. We would not hesitate to book the River Palace again. Breakfast was included for us and is a better than average contintental selection.There were also optional cooked choices (at a further charge). The waiters are all very good. We did not get the chance to dine at the hotel as we met up with friends in the evenings. The reception staff were excellent and always willing to arrange visits and tours and also to book retaurants. One we tried was the "Dal Bolognese", just off Piazza del Popolo, as it had excellent reviews in several guide books. Apparently, it is frequented by politicians and film stars, such as Matt Damon, George Clooney and Tom Cruise. Although the atmosphere was great, the food was very disappointing. Two of the dishes we tried were the signature dishes of the restaurant. They were awful! One was a huge pile of mixed meat and vegetable fritters with what appeared to be a candied fruit sauce! The other was 'Bollito', a mixture of boiled (and raw!) meats with a green salsa sauce. Definitely not "the best restaurant in Rome". Other restaurants we tried were excellent, and cheaper, including "Gusto", "Obika" (a mozzarella bar) and "Alle Fratte di Trastevere". The first two mentioned are quite contemporary, while the third is traditional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ruebedoo
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a four night stay in the River Palace Hotel. We went for my birthday and my partner had emailed in advance to let them know this and we received a free room upgrade on arrival. The staff were incredibly friendly and the hotel clean and beautifully decorated. Also we received a weather forecast and chocolates every day which were a nice touch. We thought the room size was a fine for a city Hotel and the bathroom was plenty big enough. We did not eat dinner in the hotel although the menu looked fantastic. The only downside is there was very little choice for vegetarians although this is fairly typical anywhere in Italy. Breakfast was good with a decent choice although as a previous review said the fruit juice was not great! The hotel is brilliantly located and although there is a metro station a stones throw from the Hotel we did not use this and instead walked everywhere as we thought this was the best way to explore a beautiful city like Rome! The only problem we had with the Hotel was that the room was really warm. We had a word with the reception and were told that in winter they turned the air conditioning off (they also had the heating off too) but as a result of higher than usual temperatures the rooms were hotter than usual. You could however open the window which did cool the room down. All in all for a city break in Rome I would recommend this hotel and if we ever returned I would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - very cosy lift !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah117
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4night stay in Rome, with my boyfriend and his parents. It was excellent. This hotel is truely gorgeous. We had 2 double bedrooms, both were exquisitely decorated with clouds on the ceiling!!. I was very worried about the size of the rooms but their not small at all , by my standards anyway. When we arrived in our rooms we had a welcoming note and a box of chocolates, which was very sweet!!. Also the weather forecast and complimentary chocolates each night were a lovely touch.This hotel is very conveniently located near piazza del popolo and the main street. We found the best way to get around is the metro, and their is a station at the end of the street, flaminio. For 1 euro each you can go anywhere in the city. Bargain!!. Also another little tip, their are loads of men trying to sell roses and stupid buzzing toys. They usually want 2 euro for a rose, but we kept haggling with them and got 2 roses for a euro!!!. We booked our flights with Ryan Air and hotel separate with Thomson and got a good deal. If you book a transfer with Ryan air it will cost 10euro single. But we organised a transfer with [----]..This was sheer luxury the driver waited in arrivals in a suit and then took us to a brand new e class mercedes. We were then given a 2 hour tour of all the sights of rome, we saw the vatican, pantheon,trevi fountain, spanish steps, colloseum,eternal flame, forum everything !! He even showed us this amazing keyhole at the malta embassy where you can see the vatican, rome and malta. Amazing!. He picked us up at 11.15 and dropped us off at the hotel at 1400. Perfect, and was 80 euro. Do it !!! Finally I couldnt not mention the lift at this hotel!!. It was tiny!!!. The 4 of us could get in it but it kept jolting!!, very amusing after a few cocktails.!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel hindered by small bedrooms and poor lift system”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCov
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the River Palace hotel near Piazza del Popolo. We have stayed at quite a few hotels in Rome over the years and the River Palace undoubtedly has excellent staff, always helpful and friendly. The ground floor reception and lounge is impressive as is the decoration throughout all the hotel. Reception staff are excellent. Bar is Ok ( Italian hotels generally not too good in this area). Breakfast room and service very nice with a good choice only marred by the awful juices on offer . Bedrooms/bathrooms are very small but ornately furnished, note that baths are ridiculously small and virtually unusable. Achilles heel of the hotel is the lift system; ok to first floor but then you have to exit and take a max four person (two person with luggage) up the rest of the eight floors. Queues and waits can be lengthy at times and quite frustrating. Position of hotel is good as the magnificent churches in the Piazza are merely yards away and the Metro stop is close by as is the 117 bus. Overall, good hotel hindered by rooms and lift system, bailed out by excellent staff and fine hotel decoration.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: morhousedog
Reviews.Content: We have just retuned from Rome and stayed at the River Palace Hotel. My husband and I travel around the world alot and we just loved this hotel! It is spotlessly clean, the staff are wonderful and I really mean that, they are all so helpful and always with a smilley face when they greet you. Excellent rooms, they are a bit small and very very hot. Breakfast was excellent , I really cant praise this hotel enough and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico!!!”
Reviews.Author: hoppy1671
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Palace Hotel, Rome for four days from 12th Feb 07 until 16th Feb 07 (yes i got back today...and so wish i were still there living the Roman way!!) Anyway, this was a romantic city break and both the city and hotel exceeded my estimations. The hotel is located to the nort of the city 2mins walk from the nearest metro station and tram stop. It also happens to be 2 mins from the Piazza de Popollo and Villa Borgeuese and its grounds. The area is reletively quiet so far enough from the husstle and bussle of the city centre but just a stroll from all the Roman ruins and unbelievable sites you can possibly take in. (and Rome is more blessed than most in that respect). The Hotel itself is welcoming, as is its staff who all speak near perfect english. Our room, on the 7th floor was as other reviews state 'small' but ample room enough for 2 adults sharing... it is what you expect of a european hotel room and does have all the required fixtures and fittings. Breakfast is served 'continental' style and there is ample choice. The restaurant can be found on the first floor and serves as the breakfast room and a la carte restaurant of an evening. The bar area is comfortable and relaxing, the waiters and staff dote on your every wish. The hotel does opperate a tab system payable on check out!! We were delivered to and from the airport by the hotel's own limousine service....well it was a mercedes people carrier but took the strain off finding transportation, which is daunting in a new city. Maps and advice were more than helpful. The restaurant served up food which in my opinion is unrivalled in all of Rome.... im no expert but i have never tasted a 6 course meal like it and the wine recommended was just fantastic. My hat really does go off to the chef, it must be the best kept secret in all of Italy....not cheap, the meal cost 130euro for 2, including a bottle of wine and is truly magnifico!! chocolates, a weather report on a nightly basis and a friendly smile and bonjourno everytime you go past the reception adds a final dimention to the hotel. The only down sides to this hotel was the coffee/tea making facilities in the rooms (or ours anyway)...there are none. Also, the rooms are a little warm even in Feb!!! I recommend this hotel and indeed Rome to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TEFMiddlesex
Reviews.Content: Great few days in Rome. Stayed at River Palace, via Flaminia. Small but perfectly formed rooms. Very clean and staff all very attentive and helpful. Breakfast -good choice and lots of it. Good location near Popolo Piazza. We walked everywhere but lots of methods of transport on doorstep. Particularly good for visiting the Vatican. Near Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. Great tip for a reasonably priced good ristorante/trattoria is L'Orso 80 in via del orso. Be Warned--Do not fall prey to fraudster in car asking for directions and then sayiing he needs money for petrol !!! Sadly my advice is trust no-one like this!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dani21cfc
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at The River Palace hotel with my boyfriend. The hotel is beautiful and the service is impeccable. The decoration of the hptel and the rooms are beautiful and although some reviewers have suggested that the rooms are too small we did not think this a problem at all! Rome is such a beautiful city that you will not spend the majority of your stay in your room anyway but the room size is fine anyway! The rooms were beautfully cleaned everyday and turned down each evening with Godiva chocolates and the next day's weather forecast which was a lovely touch! All of the hotel staff are extremely helpful and are very knowledgeble about Rome - they recommended a great restaurant called Gusto! We did not eat in the hotel restaurant for dinner but it has had some great reviews and the breakfast was lovely. We took the Leonardo Express from the airport to Termini and then the hotel is three stops on the metro to Termini. The metro was very busy on the Friday when we arrived so if you have lots of bags you might consider getting a taxi although it is advisable to prebook. That being said, our return journey to the airport on the Monday was stress free and so if you want to save some money then this is an easy option! Rome itself is a wonderful city with so much to see and do! Visit all the typical tourists sights as nothing can prepare you for seeing them in the flesh! We walked everywhere using the map the hotel provided and, although tiring, it meant we saw so much - there are ruins and churches in every street! Make sure you take a tour of the Colloseum so that you experience what really went on and where, there are English tour guides waiting outside and using one of these also means you get to jump the queue! We visited the Vatican on Sunday which means at 12 the Pope makes his weekly address which is an amazing sight to see! The queue for the Vatican museums was, unfortunately, too long and we did not get to see the Sistine Chapel. This was because the chapel is only open on certain days and is free on the last Sunday of the month making it an extremely popular day so if you are travelling on this day bear this in mind! If you are a fan of football a visit to Rome's Olympic Stadium where Roma and Lazio play will be an experience! Italians are extremely passionate about the game and this makes for a true experience of Italian life! I would recommend Lonely Planet as this gives advice about all of Rome's attractions! The River Palace is the perfect place to stay in Rome! I would definately return and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: moimer
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this delightful hotel. Our decision to stay here was strongly influenced by previous reviews. We were not disappointed in any way. Yes, the rooms are small. However, they are beautiful, well appointed and spotless. The staff at the hotel are superb - extremely welcoming and very helpful. Angela at reception was charming and has a wonderful sense of humour! We ate in the hotel on our first evening. We enjoyed our meal very much, but it might be a bit "different" for those with more conservative tastes.
