There are plenty of restaurants nearby to suit everyone however, we took Angela's recommendations and we were more than happy! As mentioned in previous reviews, the situation of the hotel is ideal. We walked to most of the top sights very easily. On Sunday we took the metro to the Colosseum. We were surprised that it was so busy on the metro until we realised that it was a traffic free day. (Anti-pollution measures) Along with many Romans we were able to stroll in the sunshine without the noise of cars etc whizzing by. Bliss! The hotel will arrange pick up / drop off at the airport. As we were a party of four, this was by far the best option for us. A very smart people carrier took us from the airport to the hotel and back. Would certainly return to this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmccann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace from the 14th to the 17th jan 07 and from the moment we entered the reception area we were greeted by very friendly staff. The guy at the reception desk was very helpful,gave us maps and explained how the public transport worked and advised us as to what attractions we should see.The room was first class and very clean.we had bathrobes and slippers supplied, Each evening the bed was turned down, some chocolates and the next days weather forecast left. The location was great and within walking distance of most places. The nearest metro station was just about 100m away overall i would recomend this Hotel to anyone and if i ever get back to Rome i would want to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel - great location for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: LondonDolcevita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in January 2006. Standard of accommodation: The public rooms, bedrooms and bathrooms are all very well presented, modern, clean and comfortable. Classy decoration and furnishings throughout with comfortable beds and marble bathrooms. However the bedrooms are small, so not ideal for people with lots of luggage, for those who plan to spend lots of time in their room or for romantic breaks. If you are tall or well built you may find the shower cubicle small, so ask for a bathroom with a tub. If you find street noise a problem ask for a room at the rear of the hotel, these are very quiet. Standard of service: The staff were very efficient and helpful; when I had a problem they acted immediately. Breakfast was good. Twice daily maid service. Overall I think this is a good value hotel for the standard of accommodation and service on offer and the location. Location and public transport: Located on a mainly residential street in an upmarket area very close to the Flaminio public transport interchange just outside the old city gates at the top end of the Corso. Flaminio metro station provides direct access to Termini railway station (connections for the Fuimicino airport train) as well as Barberini (Via Veneto), Repubblica (shops on Via Nazionale) and S. Giovanni (Basilica). Metro Line A shuts at 9pm due to long-term engineering work, so plan your route back if you are going to be out late. Buy public transport tickets in advance too, this saves time and you can just jump on a bus if you get tired of walking. The No. 95 bus runs quite frequently to the Via Veneto, Piazza Barberini and the lower part of the Corso. Some walking is required to reach Piazza Navona and the area around the Pantheon (approx 15-20mins brisk walk) where the choice of restaurants is greatest, but the upper end of the Corso (shops) and the Spanish Steps are both very easy to reach on foot. Felt safe walking to and from the hotel day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: 11traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel January 9-15. This hotel is in an excellent location a block away from the Piazza de Popolo. And is also easy accessible from the metro exit(Flaminia). Easy to get around the city from this location because the metro is just down the street. Also the Staff is very helpful and gracious. Angela at the front dest was particularly very helpful. We had a lot of options as far restaurants. One place close by that is just a 5-10 minute walk up to the park from the Piazza de Popolo is the Pincio. Excellent view of the city from here. Spanish steps/ Trevi Fountain is about a 10-15 minute walk. And St. Peters is about the same. We would take late night strolls in the Piazza de Popolo and still feel safe. Next time my wife and I are in Rome we are definitely staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CatPeppy
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance to Rome for his birthday and chose the River Palace hotel having read good reviews about it - and it certainly lived up to our expectations! I e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival to arrange a bottle of champagne to be put in the room. Not only was this done, but we also got a free room upgrade and the manager had written a personal birthday note to my fiance and left a box of chocolates as well! The service was outstanding - so friendly and helpful. I would certainly recommend eating in the restaurant - don't be put off by it's small size and almost 'cafe' feel - the food and wine were of an excellent standard and very reasonably priced. The location of the hotel was perfect - only about 30 seconds walk from the metro so you can get to the Colosseum easily and within walking distance of all the other major tourist sites e.g. Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Vatican. We also ate at La Chianti restaurant, just behind the Trevi Fountain and this was an amazing experience - if you love great food and wine (very difficult to choose from their extensive wine list!), you will love this place! Be sure to get there early as it get's packed but this all adds to the atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: Purina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for 3 days after christmas for a special break. The River Palace Hotel was in a great location, walking distance to most of the popular sights and very helpful staff. We were given a free upgrade to a delux room, which was beautifully decorated, very clean but a bit on the small side, although, plenty of room given the amount of time spent in it. The beds was turned down in the evening with chocolates and the following day's weather report left on the pillows. The city felt very safe to wander around and the Metro train station was on the corner of the road which was very handy for further sights further afield. Tickets can be purchased at newsagents as well as in the train station and very cheap to travel. The only down side of the trip was the airline 'Alitalia', very unorganised and definately would not recommend them. Fly with another airline if you can. All in all. a fab fantastic trip, St Peters Basilica was mind blowing and an absolute must see. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sa23nike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just a short block from the Metro and the city center. The guest services were great. The room was extremeley small. It bathroom was beautiful but it was hard to pick up your shampoo from the floor without knocking the door open (and I am a 5'4 small woman. There is so much to do in Rome so the room was sufficient because it was only used to sleep in. The breakfast was nice and although the lobby was empty at the time we spent, it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: Guzzler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip to Rome, which turned into a leisure stay due to the location of the hotel - it was fantastic! We were very impressed with the staff in the hotel, they couldn't do enough for you. As stated on previous reviews, the rooms were fairly small but the bathroom was lovely with robes and slippers provided. The continental breakfast was good. We loved the extra touches like the weather forecast report and jelly sweets delivered to your room and not forgeting the fact the porter wouldn't let us touch our own cases!. There is easy access from the hotel to all the major attractions, you could walk to most places or pay 1 Euro on the bus for 70 minutes and you can travel across the beautiful city. When we return to Rome, we will definitely be staying here again - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MB40
Reviews.Content: River Palace Hotel has a great location within walking distance for Romes attractions. As previews reviews have said the rooms are not massive but this seems to be the same in City Hotels throughout Europe. We booked via Relaxabroad which had the Hotel on special offer so we were pleased with the price as Rome tends to be quite expensive. The breakfast was very good and we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyandKev
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and i stayed at this hotel at the beginning of November for a birthday suprise. I had e-mailed the hotel beforehand to check rates for an upgrade and was told i would be able to check when we arrived. We didnt need to, the room was great so kept it as it was and had a personal note from the manager wishing my boyfriend a happy birthday and a pleasent stay, Such a nice touch we thought. The turning down of the bed covers every night and the weather forecast for the following day just added to the nice touches. The staff were very helpful, nothing was any trouble for them, location is brilliant, 1 min walk from the nearest Metro and short walking distances from all the major sights. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if we ever go back we will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: maloney
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister and mother for a "girlie" weekend to Rome for the first time in late October. I had researched the hotel and finally decided to give it a go after reading the reviews posted on here. We were not disappointed. We negotiated our way from the airport to the Termini and then on the Metro(as suggested on an earlier review) with no problem and for a lot less money than a taxi would have been. The Hotel staff were extremely helpful, spoke perfect english and were most accomodating. We also ate in the hotel restaurant , with the promise that if we were not happy we would be refunded.The food was excellent , the manager a charming host and the whole experience a pleasant start to our weekend break. Breakfast was plentiful, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, pastries, cakes, breads, a selection of hot food, all fresh and homemade. Many reviews quote the room size as being "tiny". I would have to say that we found them perfectly ok, with a lovely marble bathroom. A nice touch was the turndown of the bed on an evening, with chocolates and the next days weather forecast! The hotel is situated in a great position for walking to all the sights. We walked to the colesseum, trevi fountain, pantheon, vatican and the spanish steps are only 10mins away. Make sure you visit the palazza navona for a cappucino and people watching!! We would definitely return to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wackychick20
Reviews.Content: In a good location situated at the top end of Rome, and within in walking distance of some of Romes main highlights. The room was clean and comfortable but again quite small. Not much space around the bed, and the bathroom was the same although is a BD really necessary?! Chocolates left on pillow at night with bed turned down which i thought was a nice touch. A wide choice at breakfast to set you up for a day out. Overall, this is a clean and comfortable hotel an ideal base for exploring Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms - No Really, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: smeyler
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of the River Palace prior to booking 5 nights for a recent trip to Rome. The location is great, and the hotel is clean and well appointed. The rooms, however, are really, really small. I read several reviews that mentioned room size and had brushed it off as feedback from people not used to European standard hotels. I have traveled extensively in Europe, and often hotels are much smaller than their N. American counterparts. That said, the rooms are tiny. Smallest hotel room I have ever seen. It was quite difficult to accomodate two people of normal size/stature. If you are tall and/or wide, forget it. There was barely room for suitcases/shopping bags, or anything else. The elevator situation, previously mentioned, is also a bit of a drag as it requires two separate elevators to reach the upper floors of the hotel, and the 2nd of these can only accomodate two, maybe three, people at a time. Based on experiences with other hotels in Rome, I would say look elsewhere unless you can't get a room. If you do end up here, know that other than the suites, your room will be very small, but will be clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel River Palace”
Reviews.Author: mjrogan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Palace with my older parents and college age son. We all loved it! The location is great; good access to all in Rome, but quiet at night. Some of the rooms are on the small side, but nicely furnished. Convenient to Piazza De Popola,with many restaurants, and also a few neighborhood eateries for a late night dinner. The staff was fantastic-very helpful. The large buffet breakfast with great coffee/cappucino makes a great start to the day. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best food and service we've had”
Reviews.Author: rsbuck
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 days and 2 nights for my husband's surprise 30th birthday present. We wanted somewhere close to all the sites as we didn't have long in Rome and wanted to travel mostly on foot - as many people had reccommended. TRANSFERS: I had pre booked transfers to the hotel from the airport which was a great move. The roads are very busy!!! and the journey was more than half an hour - I didn't fancy wasting time finding buses or the right underground .If you have spare pennies I'd book a taxi. HOTEL: The hotel itself was fantastic. It was decorated beautifully. The rooms were not huge, but are definately not small. The bathrooms were gorgeous , all marble - very luxurious - just give the hot water a few minutes to come through in the shower. The reception staff spoke impeccable english although we did try out a bit of our italian on them! They can recommend trips/ restaurants and their advice is very honest. ATTRACTIONS: The hotel was in a fantastic location. It takes a while to find your bearings but follow the map the receptionist gives you and you wont go wrong. We are quite fit I guess, but the walk to every attraction was never more than 30 mins away. Give yourself enough time to see everything though - the Vatican and sistine chapel ( this is INSIDE the museum) took us all day and we went on a Tuesday which was apparantly a good day to go . On a Wednesday the Pope does his service to the people in the square which is mega busy ( but you can pre book tickets online if you want to go to this ) We did a Rome by night coach trip which took about 2 /3 hours but was well worth it ( about 35 euros each) It gives you a quick look at everything then you can find your way back there the next day. The trevi fountain was gorgeous by night - you have to go . EATING OUT: The receptionist recommended us to eat in their own restaurant the first night- which we did - but wondered if it would be any good ( you know what hotel food is like over here sometimes). Boy were we glad we ate in the hotel - the food was the best we have ever had and we do like going out for dinner. The waiting staff were amazing , as was the wine they recommended to go with the meal. We ate like kings and for only £100 euros with wine- well spent money if you enjoy a decent meal. If you like all you can eat meal's however, this probably wouldn't be up your street. You can find some great places for pizza and pasta all over the place - an especially nice one opposite the Pantheon. Stand infront of the Pantheon and it is on your right, 2nd one up. You can eat outside and watch the world go by. It served amazing antipasti and huge pizzas. A beautiful city and an amazing hotel - wish we had booked 3 nights, still, there's always next time.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TerminalDecline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the river palace for 3 nights and found it to be a really pleasant hotel, just far enough away from the Piazza del Popolo to not get too much of the traffic noise (although staying on the 8th floor might have had something to do with that) Once the taxi driver had finished circling Rome in an ever decreasing spiral until he found the hotel in the evening, we checked in fairly quickly and decided to eat in the hotel. While the food, drink and service were excellent and beyond criticism I think that 90 euros for a main course, a dessert and a glass of wine each to be a little excessive. 9 euros for a coffee and a lager also seemed on the steep side. There are so many places to eat around the piazza (and a really nice Pizzeria at the bottom of the street from the hotel) that we didn't need to eat in the hotel restaraunt after that The rooms are immaculate, although small, but if that becomes a holiday ruining issue, then you're probably focusing on the wrong things and you should get out more... you are in rome after all! We found that all the sites are within walking distance (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Venezia, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Forum, Piazza Navona, Castel S. Angelo, Vatican) and also the shopping down the Via Del Corso. Although our feet ached at the end of each day we managed to get around all these places in 2 full days at a relaxed pace. There is the Flaminio metro station near the hotel, but we never needed to use it. PS if you fly using BA use the online check in - it saves a lot of time and queuing at the airport. For the flight back you can also check in online - Handily there is an internet cafe opposite the River Palace hotel So, in summation, we both had a really wonderful few days in Rome, we were very lucky with the weather for mid october and I would recommend the river palace as a really nice place to stay for all the important reasons

Reviews.Title: “Loved the River Palace”
Reviews.Author: walterlazymouse
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we picked The River Palace because it seemed to have good reveiws on this site. We were not to be disappointed. What lovely rooms, we had a junior suite as there were three of us, they were on the small side but the decor was stunning and the bathroom out of this world. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The linen and towels were changed every day and there was a chocolate left on the pillows every evening. The loung and bar area were also stunning in their decor and it was a lovely place to unwind after a days sight seeing and shopping. Very good location, we ate just down the road in a small cafe were the food was fantastic and very reasonable. When we return to Rome we will be returning to The River Palace..

Reviews.Title: “Made a great holiday better”
Reviews.Author: jnfrazer
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in which helped justify the rather high price. Got a free upgrade on arrival to a superior room which was beautiful and spotlessly cleaned each day. The contents of a small marble quarry went into the bathroom which added to the luxury feel. The little box of 2 chocolates waiting on your bed each evening was a nice touch too. The staff were very helpful and spoke perfect English. The hotel is located at the North end of the historic city centre and most of the sights are within easy walking distance. Only the sights on the southern end (Colosseum, Forum) may require some assistance but then the metro is at the bottom of the street anyway!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: chasbigspuds
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I spent 5 days at the River Palace following our wedding, it having been recommended to us by friends. I booked their Suite Borghese, with a roof terrace, and in the few weeks before our trip emailed them via their website to let them know we were on our honey moon. I can put my hand on my heart and say that both my wife and I were amazed at our stay. The suite was beautifully decorated and well appointed, the hotel staff were the most courteous I have ever come across and the service they offered was first class. Without asking they had laid on fruit and champagne for our arrival. I had also booked their transfer service to pick us up from the airport. It cost 60 euros and was worth every penny. I for one would not want to carry my bags around the public transport system of an unfamiliar city, their car was fantastic and made the journey trouble free. It was so good we used it to get back to the airport at the end of our stay. Their restaurant had just employed a new executive chef, and we dined there the night after the opening. The food was exquisite, and the service, once again was unbeatable. I had read a few reviews of the hotel on this site prior to leaving, and had become concerned about the issue of small rooms which seems to crop up once in a while. Let me put this issue to bed. The last comparable hotel room I stayed in was at the Barclay Intercontinental in New York. The room in New York was bigger. However, hotel rooms in America are, in my experience generally larger than anywhere else I have been, and the room at the River Palace was certainly big enough for us. It is just something you have to accept, that in Europe, especially in old cities hotels will be smaller than the purpose built monoliths elsewhere. The Hotel is situated just north of the Piazza Del Popolo, on the main route through the city, 30 minutes walk from the Vatican and about 40 minutes from the coliseum, we went everywhere on foot, and did so at an unhurried pace always aware that our hotel was well situated within easy walking distance of the furthest attractions we wanted to see. I implore you, if you are going to Rome stay here, if they haven't any rooms available, wait until they have.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magx52
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel to warm smiles and friendly helpful attitude by the girl on reception. The rooms are on the small side but very well appointed with an excellent turn down service that includes chocolates and a card advising of the following day weather forecast. Breakfast was excellent and the service in the restaurant superb. The only slight criticism is that the air conditioning is not quite efficient enough for the hot weather we experienced during our stay. All the main attractions are within walking distance, with the Metro service just yards from the hotel if you're not up to the excertion. There are a good selections of restaurants nearby and if you fancy an inexpensive meal with excellent food and nice surroundings, try the Chinese restaurant just down the street. Turn left out of the hotel and you'll find it about 200 yards away on the left hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Superfantastic”
Reviews.Author: happyK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, ok, rooms are a little small but they are perfectly comfortable and more than adequate. We arrived at the hotel and asked if any "free" upgrades were available, we were greeted by warm smiles and upgraded free of charge to an executive room. The main bonus of this was the fact that someone took the trouble to come to our room every evening to pull the curtains for us and leave us a mini box of godiva choccies on our bed - yum! Staff couldn't be more helpful, giving us directions, restaurant recommendations, maps - nothing was too much trouble for these people. The location is literally a minutes walk from the metro and if you are happy to use this to get around, you will save yourself a fair few euros. An example of this is when we left our coach from the hotel at Termni station, we immediately did the tourist thing and hailed a cab. This short journey to the hotel cost us 28 euros. The return journey to the same point via the metro cost us 2 euros!!! Be brave, its easy to use and much much cleaner than London underground. If I had to find a down-side to this hotel then I would go for the room service. The food is great, but its pricey and, on-top of it already being pricey, you are charged an 8 euro supplement. I think this is pretty standard in most hotels but it seriously is the only downside I can think of. Enjoy your stay here, enjoy the great location, enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 'little' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandi1080
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Palace at the beginning of July. It took us most of the first day to get there as there was a Taxi strike so we had to get a (very hot) bus from the airport which dropped us at Termini Station. From there we could of got the metro but they looked a little scarey so we decided to walk it! (mistake). It was extremely hot and alot further than we thought. However when we finally got there we were pleasently suprised. The lobby was very luxurious and the staff very helpful! as other people have mentioned the hotel is set out very strangely at not good for the disabled as the lifts are very small. The rooms were very nice, we stayed in a standard room and yes they are tiny but to be honest we didn't spend too much time in the rooms anyway. They were very well decorated and the bathroom was really lfancy! they were very quite and the beds were comfy. My only complaint about the room was the minibar was very expensive! There was a turn down service on a night, they left choc's and tomorrows weather forcast on your bed (nice touch) The breakfast left a bit to be desired but that didn't spoil it. The hotel bar was very expensive and closed before advertised (I would avoid it to be honest) again no big deal, there are more than enough places to drink. We were there for the world cup which was a brilliant night, we found some lovely bars and restaurants. Also. it wasn't as expensive as we'd been lead to believe. About what you'd expect to pay in any capital city. We got a taxi back to the airport arranged by the hotel. It was a nice service but be warned it was very expensive! Just a couple of things about Rome you need to know *Be careful on the roads, they are absolutely bonkers. They don't stop at the zebra's unless you walk out in front of them and then they just go around you! *The queue's for the colloseum and St Peter's are very long expect to be there for a good hour. Also, if you go to st Peter's remember to wear sensible clothing because it's so beautiful and it would be a shame to stand in a queue for an hour only to realise they won't let you in because your shoulders aren't covered and you miss out! *Don't go in July or August if you don't like the heat because it's very hot! (30 degrees plus) In a nutshell, we had a fab time in Rome and we would definately go back to the River Palace. If you have any questions please feel free to email me! Mandi

Reviews.Title: “A 4* Doll's House/Hamster Pen...”
Reviews.Author: BarbarellasHairpin
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was nice inside, but the size of the room spoiled it all for us. When we finally got there (taxi strike) it was decorated nicely and didnt look tatty, and staff seemed friendly, though not over efficient. It was very oddly laid out hotel and was almost a little surreal at times. The lift to the first floor would fit 4,but then any floor higher, the second lift would only fit two and therefore I'd not advise anyone with claustrophobia stayed here -the rooms included, not just the lift. Our room was clean and sumtously decorated, however unless you walked over the bed to get the bathroom, or showered and dressed whilst your partner was asleep there was no space whatsoever! The bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom. Although on the good side there was a turndown service nightly with Godiva chocs,weather forcast and fresh towells etc, and sweets and chocs in the lobby bar area, the rest was disappointing. At breakfast there were only approx 8 tables, so if there was a rush you may be waiting a long while or miss out. The drinks were as expected, terribly over-priced and the bar shut beofre the stated time every night, even for us residents..! Access to stairs was only available when maids were cleaning as they must have had the keys, The doors were not able to be opened from your side, so the lift down for a night out could take 20 mins if everybody left at once... Not my cup of tea. Was disappointing and the fact that the rooms are bigger in Travellodge, at the time of my stay Id've preferred that.

Reviews.Title: “quality”
Reviews.Author: susanhilton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the river Palace and enjoyed it so much i have booked for Feb. 2007. The rooms were on the small side but tastefully decorated as were the bathrooms. The service was excellent with towels and linen changed daily. The beds were turned down with chocolates left on the pillow. We ate at the cafe at the top of the street and i can recommend the sea food spagetti and a bottle of chianti. We got the airport bus for 1 euro and then the metro for 1 euro. Ensure that you validate your metro ticket by putting it through the turnstile. Be aware of pick pockets and if you wish to make a purchace then carry your passport with you if paying by card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: wbully
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from Rome staying at the River Palace. The hotel was excellent, beautiful decoration, spotlessly clean and a more than comfortable bed. On reading other reviews about small rooms, we found our room to be more than adequate (room 101 - facing the street). You could hear street noise, but what do you expect in the middle of Rome!! It all adds to the atmosphere. Location was excellent and we walked everywhere, Rome is so beautiful why spend your time on an underground and miss all the sights. You could easily walk to the Vatican in 20/25 minutes/Spanish Steps 10 minutes. At the Coliseum we picked up an English speaking guide who did a tour and would recommend doing this (email me if you need their name - I can't remember it, but have the brochure at home) as they also did a tour of Ancient Rome and the next day of the Vatican. It was very informative and we got a real insight into these places rather than walking around with a guide book. highly recommended. Food excellent - you can eat as expensive or cheap as you want. In the streets past Piazza Poppolo you can eat reasonably with 2 courses/beer for about 50 euros per couple. If you just want pizza and beer even cheaper. Overall Rome was excellent and would love to go back. We would definitely stay at the River Palace Hotel, excellent location, staff, rooms and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel box”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: We came upon this hotel through an American Airlines program. Another hotel they'd recommended in another town was very large, so we were startled upon seeing the size of the room. Then we realized, yes it was small, but like a jewel box. It's decoration and furnishings were if not new, close to it, nicely designed and importantly to us, the matress comfortable and firm. We found that the closet could accommodate both our suitcases and a travel bag, our hanging clothes and its drawers held the rest, including a safe. By getting the suitcases out of the way, we were able to walk around the bed. The room contained a small corner desk with chair, two night stands and refrig/bar. The continental breakfast was very good with meat, juice, eggs, fruit, rolls and breads, cheese, coffee, or cappuccino when ordered. The dining room staff was excellent. Because of its size, we had a short wait a couple mornings on couches with newspapers and magazines in the nearby lobby.The staff kept track of who was next. Overall, the hotel staff was excellent and helpful. The room and facilities were kept spotless. The hotel is away from the noise, one block from the Piazza del Popolo and subway. We took the subway and a train to the wonderful ruins of Rome's old port at Ostia Antica, about as far away as Rome's airport, but the trip was only 1 E each way. Other than a 2 or 3-stop subway trip to the Vatican, we walked to the sights other days. It's about a 15 minute-walk south to the Trevi Fountain. Hotel and staff quality were high on our visit. But know whether you can be comfortable in a small bedroom and tight shower. The space didn't become an issue as we spent full, walking days out and slept soundly in the room. We'd gladly return to the River Palace. One recommendation: They should add a small shelf to the shower for soap/ shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic location, helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerLA
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. It was very clean and seemed almost new. As usual in Rome the rooms were very small. We upgraded to a little larger room and our only complaint is that it was on the outside of the building and we heard the street car all night. The A/C was not turned on so it was pretty loud. We were told this is because the government gives specific dates when they can turn on the A/C. Our daughters had an inside courtyard room and it was very quiet with the windows open. The breakfast was excellent. The front desk made restaurant and gallery reservations for us along with getting us a minivan from and to the airport and train schedules to Pompeii. The hotel is about 100 yards from the subway and Piazza del Popollo and a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. We'll stay here again on our next visit.
